loans.name: Edgardo Fabian

texts.es:
Edgardo Fabian, vive con su cónyuge, en casa propia. Aproximadamente más de 05 años. Él cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Tiene una familia unida, vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Edgardo Fabian se dedica al servicio de reparación de celulares en el distrito de Cayaltí desde hace 05 años aproximadamente. El destino del préstamo es para la compra de accesorios para reparación de celulares (táctiles, baterías, cargadores,etc), lo que le permitirá podrá atender con una mejor calidad dándole el valor agregado a su servicio para diferenciarse de sus competidores, lo que en un corto plazo le permitirá captar un número mayor de clientes y por ende sus ingresos aumentarán, sus ganancias mejorarán y por consecuente su calidad de vida y la de su familia también.
texts.en:
Edgardo Fabian lives with his wife in a house they own.  He has good personal and professional references.  He has a close family and lives in a community where people work in commerce, farming, and livestock.  This community is located in the Cayalti district in the province of Chiclayo and Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Edgardo Fabian has worked repairing cell phones in the Cayalti district for about five years.  He will use this loan to purchase accessories to repair cell phones, including touch screens, batteries, chargers, and others.  This will allow him to provide a better quality of service to differentiate himself from his competitors.  In a short period of time, he will be able to gain a larger number of customers and increase his income.  His profits will improve and his family's quality of life will improve as a consequence.

loans.use: to purchase accessories to repair cell phones (touch screens, batteries, chargers, etc.)

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en: Madalena is 37 years old and married with three children. She is requesting a loan of $800 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as sugar, candles, cooking oils, sardines, biscuits, hair oils, sweets and other things to sell including soft drinks. She is taking this loan because she wants to add more items in her kiosk according to what people like. Madalena started to open her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of $500. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy sugar, candles, cooking oils, sardines, biscuits, hair oils, sweets and other things to sell including soft drinks.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal QORICHASKAS, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Eliana  tiene 34 años de edad  y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en su consultorio dental, la socia es odontóloga de profesión, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su trabajo  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia sale adelante.
La socia Eliana solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales como masillas e instrumentos para curar los dientes.
La socia Eliana se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Eliana is a member of the QORICHASKAS communal bank, that is located in Cusco province. 
Eliana is 34 years old and single. She alternates her daily activities with working in her dental office. She is an odontologist and has been practicing her profession for some time. Her job is going well thanks to the dedication she puts into her work very day. Eliana is a responsible and persevering person, and these qualities allow her to support herself.
Eliana is requesting a loan to buy materials such as dental putty and instruments used in dental care. 
Eliana is thankful for the credit offered and promises to comply with her payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy dental putty and instruments used in dental care.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Zulma, es una persona soltera, actualmente comparte la vivienda con dos sobrinos; con ayuda de su madre aprendió a elaborar diferentes piezas de loza como cantaros, comales, jarros, etc., ya con experiencia pudo fundar su propio negocio de comercialización de piezas de loza, además tiene una pupusería, su jornada de trabajo inicia a las ocho de la mañana y finaliza a las cinco de la tarde, al ejercer estas actividades genera recursos económicos para subsistir.
Requiere de un crédito para comprar nacazcol, arcilla y barro crudo para la elaboración de las piezas de loza, el resto lo utilizara para comprar maíz así tendrá materia prima para la venta de pupusas, espera tenar a su alcance los materiales que le permitan continuar teniendo con vida su negocio, mejor el servicio y calidad de sus productos para ganar nuevos clientes.
Zulma tiene como sueños diversificar más los productos que ofrece a sus clientes, mejorar la situación económica y tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Zulma is single and currently shares her home with two nephews.  With the help of her mother, she learned to make different pieces of pottery, including jugs, griddles, jars, and other items.  With this experience, she was able to start her own business selling pieces of pottery.  She also has a business selling pupusas [stuffed tortillas]. Her work day starts at 8:00am and ends at 5:00pm.  Doing this work generates enough money to survive.

She is requesting this loan to purchase nacazcol [a black dye], clay, and mud to make pieces of pottery.  She will use the rest of the loan to purchase corn, which is the main ingredient she needs for her pupusa sales.  She hopes to have the materials she needs to continue her work at her disposal.  She hopes to improve her service and the quality of her products to gain new customers.

Zulma dreams of offering her customers a larger variety of products, improving her financial situation, and having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase nacazcol [a black dye], clay, and mud to make pieces of pottery and to purchase corn to make pupusas.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam has been serving in the Navy for 13 years, and over the course of his service, he has been the unofficial photographer on his ship. Facing an endless barrage of compliments for his photos from shipmates, he recently decided to start his own photography business in San Diego. 

Valiant Photography offers high-quality services at an affordable price. Adam has already booked two weddings for October and is anticipating generating $2,000.  Additionally, Adam has already invested over $800 in the business.  

Adam will use his Kiva loan to upgrade his camera. This camera will be able to produce higher-quality pictures. 

With the help of generous Kiva lenders, veteran-owned businesses like Adam’s will continue to thrive in San Diego.

loans.use: to purchase a new camera.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Rarely will you meet someone as passionate about their business as Andrew is, and never will you find someone more passionate about whiteboards. He first got the idea from a former employer who put a piece of glass on their office wall as a whiteboard. Andrew then decided to make one for himself, which led to a friend seeing it and requesting he make one for him. The rest, as they say, is history.

An intensely charming and personable autodidact, Andrew personally uses his glass whiteboards for “mind-mapping,” a process he learned while working as an assistant for a respected local neuroscientist. He guarantees his products for the life of the wall they are attached to, and the glass and other raw materials he uses to make his products are often recycled, making his business an exemplar of the kind of “green” businesses that many hope will characterize the future of American commerce.

Like any other entrepreneur, Andrew has faced challenges starting his business, primarily with raising capital to pay for marketing and client outreach. He’s also faced challenges sourcing inputs and raw materials, which has led him to developing his own designs and solutions.

Andrew’s approach to business is characterized by facing difficulties head-on. As he’ll tell you, “If someone says ‘do you want to do something?’, say yes, and then figure it out.”

Andrew will use his Kiva loan to pay for marketing costs, including a video campaign and flyers. With the help of generous Kiva lenders, Andrew hopes to take his low-tech innovative idea to offices and schools across the country.

Visit his website at: http://glasswb.com

loans.use: to pay for marketing costs, including a video campaign and flyers.

loans.name: Gedion

texts.en:
Gedion is 67 years old and very responsible with his household obligations since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and four adult children. He is a farmer and at the same time engaged in buying coconut for copra and selling charcoal.

Gedion wants to increase sales and handle the business personally. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to purchase whole nuts to increase sales. Gedion is very thankful that he became a member of Paglaum MPC, and wishes to buy a delivery truck, so that he can continue to put bread on the table in his home.

loans.use: to purchase whole nuts to increase sales.

loans.name: Genevive

texts.en:
Genevive is 43 years old and lives in Tigbawan, Lazi, Siquijor. She is married with five children. From her desire to help her husband in supporting the family, she engaged in a retail business. She sells perfume, soap, lotion, and other items. She has had this business for five years now. 

Genevive thought of expanding and renovating their house and requested a loan to purchase housing materials such as cement, nails, and plywood. 

Genevive has been a member of PMPC for two years and religiously participates in the various programs and services offered by the Co-op. In the future, Genevive hopes to save more for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials such as cement, nails, and plywood.

loans.name: Nereza

texts.en:
Nereza signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Nereza has been able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. 

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
Maximo tiene 61 años de edad, su estado civil es viudo. Tiene casa propia, cuenta con servicios públicos (agua y luz). Maximo vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú. La comunidad es pequeña los pobladores se dedican a la crianza de ganado vacuno y al comercio de plátano.

La actividad que desarrolla Maximo es a criar ganado vacuno, además se dedica a la producción y comercialización de plátano. Cliente tiene varios años residiendo en la zona. El crédito será destinado para el comprar abono para sus plantas de plátano ya que él cuenta con 2 has en producción y ademas desea invertir en la compra de un motor para rebombear agua del río para su cultivo, de esta forma poder obtener un producto de calidad y poder venderlo a un mejor precio en el mercado, lo que le generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maximo is a 61 year old widower. He has his own home which has public services (water and electricity).  Maximo lives in the district of Buenos Aires, Morropón province, Piura region of the north coast of Peru. It is a small community whose population makes a living in cattle raising and the banana trade.

The activity that Maximo is involved in is cattle raising. He also makes a living in the production and marketing of bananas. He has been living in the area for several years. 

The loan will be put towards the purchase of fertilizer for his banana plants given that he already has 2 hectares in production. In addition, he would like to invest in the purchase of an engine to repump water from the river for his cultivation, and in this way obtain a quality product and be able to sell it at a better price in the market. This will generate better income and profits, and consequently, an improvement in his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for planting bananas and an engine to pump water from the river.

loans.name: Mayra Alejandra

texts.es:
Mayra Alejandra tiene 23 años, su estado civil es conviviente. Ella es muy conocida en el medio, por prestar servicio en elaboración y venta de comidas al paso. Vive en casa familiar con 02 hijos de 06 y 01 años respectivamente, hijo de 06 años estudia en colegio nacional de la zona; su cónyuge se dedica a trabajar como peón agrícola por zona de residencia y alrededores. Su familia es muy unida. Vive en una comunidad habitada por gente amable y respetuosa, que se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Mayra Alejandra se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida al paso como chicharrones, papa rellena, entre otros, desde hace más de 02 años aproximadamente. Ella necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de una cocina más grande, ollas y otros instrumentos que le permitan mejorar la calidad de producción de su producto y esto a su vez le permitan aumentar la cantidad del mismo, dado que su demanda ha crecido y ella desea este préstamo para poder atender a todo su publico consumidor con mejores instrumentos que por ende le permitirán tener un mejor producto, con lo cual podría elaborar más cantidad de comida para la venta, generando esto mayor ingresos a su unidad familiar, mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mayra Alejandra is 23 years old and married.  She is very well known in her area for making and selling food on foot.  She lives in her family home with her two children, who are 6 and 1 years old.  Her six year old studies at the national school in her area.  Her husband works as a farm worker in their area and those nearby.  Her family is very united.  She lives in a community inhabited by kind and respectful people who work in commerce, agriculture, and livestock.  Her community is located in the Cayalti district, Chiclayo province, and Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Mayra Alejandra has worked for two years making and selling food on foot, including chicharrones, stuffed potatoes, and others.  She needs this loan to purchase a larger stove, pans, and other tools that will allow her to improve the quality of her food production and increase the quantity that she can make.  The demand for her products has risen and this loan will help her meet her customers' needs with better products.  She will have better products that she can make in larger quantities to sell, which will generate more income for her family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a larger stove, pans, and other tools.

loans.name: Felizardo

texts.es:
Felizardo tiene 47 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge, tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad, dedicado a la agricultura cultivando café actividad que desarrolla por más de 15 años, la casa de Felizardo se encuentra en el distrito de Callacyuc, provincia y región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Felizardo se dedica al Cultivo de café, desde hace 15 años en el Caserío vista alegre. Él necesita del crédito para la compra de abonos para su terreno de cultivo. Con la inversión logrará mejores rendimientos en su cultivo. Felizardo posee experiencia en el negocio. Y con el préstamo podrá obtener una buena cosecha lo que le permitirá a su vez obtener un producto de calidad el cual podrá venderlo q un buen precio, lo que en corto plazo le generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Felizardo is 47 years old, and he lives with his wife and his 2 dependent children.  He is a farmer who cultivates coffee, an activity that he has been doing for more than 15 years.  Felizardo's home is located in the Callacyuc district, in the province and region of Cajamarca in the northern highlands of Peru.  People in his community mainly work in agriculture, livestock production, and commerce.

Felizardo has been cultivating coffee in his rural settlement, called "Vista Alegre," for 15 years.  He needs a loan to buy organic fertilizer for his fields.  With this investment, he will be able to get a better harvest.  Felizardo has experience in his business, and with this loan he will be able to have a good harvest, enabling him to obtain a quality product that he will be able to sell at a good price.  In the near term, he will generate more income and more profits, enabling him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet, 49 years old, lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental with her husband and two school-age children. Her husband is a construction worker. 

Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through her small sari-sari store. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in February of 2012. She became a MIGS (member in good standing) member, which is why she has received loans several times already. 

Now, she is applying for 10,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store to increase stock and sales. She will use her profit for their daily consumption and set aside some savings. 

She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store to increase stock and sales.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is a widow with five adult children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 15 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially for the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already availed herself of loans previously to purchase stock and now she is re-applying for a loan to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store to increase her stock.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store to increase her stock

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 60 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children now at their adult age. 

Leonila has been earning a living from a snack vending business, particularly puto and hotcake, for more than 35 years already. Leonila earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing additional raw ingredients such as malagkit rice, flour, sugar, margarine, oil, and baking powder for her puto and hotcake baking business. 

Leonila has been a member of PMPC for ten years. In the future, she hopes to have a little stall for her snack vending business.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients such as malagkit rice, flour, sugar, margarine, oil, and baking powder for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Lucelina

texts.es:
Lucelina tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Lucelina se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como gallos, gallinas, pollos, etc; con más de 15 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para compra de un número mayor de animales, y así poder diversificar y aumentar su stock; dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Lucelina piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona, para que en un corto plazo mejore sus ingresos, aumenten sus ganancias y por ende mejore su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucelina is 46 years old and a single mother to two children. She lives with her family in a rural area in the Oyotún district, a province of Chiclayo located in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. Her community mainly works in farming, cattle and business. 

Lucelina raises and sells animals such as roosters, hens, chickens, etc. She has 15 years of experience in this business, which she runs from the back of her house. 

Lucelina is applying for a loan to buy more animals so she can diversify and increase her stock. This investment will help her to have a greater variety and productivity in her animals which will make a big impact on her business. 

Lucelina would like to increase her stock of animals so that she can cater to the different tastes and needs of the customers in her area. This will allow her to increase her income in a short time period, better her earnings and in the end improve her and her children's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals to diversify and increase her stock

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan is 26 years. He is married, and together with his wife they have been blessed with two children who are under five years old. His spouse helps provide additional income for the family.

Dan runs a retail business, which he has operated for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 45,000. He has requested for his second loan of KES 30,000 with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to add more assorted electronic spare parts for sale  

With the anticipated profits, Dan will be able to expand his business and improve his family's living standards. He successfully repaid his previous loans. His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to add more assorted spare parts

loans.name: Yovan

texts.en:
Yovan lives in Masindi-Uganda. He operates a hardware shop. He does farming to  get enough income to cater for the family needs. He wishes to be self-reliant. He wants a loan to buy nails, ropes, and pangas.

He is however challenged by competition.

He wants a loan to to buy nails, ropes, and knives to sell.

loans.use: to buy nails, ropes, knives to sell.

loans.name: Angélica María

texts.es:
Angélica de 34 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato y está casada, su esposo es agricultor y motorista, tiene una hija de 15 años de edad que estudia en la escuela. 

Angélica se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde y cerdos, lo que le ha permitido apoyar a su esposo con otra fuente de ingresos para la familia. También trabaja en la venta de productos de lencería lo cual lo hace por las tardes, generalmente luego de hacer los oficios del hogar. 

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar cuatro cerdos, comprará concentrado para alimentar a los pollos ya que tambien tiene pollos de engorde, y el resto lo necesita para comprar lámina para mejorar el techo de su vivienda.

Ella sueña con mejorar la granja de pollos y de cerdos, y así obtener mas ingresos para la familia y darle mejor calidad de vida a su hija, además quiere seguir apoyando en los estudios a su hija para que se supere y se convierta en una profesional en el futuro.
texts.en:
Angélica is 34 years old and studied through high school. She is married and her husband is a farmer and vehicle driver. They have a 15-year-old daughter who is in school.

Angélica raises chickens and pigs for fattening, which enables her to support her husband by providing another source of income for their family. She also works by selling lingerie products in the afternoons, generally after she is done with the household chores.

Angélica needs this loan to buy four pigs, concentrated feed for her chickens, and the remainder will be used to buy metal sheets for repairing the roof of her house. She dreams of improving her pig and poultry farm so that she can generate more income for her family and provide a better quality of life for her daughter. In addition, she wants to continue supporting her daughter’s studies so that she can succeed and become a professional in the future.

loans.use: to buy four pigs, concentrated feed for her chickens, and metal sheets for repairing the roof of her house.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 42-year-old married man with one child living in Masindi, Uganda. 

John deals in brick laying. He started the business to cater for the family's needs since the salary alone was not enough. He has dreams of educating his children to university, but he is challenged with inadequate capital to boost his business. He needs a loan to buy brick laying materials such as firewood and also pay for labour.

loans.use: to buy brick-laying materials.

loans.name: Patricia Sarai

texts.es:
Patricia, tiene una pupusería, la cual fue fundada hace 2 años, la atiende en un horario de 2:00 p.m. a 8:00 p.m. en la zona está ganando popularidad, está actividad se la enseño su madre; ella es casada, tiene una hija de 3 años de edad, todos viven juntos.
Con el financiamiento se comprara maíz, cal, quesillo, chicharrón, bebidas, chocolate, café, tomates, etc., de esta manera elabora la venta de pupusas sin ningún contratiempo, dará a sus clientes un buen servicio y espera tener mejores ingresos.
Entre las aspiraciones de Patricia está seguir ampliado su  negocio, cancelar la deuda, mejorar la calidad de vida familiar y ofrecer a su hija un  mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Patricia runs a pupusa business which she started two years ago. She works there from 2pm until 8pm and she is gaining popularity in her area. Her mother taught her how to run the business. Patricia is married, has a three year old daughter and lives together with her family.

With this loan Patricia will buy corn, limes, cheese, pork rind, drinks, chocolate, coffee, tomatoes, etc. so that she can sell her pupusas without a hitch, provide her customers with good service and hopefully have a better income. Some of Patricia's aspirations are to continue expanding her store, pay off her debt, improve her family's quality of life and offer her daughter a better future.

loans.use: to buy corn, limes, cheese, pork rind, drinks, chocolate, coffee, tomatoes, etc. so that she can sell her pupusas without a hitch

loans.name: Neydi Emeli

texts.es:
Neydi, es parte de una familia que tiene sueños e ilusiones de prosperar y desarrollarse como personas productivas en la sociedad, vive con su esposo y dos hijos; su negocio consiste en elaborar tortillas y pupusas para vender, dedica 8 horas del día para atender su negocio, ya tiene un mercado definido y experiencia para tener éxito.
Con el capital comprara maíz, harina, aceite, gas propano, aderezos, bebidas entre otros materiales para tener su negocio abastecido con la materia prima con la que elabora la venta, espera ahorrar con la inversión, tener mayores niveles de producción e ingresos que contribuirán a mejorar el estilo de vida familiar.
Los sueños de Neydi son cancelar lo más pronto posible su deuda, adquirir un local para ubicar su negocio y darle a su familia una vida más digna.
texts.en:
Neydi is part of a family that has dreams and visions of prospering and developing as productive members of society.  She lives with her husband and two children.  Her business consists of making tortillas and baked bread sandwiches to sell.   She works 8 hours per day at her business.  She already has a clientèle and the experience to have success.

With the capitol she will buy  corn, flour, oil, propane gas, sauces, drinks, and other materials to have her business stocked with the basic materials she'll use to make sales.  

She hopes to save up the loan and have greater levels of production and income that will contribute to a better family lifestyle.  Neyd's dreams are to pay off the loan as quickly as possible, find a place to locate her business,  and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn, flour, oil, propane gas, sauces, drinks, and other materials to have her business stocked with the basic materials she uses to make sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition costs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old; she is married and has one child. Her husband runs a small business. She hopes for a better life for her family, wants her grandchildren to get an education, dreams of improving her house structure and getting a full time job selling stoves and biomass pellets. She is very committed to her work and is very honest.

She has been doing business for four years. Her main line of business right now is selling stoves and pellets but she also sells cosmetics. Selling gets her to interact with a lot of people and this is what she enjoys the most about her business even if the process of teaching how to use the new products can be a challenge.
She feels replacing charcoal with biomass pellets for cooking is important because it is a solution to saving forests. It is also an easier fuel to use and she is able to make an income from this business. She also feels empowered.

loans.use: to pay for a stock of improved cookstoves and biomass pellets to sell

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

She provides outside catering. Allen cooks food for different functions like weddings and parties. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for five years. She has requested a loan of UGX 900,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy serving dishes and sauce pans. Her major challenges include seasonality. 

Her goal and aspiration is to build a residential house. She rents a house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy serving dishes and sauce pans for her catering business

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
75% of Kenyan population directly depends on small-scale farming for their livelihood in the rural areas. The farming individuals are commonly elderly people between the ages of 45-65 years. However, Jeniffer has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. At the age of 35 years, she is a proud owner of a small ¼ acre of land.She is very kind, loving, and charming. She is based in Kapsoiyo, a remote village in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. Jeniffer also owns a dairy cow.

She is happily married, and has four children that depend on her for the basic needs. For the past 12 years, she has been involved in mixed farming on her small piece of land. Her sources of income are milk selling, eggs selling, crops and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves poultry farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about poultry farming, her response was “feeding my poultry.” She sells eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and, because of high quality eggs, customers have been streaming into her compound and the demand has been overwhelming. To be able to meet the demand, she is requesting a loan to buy additional poultry. 

Through the loan she will buy quality breeds of poultry that have high productivity and hence satisfy the demand that is there. The increased income level will be used to improve her living conditions, and she plans on expanding her business to other towns. Other than increased profits, she will also benefit from poultry manure which will be used in her vegetable garden to increase productivity. Increased profits will make her business flourish, and hence provide a secure solid education system to her children.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy footwear and clothing to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for tuition and accommodation for her final year at medicine school

loans.name: Kerina

texts.en:
This is Kerina. She is a trader in Kisumu's local market, Kenya where she specializes in selling mangoes. She started selling mangoes in 2008 along the streets of Kisumu. Her business has grown steadily and has been able to educate her two children up to the University. As a single parent, the responsibility of taking care of her children has curtailed the growth of her business since most of the profits are withdrawn to cater for the family needs. 

Whereas she has always had the ambition of growing her business to sell a wide variety of fruits, raising the required capital has been a challenge. A loan from Kiva will support Kerina build a stall hence attract more customers and afford her comfort from the scorching sun of the open market. Subsequent loans will enable her grow the size of her business.

loans.use: to construct a stall for her mango selling business

loans.name: Violette

texts.en: Violette is 35 years old. She is married with three children between eight and five years old, all of whom go to school. She sells clothes and has been running this business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business, where his potential customers are town dwellers and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season when it becomes hard to operate. His dream is to purchase another motorcycle in the near future.

With the KES 50,000, he wants to service his motorcycle and purchase new spare parts. He decided to join Yehu because of the affordable interest rates

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and purchase new spare parts

loans.name: Morgan

texts.en:
Thisa is Morgan. He is a farmer in Muranga county, Kenya. He is a small scale farmer rearing goats, dairy cows and chicken. He has specialized in production of seedlings where he produces and sells seedlings of kale, cabbage, tomato, pepper, onion, spinach, and cucumber. From a humble start when he planted 50 grams of seeds in a single seedbed, Morgan has seen his business grow in reaps and bounds. So far he has sold thousands of seedlings to other farmers. 

The seedlings business has enabled him pay for upkeep and school fees for his children. Two of children are in the university, one in 3rd year and the other in second year. He has realized that the seedlings business can take him to greater heights. 

A loan from Kiva will support Morgan grow his business and enable him grow income to give his household a better life.

loans.use: to buy quality seeds, fertilizers and compost to expand his seedlings business

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and two are in school. She has one additional family member (grandmother). She is a tailor who operates her business from a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week.

She has requested a loan of UGX 1,700,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy spare parts for her sewing machine and materials for making new clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. She generates additional income through selling firewood.

Her goals and aspirations are to buy an electric sewing machine. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes and spare parts for her sewing machine

loans.name: Liliane

texts.en: Liliane is 30 years old. She is married with three children between 12 and 4 years old, all of whom go to school. She sells charcoal and has been selling in this business for two years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more firewood and charcoal to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 31-year-old married woman who adds additional income to their family. They are blessed with one child. Ruth has been operating a fruit and vegetable stall for a period of five years, earning an income of KES 5,000 at the end of every month.

Ruth is now servicing her first loan of KES 10,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to buy green vegetables, cabbages, oranges, mangoes and pineapples to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Ruth plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her child and hopes to become a successful businesswoman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy green vegetables, cabbages, oranges, mangoes and pineapples.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is asking for a second loan to buy more shoes to sell during this season of children going back to school. He hopes to expand his business into new markets and educate his children though he complains of high costs of goods and rain since he operates from an open place. He repaid successfully his previous loan.

The extra person in the photo is a fellow neighbor dealing in shoe selling since the market where they work from is just in the open.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Santos Aparicio

texts.es:
Santos, es parte de una familia integrada por su esposa y sus tres hijos, sus esfuerzos son enfocados en trabajar para salir adelante con su familia; tiene como fuente de ingresos un comedor y el destazo de cerdos, en sus inicios hace ya 5 años solamente tenía el puesto de destazo, con la buena administración de sus ganancias ha podido ampliar su negocio con la apertura de un comedor.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar cerdos para el destazo, granos básicos, verduras, aceite, condimentos, servilletas y otros materiales para elaborar los diferentes menús que ofrece en el comedor, espera tener un mejor inventario con el que su producción aumentara, podrá tener una mejor situación económica con la que responda al pago de la deuda y al mejoramiento de las circunstancias familiares.
Santos sueña con resarcir su deuda, ampliar su negocio y apoyar en sus hijos en estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Santos is part of a family made up of his wife and their three children. His efforts are focused on working to provide for his family. His sources of income are running a small restaurant and butchering pigs. In the beginning, five years ago, he only had a butchering stall; by managing his profits well, he has been able to expand his business with the opening of his restaurant.

He will use the loan to buy pigs to butcher, staple grains, vegetables, oil, condiments, napkins, and other materials for making the different dishes that he offers in his restaurant. He hopes that with a better inventory, his production will increase, enabling him to have a better financial situation with which to deal with paying his debt and improving his family's circumstances.

loans.use: to buy pigs to butcher, staple grains, vegetables, oil, condiments, napkins, and other materials for making the different dishes that he offers in his small restaurant

loans.name: Rwakyongo Uweso Group

texts.en:
Gloria is a member of Rwakyongo Uweso Group, which is comprised of five members, and they took a loan of UGX 4,600,000. 

Gloria is a resident of Rwoya, Ndere in Rukungiri. She is a single mother with three children who attend school. She depends on agriculture as her major source of income which she has done for over a period of 15 years. She joined the group to access financial assistance to boost her business. 

She took this loan to buy more seedlings and herbicide to increase her production and earn more income, so as to cater to her basic needs and take her children to school. She decided to join Rwakyogo Uweso Group to borrow since she could not stand alone and access financial assistance. 

Gloria and other group members thank UGAFODE Microfinance Limited for financial assistance which has improved their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and herbicide.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is grateful to have received a facility. He has been challenged by limited capital and lack of collateral which limited his growth. 

He will use the loan to buy a cow and veterinary drugs for his animals. He looks forward to having a large farm if he can increase his  finances.

loans.use: to buy a cow and veterinary drugs.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 29-year-old client who is married with two children and one dependent. He operates a clinic at a local trading center; a business he has done for two years. His major challenge is limited capital to serve the available market. So to overcome such a challenge, John joined Ugafode for financial assistance to expand his clinic and he took a loan of 4,000,000 UGX to add stock to his business including drugs, syringes, and more beds so as to be able to accommodate more patients. John hopes that with financial assistance from Ugafode, his business will expand and increase his income. He is happy and encourages Ugafode to continue supporting the rural community.

loans.use: To buy medical equipment and drugs for his clinic

loans.name: Ekome Feemo Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Ekome Feemo which is comprised of six hardworking women. They sell stationery, eggs, cloth, foodstuffs, slippers, and beef. 

Ida is 47 years old, married, and lives in the town of Chorkor in the greater Accra region of Ghana. For the past 12 years, she has been working hard selling eggs. To help expand her business, Ida has requested a loan from ID Ghana to buy 10 crates of eggs to sell to customers. 

This loan will help her to generate greater profits so that she can pay school fees for her children and also take care of her home. The members of the group will hold each other responsible for repaying the loan. 

Ida hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 10 crates of eggs.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon raises and trades cattle to maximize his profit. He realized a need  among the farmers and decided to buying cattle from them to make a profit because he has a chance to buy cheaply.  He was however challenged by limited capital, a challenge he thinks will soon be history once he gets funding. 

He is grateful for the financial support and the vision of the kiva  lenders in helping people out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Remigia

texts.en:
Remigia lives in Ermera. She is married, but she has no children. She has been involved in business activities for a year, using her own working capital of USD 600. 

Now, Remigia is requesting a loan of USD 800 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to add more items to sell in her kiosk, such as seasoning, aqua, shampoo, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, biscuits, and other things. 

Remigia is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she hopes it can help to improve the management of her business. With this loan, her income can be increased and she can open a larger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy seasoning, aqua, shampoo, cooking oil, sugar,  noodles, biscuits, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Virgencita De Concepcion Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Virgencita de Concepcion” consists of eleven dedicated ladies who are starting their second loan cycle with Friendship Bridge and the very first one through KIVA. The women’s average age is 30 years.  They are determined to eliminate poverty, empower themselves, and create more prosperous lives for themselves and their families. 

Ana is a 30-year-old member of the Trust Bank group and about to begin her first loan cycle. She is both nervous and excited about this big step that she is about to take. She is focused on increasing her income to provide the basic necessities for her two children and help them to receive an education. Ana sells sandals in a variety of sizes, colors, and designs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory as her business is becoming increasingly popular. Ana travels three times each week to different nearby markets in order to increase sales.

She is a good example of a hardworking woman who has established a small business with much effort and sacrifice and is beginning to realize some benefits.

In addition to the financial capital that the women of the Trust Bank “Virgen de Concepción receive, they also participate in monthly educational trainings at their meetings. A Friendship Bridge Trust Bank Officer facilitates these trainings and topics like self-esteem and empowerment, decision making and leadership as well as children’s education are discussed. The ladies also learn how to manage their small loans with information about effective business practices. Additional subjects include hygiene, health and the use of medicinal plants. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of loans and education “Microcredit Plus”. 

The women of the Trust Bank thank KIVA investors for their valuable and much-appreciated support. This is a special opportunity for them as they cannot simply walk into a bank and request a loan. KIVA investors are wonderful partners in this effort! Thank you!

loans.use: to increase her shoe inventory .

loans.name: Los Celajes Group

texts.en:
Quiché, meaning “many trees”, was the name of pre-conquest Guatemala and was derived from the forested landscape of the area. The Quichés have left one of the few indigenous documents to describe their history before the Conquest. The “Popol Vuh”, the sacred book of the Quiché nation, was written in the Quiché language using the Roman alphabet a few years after the Conquest. It tells of the creation of the world and of the wanderings of the ancestors of these proud people. It is reminiscent of the Christian Bible. Quiché or Santa Cruz del Quiché is the name given to a busy and populated municipality in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. 

With a desire to create and sustain or grow their small businesses, nine women have gathered together in Quiché to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Los Celajes”. Their ultimate goals are to join with their husbands to generate enough income to support their families and see their children complete their formal education. Their businesses include commercial sales of clothing, cosmetics, sausages, and snacks. 

Otilia is 52 years old and leader of the Trust Bank group. She is single and has one son. Otilia has two businesses that she started a few years ago: the sale of snacks and the fabrication and sale of aprons. She is requesting a loan from Friendship Bridge to add an additional business - the purchase of clothing in bulk for resale. She also wants to buy thread and fabric for her apron business, as well as ingredients for her snack sales.

The ladies of “Los Celajes” Trust Bank not only need financial capital in the form of loans but also new educational tools. They receive these new tools in the form of educational seminars at their monthly meetings. Some of the topics covered include nutrition, health and hygiene as well as the use of medicinal plants. The women also learn about self-esteem. They learn to manage their loans with information about business planning, budgeting, accounting, marketing and customer service. Friendship Bridge calls this valuable combination of education and loans “Microcredit Plus”.

KIVA investors are greatly valued by the women of the Trust Bank for their generosity and kindness in funding these much needed loans. We look forward to reporting on the progress of Otilia and her friends in the Trust Bank “Los Celajes”. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: to purchase bulk quantities of clothing.

location.town: Santa Cruz del Quiche, El Quiche

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paving bricks, cement, sand and gravel to lay bricks on the floor of her home

loans.name: Sumber Bunga Group

texts.en:
The Sumber Bunga group will repay their loans from MUK after they sell their pigs. During the maintenance period, they did not encounter any problems. Pigs can grow healthy if they avoid attack by disease. That's because all the members are very attentive in caring for pigs. Cages are cleaned every morning and pigs are given nutritious food.
Wayan had three pigs she sold to repay the loan. She received enough profit to save and provide for her family. Wayan has suggestions for group loans, the loan amount to be increased and the interest derived. She remains grateful for what she gets. The pig program has been shown to support family income. One member resigned because she moved to town with her family and was replaced by a new member.

From the Sumber Bunga group's new loan of 15,000,000 IDR, each member receives 1,500,000 IDR. This loan will focus on purchasing superior piglets and feed.
With her loan, Wayan will purchase a sow. She hopes that over the next five months, the pig will grow fast and give birth to many piglets. Her husband helps her business by finding a traditional feed, such as banana leaves, from his garden. With this business, she hopes she can save and renovate her kitchen.

Two members are not pictured because they attended a religious ceremony at the temple.

loans.use: to purchase a sow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings, noodles and assorted candies to resell

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
African mothers face high challenges in their daily life, mostly cultural and economical. Away from taking care of the family, they are also involved in finding family bread to support their husband. For five years now, the involvement of working women in Tanzania has increased higher than at any period. The main drivers have been hard living conditions and improved access to education and micro-lending institutions.

Mwajuma is an African mother who is a divorcee for six years now. She is 34 years old and taking care of her three children, two of whom attend school. She runs several businesses as a way to sustain her family needs. A genge (food stall) selling fruits, vegetables and charcoal is her first business. She also sells fabrics on credit door-to-door, receiving payments at the end of the month. She runs these business with the assistance of her daughter who is at home. She starts working from 7am-6pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her twelve credit request.  She will use it to invest in a new business in which she is interested. She wants to start a secondhand clothing business by purchasing one bundle of clothes. Mwajuma used the previous credits, all of which were repaid successfully, to open a genge (food stall) and fabrics businesses. She used the credits well. Her desire is to build a house for her family and to be well in life. 

Mwajuma is so thankful for Kiva's support and for those who keep supporting Kiva's borrowers. She will be accountable for paying back the credit.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of cloth.

loans.name: Momela Group

texts.en:
Merina is in her late thirties and is married, with two sons who are in school. She has been running two projects, a mamalishe (inexpensive 'fast food') and a genge (food stall) business for twelve years now. She operates her business from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. per working day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Merina's fifteenth loan request, which she will use to buy fruits and vegetables for her genge. She used the previous loans to buy cooking ingredients (rice, cooking oil, maize flour, baking flour, and others) and to start the genge business. 

Merina has successfully repaid all of her previous loans. She used the increased income to cover school fees and household expenses. She also used the money to buy a mattress, TV, radio, saucepans for her business, and a plot of land. 

She dreams of building her own house. She will share this loan with her loan group "Momela", which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for her food stall.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 27 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with one child. She sells clothes and has been in the business for three years. Her spouse also provides additional income. 

She will be using this loan to pay school fees for her child. She will use the anticipated profits to cater for the family basic needs. 

This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to have a successful business and educate her child.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as trustworthy. She operates a retail shop where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a business-friendly area and her primary customers are locals.

Miriam states that her biggest business challenge is lack of sufficient working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 56 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for 6 years and requests 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo, assorted biscuits, sugar, and soap to sell.  She earns additional income from pre-paid mobile loads.

Corazon has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF.   She aspires to save enough money to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, assorted biscuits, sugar, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeanette is 30 years old. She is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 8. She has a shop and has been selling for 10 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more rice, sugar and cooking oil for resale. The profits from the business will be used for the family's welfare and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is married and aged 34 years. He is living in a rural area with his family. He is a businessman who deals in coffee farming. He has an additional income from cattle fattening. He started this business in 2006.

He works six days a week, and he started this business because he needed a seasonal business that would earn him more income. He has acquired this loan in order to clear the bush in the plantation and buy fertilizers, especially inorganic, to boost the fertility of the plantation. He has hopes to use the money from coffee to buy more cows for fattening.

The challenges he faces are limited land for grazing and long drought seasons. He describes himself as a hardworking man and encourages lenders to provide funding for construction of valley dams.

loans.use: To clear the bush in his coffee plantation and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Maina

texts.en:
Maina is married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for his kids. 

For the past three years, he has operated a retail shop business selling to his neighbors and passersby. He mentioned seasonality and theft as his major challenges. Maina dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 100,000, he wants to purchase grains of maize, rice, beans, wheat, margarine, soaps and sugar to sell. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase grains of maize, rice, beans, wheat, margarine, soaps, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Meet Teresiah! She is married 40 years old small scale farmer in Kiambu, Kenya. He resides in the rural village and comes from a humble background. With her husband, the task of bringing up her two children is daunting and she is forced to divide her time between doing household chores, taking care of her dairy cows and hawking second hand clothes in the neighborhood. The many responsibilities wear her out at the end of each day but her options are limited since she has to supplement the family income. 

Teresiah plans to grow her dairy farming to give her higher milk production and improved income by increasing her dairy cows. A loan from Kiva will support her acquire an extra dairy cow, increase milk production and income, hence live a better life.

With support from Kiva she will be able to establish herself as a prominent dairy farmer in her county.

loans.use: to purchase one more dairy cow to boost her milk selling business

loans.name: Sokhea

texts.en:
Sokhea is 38 years old. She lives in Khsach Kandal district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She has been married since 2002 and has two sons and two daughters.Two of her children attend school and other two are still too young for school.
Sokhea sells vegetables and fish by her motorbike in the village while her husband is a fisherman and Khmer folk dancer (Chhay Yam). Sokhea and her husband want to build a bathroom and connect electricity in their house so they decided to apply for a loan from MAXIMA. She hopes that her family will have comfortable and healthy facilities when they have a bathroom in their house and save some money from using electricity because using a battery is more expensive.

loans.use: To build a new bathroom and connect electricity in her house.

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim is 35 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children, with 3 of them go to school. For the past 3 years, Kassim has been working hard to manage his hardware shop, which sells hardware items. 

To help expand his business, Kassim has requested a loan of UGX 4,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hardware items for sale, and will help Kassim to generate greater profits, buy basic needs for the family, and pay his children's school fees. Kassim hopes that in the future he will be able to become a wholesaler. 

Kassim is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Kassim who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more hardware items for his shop.

loans.name: Jimson

texts.en: Jimson is a hard-working father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 47 years old and has four children. He aims to upgrade their status of living and give his children a better life. He is engaged in buying and reselling scrap materials within their community to generate additional income. He wants to continue and improve this business but he has limited capital. For this reason, he would like a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy more scrap materials to sell. Being a kind and hard working father, Jimson believes that someday, he will improve the business and as well as their status of living.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 37 years old, married and blessed with three children. She owns and manages a small retail store to help her husband in gaining income. She aimed to further improve the business but she has insufficient capital. For this reason,  she would like an additional loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more soft drinks, canned goods, assorted candies, beverages, cooking oil, noodles, biscuits and seasonings to resell. Through hard work and strong determination, she is hoping that she will make will her business more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, canned goods, assorted candies, beverages, cooking oil, noodles, biscuits and seasonings to resell

location.town: Brgy. Bone South, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Luz Yane

texts.es:
Luz Yane tiene 28 años, es soltera, muy conocida en el medio, por prestar servicio en la elaboración y venta de comidas al paso. Vive en casa familiar con 02 hijos de 09 y 03 años respectivamente, hijo de 09 años estudia en colegio particular de la zona, cliente lleva separada de cónyuge hace un año. Luz Yane cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su familia es muy unida. Vive en una comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Dicha comunidad está habitada por gente amable y respetuosa, que se dedicadan al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia.

Luz Yane se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida al paso como anticuchos,hamburguesas, ceviches,etc. desde hace más de 03 años aproximadamente. Ella necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de parrilla, utensilios y otros, con lo que pretende mejorar su servicio, para poder captar un número mayor de clientes, lo que le generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia también mejoraran.
texts.en:
Luz Yane is 28 years old and single. She is well-known in the area for preparing and selling meals to go. She lives in her family's house with two children who are nine and three years old. Her nine-year-old son studies at a local school. She has been separated from her spouse for one year. 

Luz Yane has good personal and professional references. Her family is very supportive. She lives in a community located in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast. This community is inhabited by friendly and respectful people who work in commerce, agriculture, and livestock production. 

For more than three years, Luz Yane has earned her living making and selling food to go, like "anticuchos" [meat kabobs], hamburgers, ceviche, etc. She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of a grill, utensils, and more, with which she intends to improve her service so that she can attract a greater number of customers. This will generate more income and better profits, so her quality of life and that of her family will also improve.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of a grill, utensils, and more, with which she intends to improve her service to attract more customers

loans.name: Morice

texts.en:
Morice is 58 years old, married, and blessed with four school-going children. He has been running a grocery store for the past six years where he sells various types of vegetables and fruits and earns a monthly income of 14,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 		
He has applied for his second loan of 5,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy assorted fruits and vegetables for sale.
 
Morice will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and in the future to open a bigger grocery shop.

loans.use: to buy assorted fruits and vegetables for his food stall.

loans.name: Den

texts.en:
Den is  a widowed mother with ten children who works hard to support her family. Three children attend school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and  earns additional income from fish vending.  Den is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a  fishing net, boxes, and gasoline for her fishing business.

Den has sustained her business activities through 12 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is  to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, boxes, and gasoline.

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en: Joanina lives in Ermera and she has three children. She is happy to do her activities. She said living in a town is very competitive in earning money. Looking for ways to earn money, Joanina came up with an idea to run a place to wash cars and motorcycles. She is applying for a loan of (USD) $1,200 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy materials to wash cars including machine tools, gasoline, kit shampoo, detergent and other materials. She started her business in 2004 with her own working capital of (USD) $1,000.

loans.use: To buy machine tools, gasoline, kit shampoo, detergent and other material used for washing cars and motorcycles.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a retail banana business for 10 years.

She requests 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.

In the future, Dolores would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Takondwa Group

texts.en:
Alinafe is 32 years old and married. She has two children who go to school and she also looks after a school-going orphan. She sells various goods such as sugar, salt, cooking oil and is requesting this loan to order the items that are not available in her shop such as biscuits, sweats, soap to attract more customers in her village. She is running her business to be economically empowered and to support her family.

Since she started accessing loans from Microloan Foundation she has seen herself making more profits and she has decided to start building a good house for her family. Alinafe has also managed to send her children to good schools and she is able to feed her family three meals a day. She believes that the training she received on ‘Business Management’ will help her to achieve what she wants from her shop.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her grocery shop

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 61-year-old married woman with six children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur.

She has bought and sold bananas for 10 years and requests 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.

In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase  bananas to sell.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 30 years old and married with one child who attends school. Joan works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a direct sales businss of Natasha, Avon, and MSE products for 5 years and requests 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a good stock of bananas and meet his customers’ demand.

loans.name: Lailani

texts.en:
Lailani works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a ready-to-wear clothing business for 23 years.

She requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shorts, pants, sandals, and blouses to sell.

In the future, Lailani would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shorts, pants, sandals, and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 39 years old and married with three children, two attend school.

She has earned a living growing rice for 4 years.  She earns additional income from direct selling of Natasha, Avon and MSE products. Marlyn is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to  build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nashiba

texts.en:
Nashiba is 27 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family and has run a retail dry goods business for 10 years. She requests 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase dry goods to sell.

Nashiba has borrowed and  repaid 11 loans from NWTF. She earns additional income selling dried coconut meat.

Nashiba aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a 40-year-old married woman with  ten children,  four children attend school.

She has grown  bananas, vegetables, and rice for 8 years. Nelia requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She has previously borrowed 6 times  from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nelia would like to build and expand her business and secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Milca

texts.en:
Milca is 57 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 4 adult children.
 
Milca has earned a living from snack vending for more than 18 years. Her  business made it possible for all of her children to finish college. 

Milca earns approximately 10,000.00 PHP each month doing this type of business. She had requested a loan to purchase a brand new generator set for business and household use. 

Milca has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Milca hopes to have a little stall for her puto processing business.

loans.use: to purchase a brand new generator set for her business and household use.

loans.name: Selma

texts.en:
Selma works hard to support her family. She is married and has sold bananas for 11 years.

Selma requests 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy bananas to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now requests another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Selma would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Aira

texts.en:
Aira is 30 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family and has run a charcoal  business for 4 years. She requests 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Aira has previously borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF. She  earns additional income from raising cows.

Aira aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen works hard to support her family of 5 children.

She has a general store  and earns additional income from farming coconut.  Belen is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to  purchase  canned goods, eggs, coffee, sugar, and soap for her general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now requests another loan to further build her businesses.

Belen has sustained her business activities through her loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, eggs, coffee, sugar, and soap.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 55 years old and lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 adult children.
 
Judith has earned a living as an employee in one of the NGO’s of her town for more than 8 years. She is receives support from her sons and a little income from their parcel of land. 

Judith earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP each month and has requested a loan to  pay the processing fees and other requirements for her two son's application to the Philippine National Police. Judith has been a member of PMPC for almost 3 years. 

In the future, Judith hopes to acquire additional land to add their family's income.

loans.use: to pay the processing fees.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 67-year-old married woman with 6 children.  They live in Anahaw Galas Dipolog City Zamboanga del Norte Phil. 

She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since 2008. She sells chickens,  fire wood, mineral water, and operates a sari-sari store. 

Elena requests 10,000.00 PHP to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy  chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials to put in a new roof

loans.name: Tien

texts.en:
Tien, 34, is married and has two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn an income running a shop, selling beverages in front of their house. 

Tien started this business five years ago. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater variety of beverages to sell.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy and sell beverages.

loans.name: Navruza

texts.ru: Навруза является одной из таких женщин, которая трудится упорно с раннего утра до позднего вечера во благо своей семьи. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина. Навруза родилась в 1983 году. Она заботливая мать 4 детей. Навруза уже более 10 лет самостоятельно введет бизнес и развевает этот бизнес. Она выращивает сельскохозяйственные продукты. Навруза в основном выращивает овощи как лук, морковь, капусту и т.п. Полученный урожай она продает на местном рынке. Муж Наврузы помогает ей введению бизнеса. Навруза использует для осуществления посева труд наемных рабочих. Она данное время обратилась за займом, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения, топлива и оплатить наемным рабочим. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7000 сомони с такой целью. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Navruza is one of those women who works hard for her family from early in the morning to late at night. She is a very hardworking woman. She was born in 1983 and is the caring mother of four children. Navruza has been running and expanding her own business for over ten years. She grows agricultural products, mainly vegetables such as onions, carrots, cabbage, and so forth. She sells her crops at the local market. Her husband helps her with the business and they hire workers to plant the crops. She is currently applying for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel and to pay the hired workers. She is asking for 7,000 somoni for this purpose. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and fuel and to pay for hired workers

loans.name: Anito

texts.en:
Anito is a married man with five children, who lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur with his family. To make a living, he had been operating his transportation services for more than twelve years, and it covers their daily expenditures. Aside from this, he had a rice farm, which is his main source of income.

Anito successfully repaid his previous loan used for vehicle repair, for he is earning well from these activities. Recently, he took a new loan for the purpose of buying new seedlings and organic fertilizer to have a more productive harvest. He wants to improve his farm to ensure a better source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new seedlings and organic fertilizer to have a more productive harvest.

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Ut is 43 years old and married. She has two sons and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a mechanical worker. She is running a shop, selling beverages.  

Ut intends to use her loan to buy beverages to sell. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy and sell soft drinks.

loans.name: Mavludakhon

texts.ru: Мавлудахон целеустремленная женщина. Она всегда хотела организовать свой бизнес. Итак, она решила реализовать свою мечту на реальность. Она хочет организовать бизнес птицеводством, то есть она будет покупать цыплят, выращивать и продавать кур. Она уже купила клетки и цыплят. Теперь она должна купить землю в сельской местности, чтобы выращивать цыплят. Ее муж будет помогать ей введению бизнеса. Она мать 3 детей. С полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 11000 сомони для покупки земли в сельской местности, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mavludakhon is a goal-oriented woman who has always wanted to start her own business. So, she decided to make her dream a reality. She wants to start a poultry business buying, raising, and selling chickens. She already bought the chickens and a chicken coop, but she needs to buy land in a rural area to raise them. Her husband will help her run the business. She is the mother of three children and plans to use the profits from the loan to improve the family's living conditions. She applied for a loan of 11,000 somoni to buy land and establish her new business. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To buy land and start a new business

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 44 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been selling food, chicken and beverages to earn a living. 

She has been running her business for nine years. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying more food and beverages for selling to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages for selling from her stall.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора добрая женщина. Ей 41 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Она начала свою бизнес деятельность 10 лет назад. Тогда она очень нуждалась в деньгах для обеспечения семьи, так как ее муж не работал. Гулнора начала бизнес купле продажей мужской и женской обуви. Данное время она также продает женскую одежду. Она торгует на местном рынке. Гулнора тщательно изучает рынок и старается не отставать от развевающегося современного бизнеса. Она обратилась за займом в сумме 5000 сомони для покупки женской одежды для нового поздно осеннего сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Gulnora is a kind woman. She is 41 years old. She is married and raising two children. She launched her business 10 years ago. At that time, she badly needed funds to support her family since her husband was not working. Gulnora launched a business selling men’s and women’s  shoes.
