At present, she also sells women’s clothing. She sells at the local market. Gulnora carefully studies  customer demand and tries to keep up with current expectations. She has applied for a loan in the amount of 5,000 TJS to buy women’s clothing for the late fall [autumn] season. She is counting on your kindness and hoping for your compassion.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for the autumn season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of aluminum and glass to resell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn settled for a living in Zamboanga del Sur with her family. For more than seventeen years she has been earning an income from selling snacks in their village while her husband does farming. She used her revenue from this business in dealing with family expenditures and supporting her children's education costs. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying additional food and drinks to sell. To increase her sales she took a new loan recently to purchase more products like biscuits, pastries, soft drinks and raw ingredient to prepare food to sell in addition to her store. Improving her business is her main purpose as she wants to have a better income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products like biscuits, pastries, soft drinks and raw ingredient to prepare food to sell in addition to her store

loans.name: Jelfred

texts.en:
Jelfred is married with two children, living in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental with his family. He has a farm where he gets income for his family. While waiting for the season of harvest, Jelfred works on his transportation services for their daily expenditures. 

Jelfred became a member of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and has borrowed a loan to purchase organic fertilizer for his farm and a tire for his vehicle, used to commute between his farm and market. He wants to improve his farm to have a more productive harvest in order to send his children to school in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for his farm and a tire for his vehicle, used to commute between his farm and market.

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru: Чолпон успешно погасила предыдущий кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем инвесторам, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Чолпон есть 1 лошадь, 4 коровы, 1 теленок и 15 овец. Также на участке мерою 1,00 ГА она выращивает кукурузу. В целях дальнейшего развития бизнеса, Чолпон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи. В прошлом году Чолпон благодаря доходам от животноводства женила сына, теперь все средства она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, чтобы улучшить условия проживания ее семьи.
texts.en: Cholpon successfully paid off her last loan after using it for its intended purpose.  She is very grateful to Kiva and everyone who contributed to her loan.  Currently, Cholpon has a horse, four cows, a calf, and fifteen sheep on her farm, as well as a hectare of land for growing corn.  To further develop her business, she is seeking a loan of 125,000 som to buy cattle for fattening and resale.  Last year, thanks to the money she earned from raising livestock, Cholpon saw her son married, and now plans on investing all her extra money back into buying livestock so she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy additional livestock for fattening and subsequent resale

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en: Hoang would like to take a further loan to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages and coffee to satisfy her customers. Hoang's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages and coffee

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, 54, is married and has five children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband support their family by running a business selling bottled pure drinking water and renting out party equipment.

Anh has been running this business for seven years.  She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more drinking water to sell and party equipment to rent out, to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy drinking water for selling and party equipment items for renting out.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam, 38, is single and lives in Ho Chi Minh city. She earns an income through running a general store in front of her house. 

Tam started this business nineteen years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt, and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

Tam hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials. Yen's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials

loans.name: Quang

texts.en: Quang is requesting a new loan to buy fabric and sewing tools for making clothes. Quang's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing tools for making clothes.

loans.name: Juvita

texts.en:
Juvita opened a furniture shop in 2010. She started her business with her own working capital of $1,000. She also cultivates animals, like pigs and dogs. Juvita is married and she has no children. Her husband is a carpenter. Juvita's furniture shop is in her house. 

Juvita is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional materials, including wood boards, wood beams, wood glue, chisels, nails, and other materials. She is happy because, with this loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business bigger in the future.

loans.use: To buy wood boards, wood beams, wood glue, chisels, nails, and other materials.

loans.name: Davlatmo

texts.ru: Давлатмо одна из жителей не большого городка Куляба. Ей 54 года. Она мать пятерых детей. У Давлатмо большая и дружная семья. Она живет вместе с мужем, с двумя сыновьями, тремя дочками и двумя невестками. В семье Давлатмо царит гармония и уважения друг другу, что очень важно для такой семьи. Ее муж строитель. Давлатмо 30 лет своей жизни посвятила в школе. Она работает преподавателем в средней школе. Давлатмо не забыла и о своих увлечениях и интересах к швейному ремеслу. Давлатмо больше трех лет берет заказы на шитье национальной женской одежды, на дому. Она успевает работать и в школе и дома. Сейчас она просит ей помочь купить компьютерную швейную машинку, которая на много облегчит ее работу. Из-за нехватки денег она не смогла самостоятельно совершить покупку. Давлатмо надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Davlatmo is a resident of the large town of Kulob. She is 54 and the mother of five children. She has a large, close-knit family and lives with her husband, two sons, three daughters, and two daughters-in-law. Harmony and mutual respect prevail in Davlatmo's family, which is very important for them. Her husband is a construction worker and Davlatmo has devoted thirty years of her life to the high school where she teaches. She has not forgotten about her hobby and interest in sewing, either. She has been taking orders for traditional dresses from home for over three years. She is able to work at the school and at home. Now she is asking for help to buy a computerized sewing machine that will really help with her work. She cannot make the purchase on her own due to lack of money. Davlatmo hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine

loans.name: Isroiljon

texts.ru: Исроилчон родился в 1994 году. Он целеустремленный человек. Исроилчон является студентом 1 курса Медицинского колледжа. Он изучает фармацевтику. Исроилчон очень рад, что в этом году смог поступить в колледж. Он долго шел к своей цели. После окончания средней школы не имел возможности поступить в университет. Он уехал в Российскую Федерацию на заработки. Он накопил деньги и возвратился на Родину. Свои деньги он использовал для улучшения домохозяйства. Он данное время нуждается в финансовой поддержке, чтобы оплатить за учебный договор. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Isroiljon was born in 1994. He is a goal-oriented person. He is  in his first year of studies at the Medical College. He is studying Pharmaceutics. Isroiljon is really glad to be able to enter college this year. It took him a long time to reach this goal. When he graduated from secondary school, university studies were out of his reach, so he left for the Russian Federation as a work migrant. Eventually he saved some money and returned home. He has used his money for household needs. At present Isroiljon needs financial support in order to pay his tuition. He is counting on your kindness and hopes for your compassion.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Asociacion De Productores Agropecuarios Roncohuasi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ASOCIACION DE PRODUCTORES AGROPECUARIOS RONCOHUASI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Limatambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Norma ella es soltera y tiene 46 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras, la socia también vende zanahorias, tomates y pepinos, la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las verduras, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las verduras.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cebollas, zanahorias y pepinos.

La socia que está pegada a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidió permiso por motivos de trabajo.
La socia que esta tapada con un circulo su rostro ya no pertenece al banco comunal Asociacion de Productores Agropecuarios Roncohuasi.

 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ponches, negocio de carpintería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank group called "ASOCIACION DE PRODUCTORES AGROPECUARIOS RONCOHUASI" [Roncohausi Farmer's Association]. This group is located in the district of Limatambo which belongs to the Province of Anta in the Department of Cusco.

Norma is a member of this group. She is single and 46 years old. She has three children. She works on her business of selling vegetables. She sells carrots, tomatoes, and cucumbers in her market stall. She works from 8 am until 5 pm. Norma has had this business for 7 years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell vegetables. She is requesting a loan to buy onions, carrots, and cucumbers.

The group member whose photo is attached to this group photo took her picture after the group meeting which she missed with permission in order to work.
The person whose face is covered with a circle does not belong to this group.

The other members are in the businesses of selling drinks, carpentry, running a grocery store, and a restaurant. 

Norma is grateful to those that are part of this dream through this platform. She will comply with the payment of her loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase onions, carrots, and cucumbers

loans.name: Jenely

texts.en:
Jenely is 53 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Jenely works very hard to provide for them.

Jenely runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, bread, and other groceries. 

In the future, Jenely would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 58 years old and married with four children, who are all in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Corazon runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Corazon has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marvin Roberto

texts.es:
Marvin, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar fóliales, abono y pagar mozos, para realizar los cultivos de maíz y frijol, así poder abastecer a su hogar y a sus clientes con granos básicos.
Marvin comenta que su negocio ha crecido con la ayuda del préstamo anterior, su nueva situación económica le da oportunidad de cubrir las necesidades familiares y cancelar parte de sus deudas. Actualmente uno de sus hijos esta trabajando y estudiando.
texts.en: Marvin needs to request a new loan to buy foliar spray, manure and pay workers to grow his corn and bean crops. Doing this he can supply his house and his clients with basic grains. Marvin comments that his business has grown with the help of the previous loan. His new economic situation provides him the opportunity to pay for the family's needs and pay off part of his debt. Currently one of his children is studying and working.

loans.use: to buy foliar spray, manure and pay for labor for his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Hanh's Group

texts.en:
Hanh is 34 years old and lives with her two children and husband. Her husband works as a fireman. For the past nine years, Hanh has been running a business selling clothes to earn an income to support her family. Hanh is the Group Leader of a six-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is in the third from the left wearing a dark blue flowered blouse. Each of the group members is requesting a loan to fund income-generating activities.

Hanh is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality and greater variety of clothes to restock her shop. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a better quality and greater variety of clothes to restock her shop

loans.name: Tuyen

texts.en: Tuyen is requesting a new loan to buy better quality food for her food stall. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. Tuyen hopes that her new loan will assist her in expanding the size of her food stall and increasing sales and that it will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase better quality food to sell

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep, 30, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income by running a business that rents out party equipment. 

Diep started this business seven years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of new bowls, chopsticks, chairs and tables to rent out.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new bowls, chopsticks, chairs and tables to rent out.

loans.name: Phuoc

texts.en:
Phuoc is 58 years old and is married with four children. Her husband supports the family through selling vegetarian food. She has been running a food stall selling fish and shrimp for 30 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Phuoc is requesting a loan to buy fish and shrimp and thereby expand and increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy and sell fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Cuong

texts.en: Cuong is requesting a new loan to buy washing tools and motorcycle parts to stock his store and serve more customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business, processing capacity, and sales. Cuong hopes that his new loan will assist him in expanding the size of his business and increasing his income and that it will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy washing tools and motorcycle parts to stock his store and serve more customers

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is a 45-year-old married woman. She has two children. Her husband works in a local company. Dung lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. For five years, she has operated a food stall to sell meals to people in their community.

Dung would like a loan to purchase new furniture, good-quality food and rice in bulk. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture, good-quality food and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Velasco Astete Group

texts.es:
La socia Edith pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE, el banco está ubicado  en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
 La socia  Edith continua trabajando  como docente en uno de los colegios de la zona, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia, este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio, siendo este un grupo que cumple dichas características.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de vivieres para su hogar y otros.
Las personas que salen con la cara tapada no pertenecen al banco comunal.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas. 
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de restaurante, tienda de abarrotes, elaboración de tortas, hospedaje, docentes.
texts.en:
Edith belongs to the VELASCO ASTETE communal bank, which is located in the Cusco province in the department of Cusco. Edith continues to work as a teacher in one of the high schools in the area. She is responsible and diligent, and this way she is able to bring her family forward.

This loan is part of one of the credit facilities from the Arariwa Association. It is called Credi Yapa, and this credit facility is provided to borrowers with good credit history. This group meets these characteristics. 

The member requests the loan to purchase supplies for her home and other things.

The people who appear in the photo with their faces covered do not belong to the communal bank. The members who appear in the attached photos requested permission to arrive to the meeting late due to work reasons. The member is grateful for the loan and promises to make payments on time.

The other members work in restaurants, grocery store, cake bakeries, hospitality and education.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her home and other things.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn has been helping her husband working on their own farm to make a living. She earns well from this business and was able to build a general store from her revenue. She had successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for purchasing fertilizer and organic pesticides for her farm. 

Jocelyn is now focused on managing her store, while her husband works on their farm. To increase her sales, she took a new loan recently to purchase additional grocery goods for her store. Hoping to earn more profits, she wants to improve her business and be able to provide a better education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods for her store

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 40 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Mary Jean has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as shampoo, canned goods, noodles, and other groceries.

Mary Jean has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as shampoo, canned goods, noodles, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jose Manrique

texts.es:
José, utilizo el préstamo anterior para mejorar las condiciones del su vehículo y hacer mejoras en su vivienda, ha establecido mejor la venta de plátanos al por mayor. El taller de estructuras metálicas ya no lo tiene debido a que no le estaba generando muchas ganancias y tomo la decisión de dedicarse a vender verduras. La familia se mantiene, sus ingresos no han variado mucho pero se mantiene optimista en continuar trabajando para lograr comprar un nuevo vehículo y construir su casa propia.
Requiere un nuevo financiamiento para comprar variedad de verduras, sobre todo plátanos al por mayor para luego distribuirlos a sus clientes, otra parte lo invertirá en comprar llantas nuevas y dar mantenimiento al motor de su vehículo.
texts.en:
José used the previous loan to improve the condition of his vehicle and to make improvements to his house.  He has better established his wholesale sale of bananas.  He no longer has the metal shop because it was not generating much income.  He decided to devote himself to selling produce.  

He is supporting his family, and his income has not changed much.  However, he stays optimistic about continuing to work in order to manage to buy a new vehicle and to build his own house.

He needs a new loan to buy a variety of produce, especially wholesale bananas to later distribute to his customers.  He will use the other part of the loan to buy new tires and to provide maintenance on the motor of his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy a variety of produce, especially wholesale bananas.

loans.name: Ijaz Hussain

texts.en:
Ijaz lives in Lahore. He is 45, married and a father of five children. He runs an auto repair shop, where he also sells spare parts to his customers. He is skilled at his work and is a hardworking and responsible person. 

In order to extend more services to his customers, he wants to buy more spare parts such as brake shoes, mud guards, brake levers, etc. Due to financial constraints, he is short of funds as most of his earnings are consumed in covering household expenses. He has therefore requested a loan to help him buy these items and improve his business. 

He is hopeful that Kiva lenders will give him full support so that he can carry out his business activities efficiently.

loans.use: to buy spare parts such as brake shoes, mud guards, brake levers, chains, and wheels.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat belongs to a poor family. She lives with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a blacksmith; he manufactures iron accessories used on house doors and windows. He has been providing door-to-door services to weld the broken accessories.

A few days ago, his welding machine stopped working due to overheating, and it needs to be replaced with a new one. He wants to buy a new welding machine but he does not have money due to a lot of household expenses.

Therefore, Ishrat requested a loan from BRAC, an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy a welding machine for manufacturing.

Ishrat thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine for her husband's welding business

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de l’habillement et de charbon.
Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur dix neuvième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente AMI, première personne de la gauche vers la droite est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de charbon de bois . Elle compte acheter 30 sacs de charbon à Falakono. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme group is composed of married women averaging 33 years, with three children. They all live in traditional families in the town of Diola, Diola Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell clothing and charcoal.The group members are on their ninth solidarity loan. With the goal of meeting very large customer demand, they have reached out to Soro Yiriwaso. 

Our client Ami, the first one standing from left to right, is illiterate. At present she works selling charcoal. She plans to buy 30 bags of charcoal in Falakono.
She sells retail, for cash, out of her home, to a mixed clientele. She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 35,000 West African francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
As one way of generating income, Fely runs a small retail store within the local community. This is her way of helping her husband to sustain the necessities of their family. She needs to acquire more stock of grocery items to sell, but she doesn't have enough capital.

For this reason, she would like to avail herself of a loan of PHP 18,000.00 to buy beverages, seasonings, soft drinks, snack foods, candies and laundry soaps to resell. She is hoping that someday she will make her business more profitable through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beverages, seasonings, soft drinks, snack foods, candies and laundry soaps to resell

location.town: Brgy. Bone North, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 53 years old and widowed. She is currently residing in a rural community. She buys and resells school supplies and grocery items within the public market. She aims to make her business profitable in order to meet the necessities of her family and save some for future emergencies. 

She wants to acquire more stock of the said products to resell, but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to avail herself of additional capital of PHP 50,000 from Kiva lenders to buy more stock of school supplies, toys, souvenirs, and rice within the public market. 

Having this financial assistance, Rebecca believes that she will increase her income and satisfy the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy more stock of school supplies, toys, souvenirs, and rice within the public market.

loans.name: Hermogenes

texts.es:
Hermogenes tiene 48 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, con su cónyuge y su hijo de 12 años de edad el cual cursa primaria en colegio nacional del distrito de Pucará. Hermogenes vive por más de 21 años en la parte rural de este distrito contando con servicios de agua y luz. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Hermogenes es el servicio de labores agrícolas como arado y dragueo de terrenos agrícolas, cuenta con clientela reconocida de la zona. Hermogenes cuenta con 20 años de antigüedad en el rubro. El destino del crédito será para invertir en compra de un novillo, para poder realizar sus servicios con mayor comodidad y dandole de esta forma un valor agregado a su servicio, para poder diferenciarse de su competencia y asi poder captar un número mayor de ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en la calidad de su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hermogenes is 48 years old. He lives in his own home, which is made of rustic materials, with his partner and their 12-year-old son. Their son is in high school at the government-run school in Pucará. Hermogenes has lived in the rural part of this district for more than 21 years and has water and electricity. This district is located in the province of Jaén in the Cajamara region in southern Perú. People in the community work in agriculture, raise cattle, and engage in commerce.

Hermogenes provides agricultural labor, like plowing and tiling agricultural land. He has well-known customers in the area. Hermogenes has been working in this position for more than 20 years.

He will use the loan to invest in a cow in order to make his job more convenient. This way, he will add value to his services because he will differentiate himself from his competition. This way, he'll be able to earn more money and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a cow.

loans.name: Thet

texts.en:
Thet, 45, is married with four children. She resides in a rural village located in the Angkor Chey district of Kampot Province. For the last 27 years, she has been farming rice and selling Khmer noodles. She can earn about US$10 per day.

Now she is asking for a loan. This is Thet's first loan with VisionFund. Thet will use this loan to pay her son’s school fee. He wants to study Economics. She hopes this loan will enable him to get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay hrt son’s school fee

loans.name: Mirna Maricela

texts.es: Mirna de 27 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda humilde pero propia junto a sus 2 hijas de 11 y 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer admirable ya que ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijas apoyada únicamente en su negocio de elaboración de delantales y gabachas, los que distribuye en diferentes mercados cercanos, además elabora prendas de vestir por encargo. Mirna adquirió un crédito anteriormente con la institución con el cual repelló su vivienda de bajareque y cambió el techo de su vivienda, por lo que se siente muy agradecida, por lo que desea adquirir un nuevo crédito con FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y mano de obra para encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mirna, 27, is a single mother who lives in a humble house that she owns. She has two daughters, aged 11 and 7 years. She is a remarkable woman who has already managed to raise her daughters supported only by her business of making aprons and smocks which she sells in various markets.  She also produces custom clothing. 

Mirna has already gotten a loan from this institution with which she plastered her home and changed its roof. She feels very grateful. She is seeking a new loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and labor costs for setting a concrete floor in her home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, and pay laborers to build a cement floor

loans.name: Brayan Alex

texts.es:
Brayan es un hombre de 20 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y se dedica al servicio de transporte.
Él es inteligente, soñador, optimista, constante, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona de ‘Buenos Aires’ un lugar popular caracterizado por la diversidad de comercios en todas las áreas.
Brayan es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el aymara por herencia familiar. Su trabajo es el servicio de transporte como taxi, a muy tempranas horas por la madrugada ronda por la zona en busca de sus clientes continuos que son aquellos que se dedican al comercio y comienzan sus labores junto a la salida del sol. Su deseo de superación lo ha llevado a lograr estudios superiores en la universidad, se encuentra en tercer año y le faltan dos años para terminar. Su sueño es terminar su carrera para manejar de mejor forma su negocio. El desea realizar el pago de un curso en la universidad y comprar libros de estudio.
Es por esos motivos que Brayan solicita un préstamo para pagar un curso en la universidad y comprar libros de estudio.
texts.en:
Brayan is a 20-year-old single man with no children who works in the transport service.

He is a smart dreamer who is optimistic, consistent, responsible, and hardworking. His work is done in the area of Buenos Aires, a popular spot characterized by the diversity of businesses in the area.

Brayan is of dark complexion. He has short black hair, he is of medium height and slender physique. His first language is Spanish and he learned Aymara at home. His job is to transport people as a taxi driver. At very early hours of the morning, he goes around the area looking for his customers who are engaged in trade and begin their work at sunrise. His desire to excel led him to seek higher education at the university. He is in his third year and needs to complete two more. His dream is to finish his studies to better manage his business. 

He wants to pay for a college course and buy textbooks. He is seeking a loan to pay for the course and his textbooks for this reason.

loans.use: to pay for a college course and textbooks

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolas tiene 50 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge; no tiene hijos a su cargo. Es natural de Caserío la Succha del Distrito de Santo Tomas de Cutervo, vive en casa propia de material rustico un piso; Nicolas mantiene buenas relaciones con los miembros su comunidad, vive en una comunidad pequeña dedicada básicamente a la agricultura. Nicolas vive en la parte urbana del Caserío la Succha del Distrito de Santo Tomas de Cutervo, vivienda cuenda con servicios de agua. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en la provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Nicolas es la agricultura hace 25 años, cultiva café variedad catimor, a la fecha de la visita él tiene 1 has. Plantación de 4 años de edad, cultivo realiza en terreno propio en caserío La Succha; Nicolas cuenta con amplia experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café; producto vende a compradores mayoristas del distrito. Adicionalmente cultiva maíz amarillo duro criollo; cultiva 1 has. En terreno de su propiedad, en el Caserío Miraflores sector Hurumana, su producto lo comercializa los dias domingos en el Distrito de Santo Tomas a compradores mayoristas.

El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento de una has de café variedad catimor, con ello asegurará campaña 2015 con una mayor y mejor producción y por ende tener mayor ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
50-year old Nicolas lives in a stable home along with his wife. They do not have any dependent children. Nicolas is from the village of La Succha in the district of Santo Tomas de Cutervo. He lives in a house with one floor made of local materials. He is on good terms with the members of his small community who earn their living in agriculture. His home has a water supply. The community is located in the province of Cutervo, in Cajamarca Region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

Nicolas has been a farmer for 25 years. He grows the Catimor variety of coffee on his one hectare plantation which is four years old. The land is his own and is located in La Succha. He has many years of experience growing coffee which he sells to local wholesale buyers.

He also grows one hectare of a local variety of maize in the village of Miraflores on his own land in the Hurumana neighbourhood. He sells the produce on Sundays to wholesalers in Santo Tomas District.

Nicolas plans to use the loan money to buy agricultural supplies for his 2015 coffee crop so that he will have a larger and improved crop. Then he will earn more money and be able to improve his own and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies for his coffee plants

loans.name: Proek

texts.en:
A villager from the Takeo province’s Bati district, Proek is 63 years old and married. She has seven children. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming and weaving bamboo buckets. To supplement the income, she has been working as a garment worker. Having been in this business for 14 years, she is able to earn daily income of USD 14 to support her family, and she can save about USD 7 per day for the future needs. 

This is the second loan for Proek with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan to pay for her son’s university tuition fees. She hopes that he will get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s university tuition fees.

loans.name: Sokleap

texts.en:
Sokleap, 22, is single and residing in a rural area of the Bati district of Takeo Province. To make a living, he has been farming rice and working in one of the factories in the village. He can earn about USD $12 per day. 

Sokleap is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now he is asking for a loan to pay his university tuition fees to study information technology. He hopes this loan will keep him in university until his gradation.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition fees to study information technology.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Rubina is 41 years old. She is a housewife and looks after her family, consisting of six people. Her husband owns a sanitary items shop. He has been running the sanitary items shop for the last four years. He sells a variety of sanitary items like PVC pipes, washbasins, bracket pairs for washbasin, lead (solid), looking glass etc. in his shop. He requires some amount to enhance his business, so Rubina made contact with Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan. BRAC staff visited her husband's sanitary shop and issued a loan. Rubina is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to enhance in her husband's sanitary shop.

loans.name: Fray Oscar

texts.es: Fray de 51 años de edad habita en vivienda humilde pero propia desde hace 30 años a lado de su esposa y sus hijos, el siempre ha buscado la manera de sacar adelante a su familia a pesar de ser una persona sencilla ha sabido sostener la economía de su hogar. Se gana la vida desde hace mucho tiempo cultivando diversidad de granos y hortalizas como: maíz, frijol, maicillo, güisquil, tomate y pepino, lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos y apoyarse en ello para cancelar un crédito anterior que utilizo para cambiar el techo del corredor y mejorar el piso de este, por lo que se siente muy agradecido. Fray desea adquirir un nuevo crédito con FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y mano de obra para encementar el piso de su vivienda dado que con el primer crédito solo pudo mejorar el techo del corredor y desea terminar las mejoras y  así dar una mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Fray is 51 years old and lives in a humble home that he has owned for the past 30 years. He lives with his wife and their children. He always looks for ways to move his family forward. Despite being a modest person, he has known how to support his household financially.

For many years, he has made a living by growing a variety of grains and vegetables like corn, beans, millet, chayote squash, tomatoes, and cucumbers. This has allowed him to move his children forward and pay off a previous loan that he used to replace the roof and improve the floor in the hallway. He is very grateful for this.

Fray would like to obtain a new loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, and gravel, and to pay workers to install a cement floor in his home. With his first loan, he was only able to improve the roof in the hallway, and he would like to complete the repairs to provide more comfort for his family.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and gravel, and to pay workers to install a cement floor in his home to provide more comfort for his family.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción, ve en los créditos la oportunidad de incrementar las ganancias de su negocio, por lo que nuevamente solicita un crédito que será de ayuda para comprar 6 qq de abono, para el cultivo de una manzana de maíz, también realizara la compra de un cerdo para engordarlo y posteriormente venderlo a un buen precio, espera mantener la continuidad del buen desarrollo de su negocio.
El crédito anterior ha sido de beneficio para Concepción, pues tiene un negocio más productivo, mejores ingresos con los que ha mantenido el buen record crediticio y junto a su familia comparte un estilo de vida mucho más confortable.
texts.en:
Concepción sees loans as an opportunity to increase the profits of his business, therefore, he is again applying for a loan which will help him to buy six quintals of fertilizer for growing corn and apples. He will also buy a pig to fatten and sell later at a good price. He looks forward to the continued success of his business.

The previous loan has been beneficial for Concepción. His business is more productive and he has more income with which he has maintained a good credit record. His family shares a more comfortable way of life.

loans.use: to grow corn and apples and raise a pig

loans.name: Melquiades

texts.es:
Melquiades tiene 62 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia; en una zona rural del distrito de Nueva Arica, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Melquiades se dedica a brindar servicio de jornaleria; desde hace 35 años, el presta este servicio en su distrito y en los alrededores del mismo. Él solicita préstamo para invertir en actvo fijo; compra de una mochila para funigar; esto le servira para mejorar sus servicios a los agricultores, ya que le dara un valor agregado a su servicio. De esta forma, podrá captar un número mayor de clientes, mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en la calidad de su vida.
texts.en:
Melquiades is 62 years old, single, and has no dependent children. He lives in his own house in a rural district of Nueva Arica in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, in the north coast of Peru. His community is dedicated mainly to agriculture, livestock, and trade.

Melquiades is a day laborer. For 35 years, he has been working in the district and nearby areas. He has requested a loan to invest in fixed assets, buying a pesticide sprayer which will improve his services to farmers, adding value to his service. This way, he can attract more customers, higher revenues, higher profits, and an improvement in his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a pesticide sprayer

loans.name: Karla Ines

texts.es:
Karla, se dedica a vender pupusas, refrescos, jugos, etc., esta actividad la aprendió a desempeñarla por motivación de amistades, luego decidió fundar su propio negocio con apoyo de su esposo, ya tiene 4 años de poseerlo, su suegra le ayuda a atenderlo; vive con su hijo y su suegra.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar harina, quesillo, repollo, tomates, aceite, jugos, gaseosas, etc., tendrá materia prima para mantener su negocio con actividad en el mercado, espera tener nuevos clientes, ventas e ingresos mayores.
Su visión es a futuro incluir un nuevo rubro con el que genere ingresos extras, construir su casa propia, cancelar sus deudas y mejorar la calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Karla sells stuffed tortillas, soft drinks, juice etc. She learned how to this from a group of friends. Then she decided to open her own business, now 4 years old, with the help of her husband. Her mother-in-law helps her. She lives with her son and mother-in-law.

Karla will use the loan money to buy flour, cream cheese, cabbage, tomatoes, oil, juice, sodas etc. She will then have the necessary ingredients to continue her work in the market. She hopes to have new customers, more sales, and a greater income. In the future Karla hopes to have a new line of business so she can earn more money, build a house of her own, pay off her debts, and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy flour, cream cheese, cabbage, tomatoes, oil, juice, sodas etc

loans.name: Suarez

texts.es:
Suarez tiene 25 años de edad, vive con sus padres, es soltero, dedicado a la agricultura cultivando caña y cultivo de café, actividad que desarrolla por más de 10 años, posee experiencia en el negocio. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Callacyuc, provincia y región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Suarez se dedica al Cultivo de café, desde hace más de 10 años. El destino del crédito es para comprar abonos para el mantenimiento de su finca. Manteniendo sus fincas obtendrá mayores rendimientos mejor producción y por ende un mejor producto que prodrá ofrecerlo en el mercado a un mejor precio, lo que le generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en la calidad de su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
25-year old Suarez lives with his parents and is single. He has earned his living growing sugar cane and coffee for more than ten years. He has business experience. The local people work in agriculture, raise livestock or have businesses. The community is located in the district of Callacyuc, in the province and region of Cajamarca, in Peru's northern mountains.

Suarez plans to use the loan money to buy fertilizer for his crops. By taking good care of the plants he will have a good harvest, better production, and finally a better product to sell in the market at a better price. He will generate more income and more profit which will result in an improved quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for his fields

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is a resourceful mother who was engages in direct selling of Avon, MSE, Natasha, and Tupperware products within the local community, to supplement her husband’s income. She is 39 years old and blessed with three children attending school. Despite the hardship of living, she and her husband want to educate their children, and to give them a better living. With this regard, Jennifer aims to improve her business to earn a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail an additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy more stock of Avon, MSE, Natasha and Tupperware products to sell. She believes that she will further improve her business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Avon, MSE, Natasha and Tupperware products to sell.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in Kampong Speu Province’s Phnom Srouch district, Sokha is 44 years old and married with five children. She earns a living through farming rice and she also works as a garment worker. Together, she and her family can earn about KHR 20,000 per day from their current work and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for their future needs.

This is Sokha's first loan from VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sokha is going to use her portion to buy a water filter for her family to use. She hopes to have clean water for drinking so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a water filter for her family to use

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Phnom Srouch district

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom is aged 47 years and married with eight children, three of whom are in school. She lives in a rural village in the Kampong Speu Province’s Phnom Srouch district, and she earns a living through farming rice and working as a garment worker. Together, she and her family can earn about KHR 20,000 per day from their current work and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for their future needs.

Mom is leading a group of two borrowers with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she is just with VisionFund for this cycle. As the group leader, Mom wants to use her portion to buy a water filter for her family to use. She hopes to have clean water to use in her family.

loans.use: to buy a water filter for her family to use

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Phnom Srouch district

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez, age 44, is a mother of five children. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of tailoring materials for his shop, including threads, needles, clothing, etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to a lack of money he finds it difficult to purchase these items. 

Therefore his wife, Kaneez is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. Her husband will purchase a new sewing machine with the help of this loan. Kaneez is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with this loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her husband's tailoring work

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem's age is 39, and she is married, living with her family including seven children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son owns a small business selling ready-made clothing. He purchases garments from the market at low prices and sells them at higher prices from his shop. People of the town like his garment collections and selection a lot. Now the winter season is going to start, and he wants to buy the clothes to sell for the winter season, but he does not have the amounts because of household expenses. 

Therefore his mother, Naseem, has requested a loan so that her son can buy more clothes for the winter season to fulfill the demand. Naseem wishes for the bright future of her children and she dreams to provide better education for them. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance in her son's ready-made clothes sales business.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима порядочная женщина. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 несовершеннолетних детей. Она всегда старается для блага получения своих детей. Она 2 года назад начала свой бизнес скотоводством. Она откармливает коров. Фотима имеет коровник в своем доме. Ее рабочий день начинается в 5 утра, когда она откармливает корм для скота, а после этого доит корову. Фотима продает молоко местным жителям. Ее покупатели рады от высококачественного молочного продукта. Фотима запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки коровы, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Fotima is an honest, upstanding lady.  She is 26, married, and has two children who have yet to come of age.  She always tries her best to provide for her children's well-being.  Two years ago, she started her own livestock business, keeping cows in a pen at her house and fattening them over time.  Her work day starts at 5:00 AM, when she first feeds her cows, then milks them.  She sells her milk to the locals, and her customers are always pleased with its quality.  She is seeking a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy a cow to increase her working capital, and is counting on your kindness and charity.

loans.use: buy a cow to increase her working capital

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is the age of 55 and she is a mother of five children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, and thus he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Shehnaz is so very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the repair costs of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Shafiq Shah

texts.en:
Shafiq is from Lahore. He is 32, married, and a father of four children. He is a loving father. All his children are school-going. Shafiq sells homeopathic/herbal medicines in the local market. As some people prefer to use homeopathic medicines due to their lack of side effects, the demand for such medicines is increasing.

Shafiq sees this as a window of opportunity and wants to buy more medicines for his store for which he needs a loan of PKR 200,000. He has therefore requested a loan to help him buy more homeopathic medicines in order to increase his earnings.

loans.use: To buy homeopathic medicines to meet increasing demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more canned goods, breads, soft drinks, biscuits, assorted candies, beverages and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Ali Asghar

texts.en:
Ali runs a school in his community. He is 39, married, and blessed with three children. He teaches in the school as well. He believes that education is the right of every individual. He is liked by everyone. He is hardworking and tries to provide his students with the best possible education despite the many constraints. 

As the number of students in increasing in his school, he needs to buy additional furniture for his school. For this purpose he has requested a loan. He is hopeful that he will be able to educate many children in his community and make them responsible citizens. He is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva lenders

loans.use: to buy furniture for his school.

loans.name: M. Waheed

texts.en: M. Waheed is a hardworking wholesaler from Lahore. He is 38, married and blessed with five children. He has been in this business for quite some time now. He mainly deals in grocery products and has made a good clientele over the time. He gets frequent orders and his customers are satisfied by his quick and better services.  He has requested a loan to extend his services, as he has many orders in line. He is hopeful that it will be beneficial for the growth of his business.

loans.use: to buy sacks rice, flour and cases of cooking oils to sell to the retailers.

loans.name: Sylver

texts.en:
Sylver lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. He sells second hand clothes to earn income for supporting his family's needs. He desires to educate his children. He also has a piggery so as to add to his income. Sylver is challenged by price fluctuation and seasonal changes. 

He wants a loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Lourdes Esmeralda

texts.es: Lourdes de 32 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 1 año y 8 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano a regar y limpiar el cultivo de hortalizas que comparte con su compañero de vida, ya que ambos cultivan espinaca y güisquil desde hace 12 años por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes  que compran por mayoreo sus productos. Lourdes adquirió un crédito anteriormente con la institución el mismo lo invirtió en la construcción de un pasamanos en su vivienda. Ella se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo recibido, por lo que desea adquirir un  nuevo credito para realizar mejoras en la cocina de su vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, hierro y ladrillo.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 32 years old and lives in her own home along with her partner and their two children, who are 1 and 8 years old. She is a hardworking woman who wakes up early every day to water and tend to the vegetable garden that she cares for with her partner. They have both been growing spinach and chayote squash for 12 years and have a good number of customers who buy their vegetables wholesale. 

Lourdes earlier took out a loan through Apoyo Integral [Kiva Field Partner] that she used to build a railing in her home. She is very thankful for the support that she received and would now like to take out a new loan to make improvements to her kitchen. With this loan she will buy cement, sand, iron and bricks to make the repairs.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, iron and bricks to repair her home.

loans.name: Psomogen

texts.en: Psomogen is a 66-year-old, married woman living with six children in Masindi, Uganda. She sells food and drinks like sodas in a restaurant. She has been in this business for two years, so as to cater for her family’s needs. She desires to educate her children. Inadequate capital hinders her business. Psomogen wants a loan to buy drinks and food for sell.

loans.use: to buy drinks and food to sell.

loans.name: Jesus Alberto

texts.es: Jesús de 22 años de edad habita en vivienda humilde pero propia al lado de su compañera de vida y su grupo familiar. Él es un hombre trabajador que desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar la tierra por lo que actualmente ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia con las ganancias de sus cultivos de mora y espinaca. Jesús anteriormente solicitó un crédito a la institución y lo  invirtió en materiales para la construcción de un cuarto, pero no logro construirlo por falta de otros materiales y financiamiento de mano de obra y es por ello que solicita un  nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y mano de obra para construir un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jesús is 22 years old and lives with his life partner and family group in a house that is humble but their own. He is a hard worker who learned to work the land at a young age and has managed to support his family with earnings from his blackberry and spinach crops. 

Jesus previously requested a loan from the institution and invested it in materials to construct a room, but he wasn't able to build it due to a lack of other materials, plus he didn't have financing to pay for the labor. This is why he is asking for a new loan from FUSAI which he will invest in bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and labor to add a room to his house.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and gravel, and to pay for labor to add a room to his house.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a 39-year-old, single lady operating a retail shop in the town of Masindi, Uganda. She started the business five years ago to support her family’s needs. She desires to increase her business stock. Being a single parent looking after children has affected her business cash flows. She needs a loan to buy sugar, salt and drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, brinda en su comunidad el servicio de cibercafé y sala de video juegos, en esta actividad tiene 9 años de experiencia, pero desde hace 3 años hizo la apertura de su propio negocio, sus conocimientos lo adquirió mediante preparación académica, atiende a los clientes de nueve de la mañana a diez de la noche. Es soltero, vive con sus hermanos y su madre.
Invertirá en video cámaras, con las que tendrá vigilado su negocio, le será de ayuda para tener seguridad personal y brindar a sus clientes mayor confianza, espera continuar trabajando y mejorando su entorno.  Su riesgo es el nivel de delincuencia por lo que puede ser objeto de un asalto.
Sus anhelos son abrir un nuevo cibercafé y comprar un vehículo.
texts.en:
Juan provides his community with cybercafe services and a video game salon. He has nine years of experience doing this, but three years ago he decided to start his own business. He acquired his knowledge through academic preparation. He serves his customers from nine in the morning to ten at night. He is single and lives with his mother and brothers.

He will invest in video cameras which he will use to monitor his business. They will help him ensure his personal security and give his customers more confidence. He hopes to continue working and improving his surroundings. The risk he encounters is due to the level of crime which makes him vulnerable to being the victim of an attack.

He hopes to open a new cybercafe and buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to invest in video cameras which he will use to monitor his business helping him to ensure his personal security and give his customers more confidence.

loans.name: Kiem

texts.en:
Kiem, 52 years old, is divorced and has two children, one son and one daughter. She runs a food stall to sell meals to people in her community. She has had this business for 28 years. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Kiem intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and to buy good quality raw food to make better meals to sell. The additional capital will enable her to increase her income from this business. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw food to make meals to sell from her food stall.

loans.name: Terraclear

texts.en:
In Laos, nearly half of the population lacks access to safe drinking water, causing widespread waterborne illness. TerraClear is a social enterprise with the mission to increase access to safe drinking water especially in remote households. Since 2010, TerraClear has been locally manufacturing ceramic water filters, which provide effective and long-term household access to clean water.

TerraClear's success has been built on promoting an affordable and easy to use product with an innovative design. TerraClear became a Kiva Field partner at the beginning of the year in order to increase its outreach and provide these water filters to its end users. Ceramic Water Filters have helped over 30,000 families to access clean water in Laos. The next stage of TerraClear's business plan is to scale up production and delivery to more remote areas. To achieve this, Kiva has partnered with Nexus Carbon for Development to provide a loan of $35,000 to TerraClear to purchase a delivery truck to service remote households of Laos with safe drinking water.

Currently, TerraClear can only transport 30-35 water filters at one time. This new truck will allow TerraClear to transport 120-130 water filter sets, which will reduce the number of trips from the provinces back to the distribution center. This will dramatically increase the number of filters reaching households every week. 

As TerraClear is scaling-up, this investment will require some time to produce returns. The loan has been structured with a single payment at the end of the loan term with the expectations that lenders could get paid back earlier if TerraClear produces results quicker than anticipated. 

Pictures displayed in the profile show TerraClear's end users who have received water filters and a short video of TerraClear's founder.  

For more information about TerraClear and safe water in Laos, go to https://www.facebook.com/pages/Nexus-c4d/339349449574898?sk=info or www.laowater.org

video.title: Kiva Borrower Nathan from Lao People's Democratic Republic

loans.use: to purchase a truck to deliver water filters to remote areas of Laos

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 30-year-old, married, father of two children. He is a Palestinian refugee who works hard to provide his family with the necessary living needs. 

Five years ago, Jamal started working in a shampoo factory with limited salary to cover the expenses and needs of his family. His family’s needs are increasing, thus he has to work hard in order to increase his income.

Today, Jamal wants to start his own business, but since he has no saved capital, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua, to start selling charcoal. Charcoal is highly requested in his region for Hookah smokers and to warm up during the coming autumn and winter seasons.  

He hopes to develop his business in the future, so that one day he can quit working in the factory and develop his own career.

loans.use: to start his own charcoal selling business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a cassava production business in the Philippines. Letecia is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to  purchase empty sacks and to repair machinery for her cassava production business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase empty sacks and to repair machinery for her cassava production business.

loans.name: Rutchanie

texts.en:
Rutchanie is 52 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Rutchanie is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rutchanie has been farming sugarcane for 28 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy manure, fertilizers, and seeds, and cover other costs associated with his crops.

loans.name: M. Arif

texts.en:
M. Arif belongs to Lahore. He is 38, married, and blessed with three sons. He is a milkman by profession. He wakes up early in the morning to get milk from his cattle and then leaves to deliver it to households and restaurants and shops. He is experienced and is hardworking. He wants to give his children a better education. 

He is now planning to extend his services to more customers, and he has therefore requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner, to help him buy another buffalo to increase milk production. He is thankful and hopes that this investment will be beneficial for the growth of his bus

loans.use: to buy an additional buffalo for producing milk.

loans.name: Danis Esau

texts.es:
Danis, se dedica a reparar equipos de sonido, televisores, etc., lo hace de manera independiente desde hace 6 años, es un oficio que heredó de su familia, ya cuenta con mucha experiencia; es un joven que cuenta con la responsabilidad de sacar a delante a su familia, vive con su compañera de vida y un hijo de 6 años de edad.
Comprará cables, tornillos y otros repuestos que utilizará para realizar un buen trabajo, espera tener más clientes satisfechos, obtener mayor utilidad en su negocio y resarcir su deuda.
Danis sueña con tener recursos económicos para comprar su propia casa y dar a su hijo estudios universitarios para que tenga un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Danis works repairing television sets and sound equipment. He's been working at this independently for 6 years and because it's a business that he inherited from his family he has lots of experience. Danis lives with his partner and their 6-year-old son, and though he's young he is responsible for helping his family to get ahead in life.

Danis will use this loan to buy cables, screws and other parts and supplies that he will use to do quality repair work. He hopes to have more satisfied customers, run his business more efficiently, and repay his debt. His dream is to have the means to buy his own home and provide his son with a college education so that he will have a better future.

loans.use: buy cables, screws and other parts and supplies that he will use to do quality repair work.

loans.name: Gilmer

texts.es:
Gilmer tiene 30 años de edad, vive en casa propia, con su cónyuge y su menor hijo de 02 años. Viven en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú; contando con servicios de agua y luz. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Gilmer se dedica al alquilar de yunta para dragueo y arada, y también cuenta con alquiler de cultivo de arroz el cual se encuentra en la etapa de espiga. El destino del crédito sera para invertir en los gastos de arreglo del dragueo y de la arada. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende mejora su calidad de vida, y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gilmer, 30, lives in his own home with his wife and their minor child, aged two.  They live in the rural part of the district of Pucara, in Jaen province in the  Cajamarca region  in the northern highlands of Peru.  In his home, Gilmer has water and electricity. The residents of his community mainly work in agriculture, animal husbandry, and commerce.

Gilmer has a business renting a pair of bulls and a yolk to plow fields.  He also does rentals for rice crops, as it is currently the growing season.  He will use this loan to pay for some expenses to fix his plowing equipment.  There is not much competition in this line of work in his area, so with this loan he will obtain more earnings and income.  This way he can improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to repair the equipment he uses in his agricultural rentals business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell and groundnuts for peanut butter production.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Luciano tiene 29 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado se su cónyuge y una hija menor de 2 años y 10 meses; Luciana vive en casa propia de material rustico de un piso; él es nacido en caserio la Succha Sector el Huabo y cónyuge es nacida en caserío Miraflores del distrito Santo Tomas, conviven hace 4 años en armonía familiar; se lleva en comunión con los miembros de su caserío, vive en la parte rural del caserío la Succha del Distrito de Santo Tomas; vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua.

La actividad que realiza Luciano es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1,5 has. Variedad catimor, plantación esta en tercer y cuarto año de producción; tiene terreno agrícola propio donde esta parcela de café, actividad la realiza hace 11 años en caserío la Succha sector el huabo Distrito Santo Tomas, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café, producto lo vende en distrito Santo Tomas a compradores de la zona.

Adicionalmente Luciano se dedica al cultivo de maiz amarillo criollo duro contando a la fecha con 1 has. En caserío lasuccha sector el huabo. El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento de 1,5 has. De café en producción, con ello asegurara mayor y mejor producción para campaña 2015 y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luciano is 29 years old and has a stable home together with his common-law wife and their daughter who is 2 years and 10 months old. He lives in his own rustic, one-floor house which has running water.  He was born in the hamlet of Succha, in the Huabo Sector, and he lives there today in the rural section. His wife was born in the hamlet of Miraflores in the Santo Tomas district. They have lived in familial harmony for four years and they live communally with the people of their hamlet.

Luciano's work is coffee-growing. As of now he owns 1.5 hectares of land on which he grows the Catimor variety of coffee and which is in its third and fourth years of production. He has experience growing coffee and has been doing this for 11 years in the hamlet where he lives. He sells his product in Santo Tomas to buyers from the area.

Additionally, Luciano also grows hard yellow native corn and as of today he has 1 hectare which is located in the hamlet of La Succha in the Huabo Sector. The loan will be used to maintain the 1.5 hectares of coffee in production which will ensure more and better quality output for the 2015 season, resulting in more income and the ability to improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: pay for the maintenance of 1.5 hectares of coffee, ensuring more and better output in 2015.

loans.name: Maria Noemy

texts.es: María tiene 30 años de edad y habita junto a su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos de 12 años, 11 años, 9 años y 8 años de edad. María se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como se gana la vida y junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. María desea reparar el techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado y cuando llueve el agua se filtra, dañando sus pocas pertenencias. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, polines, madera y pines.
texts.en:
Maria is 30 years old and lives with her life partner and four children, ages 12, 11, 9, and 8. Maria has made a living selling clothes for a long time, and this is how she earns her living. Together with her life partner, they maintain the household finances. 

Maria wants to repair the roof of the house given that it has deteriorated, and when it rains, water leaks, damaging her few belongings. She is therefore requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in buying galvanized sheet, beams, wood, and fastening pins.

loans.use: to buy: galvanized sheet, beams, wood, and fastening pins in order to repair the roof of the house.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with five children, one of whom attends school. She takes care of additional family members. She has been selling local brew from home, both wholesale and retail, for the last ten years, working seven days a week. She generates additional income from selling charcoal. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 2,200,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy more jerrycans of local brew and spirits for sale. Her challenges include thieves and transportation. Her dream is to start selling beer and wines on a wholesale basis. She joined MCDT because of the good relationship between the SACCO members and the staff members. She resides in her own house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy jerrycans of local brew and spirits

loans.name: Kabuku Success Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Salome, a member of Kabuku Success Group. She is twenty-seven years old, married and blessed with two children.

She sells second hand clothes in the local market, hawking her products in the neighborhood to reach more customers. Salome is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for inculcating a savings and entrepreneurial culture in her through their trainings. She is borrowing from Kiva to expand her clothing enterprise. She hopes this will enable her to meet the rising demand for clothing hence increased income. This will help her support her family's needs, such as food and clothing.

Salome is happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for this help and support.

loans.use: to pay for second hand clothes.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo tiene 33 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge e hijos en el distrito de Morropón. La vida en el distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente debido a que no existe peligro alguno, en lo que respecta al negocio u a otra actividad que se desarrolla, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio de abarrotes,etc. Dicho distrito está ubicada en distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Gerardo es la venta de abarrotes, arroz, azucar, aceite, entre otros. La actividad la realiza desde hace más de 5 años, en su domicilio en el distrito de Morropón. El destino del crédito será para realizar la compra de una cantidad mayor de abarrotes(azùcar, cafe, aceite, arros, entre otros). El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que el producto se vende de manera diaria en la zona y él piensa trabajar otorgando buen producto incrementando sus ventas, aumentando sus ingresos, mejorando sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 33 years old. His is partnered, and lives in his own house with his partner and children in Morropón district. Life in the district is peaceful because there is no danger.  In regards to business or other economic activity, the population works in agriculture, selling groceries, etc. This district is located in Morropón district and province, Piura region, on the northern coast of Perú. 

The work Gerardo does is selling groceries, rice, sugar, and oil, among others. He has done this work for over 5 years, from his home, in Morropón district. The loan will be used to purchase a greater quantity of groceries (sugar, coffee, oil, and rice, among others).  The market has good prospects due to the product being sold daily in the zone and he plans to work offering good products, increase his income, improve his profit and, in turn, the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a zero-grazing unit

loans.name: Maria Sonia

texts.es:
María, comercializa cerdos y aves de corral desde hace nueve años, ella aprendió lo relacionado con el negocio de su madre, actualmente lo desempeña como una fuente de ingresos con los que subsiste junto a su familia, su jornada de trabajo es de ocho  de la mañana a cinco de la tarde; vive con sus dos hijos de 15 y 3 años de edad, el mayor está estudiando octavo grado.
 Le será de ayuda el crédito para comprar concentrado y vitaminas para cerdos, fortalecerá su negocio y mejorara la alimentación de sus animales, espera que al momento de venderlos pueda tener mayores ganancias y nuevos clientes.
María desea seguir trabajando para mejorar su situación económica, cancelar la deuda adquirirá, diversificar más su negocio y cambiar su estilo de vida por uno más digno.
texts.en:
María has sold pigs and poultry for the past nine years. She learned everything related to the business from her mother.
