Currently she carries it out as a source of income on which she lives with her family. Her work day is from eight in the morning until five in the afternoon. She lives with her two children, ages 15 and 3 years old; the older one is in eighth grade.

The loan will be of help to her to purchase concentrated feed and vitamins for pigs, it will strengthen her business and improve her animals' diet; she expects that when selling them she can have increased earnings and new customers.

María wants to continue working to improve her economic situation, pay off the debt she will acquire, diversify her business more and change her lifestyle for one that's more dignified.

loans.use: to purchase concentrated feed and vitamins for pigs, to strengthen her business and improve the diet of her animals.

loans.name: Nbn Group

texts.en:
Zahraa is the featured borrower for NBN Group. She got together with the other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Zahraa is a 20-year-old single lady who works as a tutor to cover her living needs and expenses, but her acquired income isn’t enough to cover unexpected increasing living needs. That’s why, today Zahraa acquired a loan that will be used in covering her necessary dental needs.

Zahraa is the first lady on the left, Bahiya is the lady standing in the middle, and Nadia is the first lady on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to covering her necessary dental needs.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan de 51 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos dos mayores de edad y dos de 15 y 13 años de edad. Él toda su vida ha sabido salir adelante a base de esfuerzo y trabajo, cultivando hortalizas como: mora, espinaca y hierba buena, además sabiendo que el gasto económico de su hogar es bastante grande también se dedica a vender productos reciclables con lo que logra tener una mayor estabilidad económica. Juan anteriormente solicito un crédito el cual invirtió en laminas para el techo de su vivienda por lo que se siente muy agradecido ya que sus pertenencias Y su familia ya no se mojan y es por ello que desea adquirir un nuevo crédito con FUSAI para invertir en: adobe, cemento, lamina y madera para construir un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en: Juan is 51 years old. He lives in his own home with his life partner and their four children. Two of them are older and the two younger ones are 15 and 13 years old. All his life he has been able to succeed due to his efforts and hard work. He grows blackberries, spinach and mint. In addition, due to the large household expenses, he also sells recyclable products in order to have better financial stability. Previously, Juan requested a loan to invest in sheeting for the roof of his home. He is very grateful that his belongings and family do not get wet. This is why he wants to request a new loan with FUSAI to invest in adobe, cement, laminate and wood in order to build a room in his house.

loans.use: purchase adobe, cement, laminate, and wood

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz una mujer de 49 años de edad, propietaria de una tienda donde distribuye productos de la canasta familiar y bebidas entre ella la más consumida que es la cerveza, se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual invertirá en pintura para su negocio y arreglar una carpa para poder ubicar mesas y silletería afuera del negocio haciendo muy agradable a la vista del público.

Es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad y comenzó la tienda por vocación por amor al trabajo, su sueño es poder darles estudio. Con el crédito espera poder mejorar la percepción de su negocio atrayendo más clientes que se sienten a compartir una sonrisa y una refrescante cerveza.
texts.en:
Luz is a 49 year old woman and owner of a store where she sells basic groceries and beverages; among the most consumed is beer. She is seeking a loan to invest in paint for her business and to repair a canopy in order to locate tables and seating outside her business, giving it a friendly appearance to the public.

She is the mother of 2 children and she opened her store because she loved the work. Her dream is to be able to provide an education to her children. With this loan she hopes to be able to improve her business's appearance, thus attracting more customers with whom to share a smile and refreshing beer.

loans.use: to buy paint and a canopy.

loans.name: Mushgoa Multipurpose Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Florence, 52 years old, married and living with her husband. She is a mother of seven children and works tirelessly to support her family. She is a member of Mushgoa Multipurpose Self Help Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIH EA)  in the year 2013 to benefit from the training on enterprise creation and financial management to help improve their living standards.

She is a mixed farmer who raises potatoes, maize, cabbages, peas and carrots and also does dairy farming. From the training she got from HIH EA,  she has been able to manage her business and make good returns from it.
 
She is borrowing a loan to build a modern cow shed for the cows. This will ensure they are clean and safe from disease, hence maintaining a consistent milk supply. She hopes that her business will go a long way in helping support her children’s education and providing them with basic needs such as food and clothing.

Florence is happy for Kiva and their lenders for the great support.

loans.use: To pay for constructing a cow shed

loans.name: Mervete

texts.en:
Mervete is 41 years old and has three children between the ages of nine and 13 years old. Mervete is a very hard working woman who does a lot in order to support her family because her husband is ill with a disease that prevents him from being able to work. She not only takes care of the home and the children, but she also plants corn and wheat on their land and sells them. 

Right now she is requesting a loan in order to purchase guano and wheat seeds and to pay the worker to tend to the crops on her land since she is unable to do it all herself. She hopes that in the future she will be able to find a job and be able to add even more income to her family. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support and the opportunities she hopes to have.

loans.use: to purchase guano and wheat seeds and to pay a worker to tend to the crops on her land.

loans.name: Samara

texts.es:
Samara una hermosa joven de 21 años que encontró en su hijo el motor de su vida, esa chispa de fuerza que le hacía falta para proyectarse y despegar laboralmente, se dedica a la venta de mercancía como ropa, cosméticos, y productos de uso personal como lo son crema de manos, lociones etc. 
Samara en busca de mejorar las condiciones de vida, mejorar su negocio, ser una mejor empresa y velar por el futuro de su hijo de 2 años quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de vitrinas y estanterías ya que para exhibir sus productos saca toda su mercancía muy desorganizadamente y lo que quiere lograr es parecerse cada día más a un almacén por eso necesita de urgencia las vitrinas y estanterías. 
Su sueño es poder ampliar su negocio y así sacarlo al público como local comercial y comprara todo poco a poco.
Samara ha solicitado dos créditos con un habitó de pago muy puntal.
texts.en:
Samara is a beautiful 21 year old young woman who is inspired by her son. She sells merchandise such as clothing, cosmetics, and person use products such as hand cream, lotion, etc. Samara seeks better living conditions, improve her business, to be a better businesswoman and to secure the future of her 2 year old son.

She wants to ask for a loan to buy display cases and display stands to showcase her products as currently her merchandise is disorganized. She wants her space to appear more like a store so she needs the display cases and stands.

Her dream is to be able to expand her business and make it known to the public as a place to buy goods. She will buy everything little by little. Samara has had two loans and has made payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy display cases and display stands.

loans.name: Luz Emiliana

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora que con mucho esfuerzo logro montar un restaurante puesto que tenía necesidades económicas que cubrir y opto por su pasión para generar dinero. 
Es una persona que quiere progresar y en su restaurante vende desayunos, almuerzo, y comidas por encargo, pero tiene una dificultad y es que no cuenta con mesas, sillas e utensilios para atender adecuadamente a los clientes, por dicha razón solicita un crédito el cual invertirá en sillas, mesas y utensilios buscando mejorar su restaurante y en realidad haciéndolo ver como un restaurante. 
Con el crédito espera seguir progresando atraer más clientes y tener mejores ingresos para seguir buscando su meta que es tener varios locales donde vender sus prodigiosos platos de comida.
texts.en:
Luz is a hard-working woman who with a lot of energy opened a restaurant. She had some economic necessities that she needed to cover and decided to use her passion for cooking to generate money. She is a person who wants to grow her business. In her restaurant she sells breakfast, lunch and dinners to order, but she has a challenge in that she doesn't have tables, seats, or utensils to adequately serve her customers.

Therefore she seeks a loan to buy tables, chairs and utensils to improve her restaurant, and in reality, making it become a restaurant. With the loan she hopes to continue attracting more customers and have better income to continue seeking her goal of having various locations to sell her delicious food.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and utensils.

loans.name: Analis

texts.en:
Analis is a 30-year-old, single woman from the town of Dulag, Leyte. She operates a sari-sari, (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like sugar, rice, canned goods, beverages, soft drinks and toiletries. Analis is also engaged in a food vending business. She sells homemade meals like pancit (noodles), stewed vegetables, chicken adobo, and fish soup. Her sari-sari store business started more than five years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy various stocks like biscuits, soap, rice, and soft drinks, and supplies like seasoning, meat and vegetables. These will help Analis generate more sales and set aside some savings for emergency purposes.

In the future, Analis hopes to expand both of her businesses to improve her status of living.

loans.use: to buy various stocks like biscuits, soap, rice, and soft drinks, and supplies like seasoning, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Felicisimo

texts.en: Felicisimo is 47 years old, married and has three children. He is a farmer, planting and harvesting rice to sell. He wants to keep achieving good crop production to save and use for his family's expenses. This planting season, Felicisimo is requesting additional capital of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides to use in farming. This will help improve nutrition for his crops leading to a better harvest someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides to use in farming

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Fely works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Fely is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Fely has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ameliza

texts.en:
Ameliza is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and pig fattening. Ameliza is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Ameliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Abel Antonio

texts.es:
Abel un hombre soltero de 25 años que siempre ha tenido preferencia por el emprendimiento, le gusta ser su propio jefe y depender de sí mismo, ayuda a su tía y hermanos que fueron las personas con quienes se crio y ahora quiere iniciar un negocio en el municipio de puerto salgar el cual es cría de ganado bovino en pocas palabras será productos de leche.
El negocio lo inicia como alternativa económica y será pionero en su sector buscando incentivar esta actividad entre sus vecinos. 
Con el crédito podrá comprar una vaca y así iniciar su negocio, se compromete a pagar puntalmente las cuotas, crecer y mantener su empresa en el tiempo.
texts.en:
Abel is single, 25 years old, and has always preferred to work as an entrepreneur. He likes to be his own boss and depend on himself. He helps his aunt and siblings as they are the people who raised him and now he wants to start a business raising dairy cattle to produce dairy products. The business is an economic alternative and he will be pioneer among his neighbors with this business.

With the loan he will be able to buy a cow and in this way begin his business. He promises to pay the payments punctually, to grown and maintain his business in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy a cow to start a business selling milk.

loans.name: Erickana

texts.en:
Erickana is a 70 year old hardworking married man with seven children living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He deals in livestock as his main source of income although he also practices the growing and selling of coffee, beans and bananas to earn extra income. He started this business with the intention of earning more profits and improving his standard of living. He faces the challenge of animal diseases that attack his cattle, however he has hopes of increasing the number of animals on his farm and becoming self sustaining.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for his farm

loans.name: Eseri

texts.en: Eseri lives in Kampala. She is married and has 4 children; 3 attend school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. She has sold charcoal on a retail basis from the market for 15 years. She works seven days a week. She earns additional income from rental houses. She is requesting 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings to buy bags of charcoal for sale. Her business challenges include transportation and seasonal changes. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a delivery van to serve more customers. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and medication.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Al Ahlam Group

texts.en:
Mona is the featured borrower for Al Ahlam Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Mona is a 29-year-old married mother of three children, who started four years ago selling clothes and accessories from her house to help her husband in covering their family’s increasing needs and expenses.

Today, Mona is acquiring a loan to increase her business merchandise with new released more fashionable products for the upcoming autumn and winter seasons in an attempt to satisfy her customers more.

With respect to the other group members, Fatima is a 34-year-old married mother of three children who wants to make some electricity extensions in her house, while Fawziya is a 39-year-old married lady who works selling clothes and wants to increase her business merchandise with more fashionable products.

Mona is the lady standing in the middle, Fatima is the first lady on the left, and Fawziya is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new released more fashionable products for the upcoming autumn and winter seasons.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a 46-year-old woman from the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. She is married with five children.The oldest child is 29 while the youngest is 12. She operates a variety store, and sells items like biscuits, noodles, eggs, bread, seasonings and soap. Her business started ten years ago. Due to difficulty in acquiring capital, Conchita  is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks like canned goods, soft drinks and toiletries.These will help Conchita increase her sales and will help meet her daily family expenses.

In the future, Conchita hopes to expand her business and increase the business' profitability to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like canned goods, soft drinks and toiletries

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Judy works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling rice and pig fattening. Judy is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Judy has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nora Eugenia

texts.es:
Nora, a sus 41 años de edad, es una mujer carismática y servicial que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició por la necesidad de generar ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. 

A pesar de las adversidades, ella tuvo la fortaleza y la determinación para levantarse y seguir adelante y, gracias a ello lleva 8 años de trayectoria en esta actividad.

Su propósito en la vida es seguir progresando y por ello desea fortalecer su negocio acreditándolo con la compra de surtido de productos como abarrotes, granos, frituras, bebidas gaseosas y en general productos básicos de la canasta familiar, de esta forma podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad y servicio, logrando aumentar notablemente sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de ellas.

Nora manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo con su negocio y, en un futuro desea convertirlo en un supermercado, en el que los clientes puedan encontrar todos los artículos que necesiten y así mejorar la rentabilidad y poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Apoyando a este crédito estarás contribuyendo con el emprendimiento de las mujeres Colombianas!
texts.en:
Nora, age 41, is a charismatic and helpful woman who works at her own business. She has a grocery store that she started because she needed to generate income so that her family could get ahead. Despite the adversities, Nora has the strength and determination to get up and continue forward. Thanks to her efforts, she has been at this business for eight years.

Her goal in life is to continue making progress. For this reason, she wants to strengthen the credibility of her business by stocking it with products such as groceries, grains, fried foods, beverages, sodas, and other basic household goods. This will allow her to offer her customers better quality and service. As a result, she can increase her sales considerably, as well as her income.

Nora says that her greatest wish is to continue growing her business. In the future, she wants to transform it into a supermarket where her customers can find all of the products they need. This would improve her profitability and allow her to provide a better quality of life for her family.

Supporting this loan will contribute to the entrepreneurship of Colombian women!

loans.use: to buy groceries, grains, fried foods, beverages, sodas, and other basic household goods.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Hello Lenders! Meet Jennifer, 39, a mother of 4 who has defied the notion among her friends that farming is an old-fashioned way of earning a living. 

Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs and farming. Jennifer hails from Kapsowar, Kenya, an area that enjoys favorable weather patterns and this boosts crop production in the area. Jennifer -- being someone who is very ambitious and someone who always takes advantage of positive things -- would like to capitalize on the good weather patterns experienced in the region and boost her farming. 

Being a hardworking mother, Jennifer has always ensured that she puts food on the table for her family. She also ensures that she is able to take her children to school. Jennifer detests living in conditions of poverty and she has a plan to improve her standard of living. This is why she is seeking a loan of 52,750 KES in order to be able to purchase a dairy cow. This will help in producing milk and manure to be used on her farm. 

Milk from the cow will be sold to the local market and this means improved cash flow. Through improved cash flow her profits will be higher and she can comfortably take care of her family and take her kids to school. Through your loan Jennifer will be empowered economically and be able to improve her standard of living and also those of people living within the area. Jennifer is very comfortable with the repayment plan and the monthly installments.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, steel laminate, and wood for his home's floor and roof.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married woman with children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan, she is requesting of KES 30,000 so she can purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 35 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace varios años, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar perfumes, desodorantes, cremas, shampoo, lociones, etc. para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is a 35-year-old single mother who lives in her own home along with her two daughters. She has been selling personal use products for several years. Ana sells as a traveling merchant in different neighborhoods.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy perfumes, deodorants, crèmes, shampoo, lotions, and other products so that she can continue her sales. As a result, she can provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, deodorants, crèmes, shampoo, lotions, and other products.

loans.name: Grupo Alfa Group

texts.es: Joyce de 20 años de edad es separada y tiene 02 hijos dependientes. Ella Pertenece a la Nueva Alcancía Comunal “Grupo Alfa”  la cual lo conforman 05 socios con deseos de crecer en sus negocios. Joyce hace más de 01 año  que viene desempeñándose al cuidado y limpieza de una guardería. Gracias a su constante dedicación Joyce puede cubrir con los gastos del hogar.  Su mayor deseo es estudiar diseño y modas. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de una laptop. La Nueva Alcancía “Grupo Alfa” agradece a los Inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Joyce es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo negro.
texts.en:
Joyce, 20 years old, is separated and has two dependent children. She belongs to the new communal bank “Grupo Alfa”  [Alpha Group] which has five members who want to grow their businesses.  

Joyce has been taking care of and cleaning a nursery for more than a year. Thanks to her constant dedication Joyce is able to take care of her household expenses. Her greatest desire is to study design and fashion. It is for this reason that she requested a loan in order to buy a laptop. 

The new communal bank “Grupo Alfa” thanks Kiva investors for the support provided. Joyce is the second from the left in the photo and is wearing a black t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en: Phiona is married with four children and all go to school. She has additional family members. She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cooking oil, beans, flour, and bunches of green bananas. She also generates additional income from selling soft drinks. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality. She aspires to buy a plot of land. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, flour, beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy brick, sand, cement, gravel, metal sheet and poles to build a washstand with a sink and the roof of her house.

loans.name: Marta Estebana

texts.es: Marta es una señora que por muchos años se ha desempeñado como maestra de educación primaria con 25 años de laborar, soltera, esta señora actualmente tiene la necesidad de resolver un problema familiar, debido a eso visito Ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en gastos personales y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Marta is a woman who has worked as an elementary school teacher for many years; she has worked for 25 years.  She is single. 

Marta now needs to resolve a family problem.  That is why she visited CEPODEL to request a loan, which she will use for personal expenses.  This way her living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to cover personal expenses to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa tiene 47 años de edad, es conviviente, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Carmen Rosa se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, hace 3 años, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio; ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; compra de pavos, gallinas, cerdos, cuyes el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor inversión de animales esto con la finalidad de incrementar su productividad de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Asi como de aumentar sus ventas, mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende obtener una mejora en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is 47 years old, lives in a domestic partnership, without children in her care.  She lives in her own home, in a rural area of Oyotún district, in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru. Her community earns its living primarily by agriculture, livestock, and trade.

Carmen Rosa has earned her living by raising and selling barnyard animals for the past three years, a business located in her home.  She is seeking a loan to increase her working capital; to buy turkeys, chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs. The loan will help her to increase her investment in animals. This is with the end goal of increasing the productivity of the animals and to satisfy the needs of her customers. In this way, she can increase her sales, improve her income, increase her earnings, and finally to get an improvement in her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy turkeys, chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs which will help her to increase her investment in animals.

loans.name: Domingo Antonio

texts.es: Domingo es un señor dedicado a vigilar la salud de la población, trabaja en el área de epidemiologia, con 7 años de ejercer dicha labor, casado con un hijo a su cargo al que le brinda el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo académico, actualmente tiene la necesidad de resolver un problema familiar, debido a eso visito Ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en gastos personales.
texts.en:
Domingo  is a gentleman devoted to looking after the town's health.  He works in the area of epidemiology and has seven years experience doing this work. 

He is married, with one child under his responsibility,  to whom he provides  the support necessary for his educational development. Currently, he needs to resolve a family problem and due to this he visited the Ceprodel office to request a loan, which he will use for personal expenses.

loans.use: To pay for personal expenses

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane, who resides in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur with her family, has  been farming for over seven years. It is the family's main source of income and, enables her to support her children and the entire family's needs. 

Mary Jane, who repaid her previous loan, recently requested a new one to buy a variety of seedlings, organic fertilizer and pesticides to have a productive farm. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, organic fertilizer and pesticides to have a productive farm

loans.name: Katia

texts.es: Katia, tiene la edad  de 28 años, está casada, vive con el esposo actualmente. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de materiales como pinturas entre otros, con el fin de hacer manualidades para venderlas en basaresy en la misma comunidad a sus besinos y con ello obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Élla no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Katia is 28 years old, married, and currently lives with her husband. With this loan, she intends to buy materials, such as paints and other supplies, for making handicrafts that she can sell in her community and to her neighbors. With the little bit of income that she earns, she is be able to improve her family’s living conditions and also accomplish some of her goals.

This is the first loan that Katia has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any previous loans from the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy paints and other craft supplies.

loans.name: Gatarakwa Great Vision Group

texts.en:
In 2013 Gatarakwa Great Vision Group joined Hand In Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on savings mobilization and enterprise creation and development.

The person raising her hand in the photo is Veronicha who is a member of this group. She is forty years old, married and living with her three children. She raises vegetables such as kale, spinach, tomatoes and cabbages and also does poultry farming.

She is borrowing a loan to buy certified seeds and chicken feed for her chickens. She is hopeful that the crop yield and her chicken production will increase. She feels that this will improve her income levels hence she will be able to feed her family and provide good clothing for her children and also pay their school fees.

Veronicha is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase planting seeds and chicken feed.

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia Irma continua dedicándose a la costura y alquiler de cuartos, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir con sus negocios para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de hilos, lanas de diferentes colores entre otros.
Irma pertenece al banco comunal “Velasco Astete” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Irma continues to manage her businesses of sewing and renting out rooms. She is a responsible and diligent individual. Irma has been in these businesses for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her work each day. She wants to continue with her businesses so that she can keep supporting her family.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy thread, wool in different colors, and other supplies. Irma is a member of the Communal Bank “Velasco Astete”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy thread, wool in different colors, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition and purchase educational equipment for her son

loans.name: Nonito

texts.en: Nonito settled for a living in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental with his family. To make a living, he operates a farm, his main source of income and has been doing this for over 20 years. He is a widow who is taking care of his children by himself. He became a member of Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a new loan to purchase seedlings, pay fertilization costs and cover expenses for cultivating the farm to have a productive  farm. In the future, he wants to have savings for his future needs.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, pay fertilization costs and cover expenses for cultivating the farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two sows, one boar and cement as part of SSLLP's piggery program.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
This is Dina. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used buy more products of processed meat, different kinds of fish and vegetables needed to increase her inventory. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan to purchase more fish, meat and fresh veggies that she needs in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Dina hopes that her business will continue to flourish. She also dreams that her children will be able to complete their studies and have a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fish, meat, vegetables, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a 27-year-old woman from the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. She is married with three children ages eight, six, and one year old, respectively. She raises and sells hogs. In addition to that, she also engages in food vending and has a gasoline retail business.  These are the sources of her income. Her hog raising business started more than five years ago. Belinda is asking for a loan to buy pig feed, supplies like meat, seasonings, vegetables and additional of gasoline. These will help improve Belinda's income in meeting her day-to-day family needs.

 In the future, Belinda hopes to expand her business and increase her business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, meat, seasonings, vegetables and gasoline

loans.name: Ulviya

texts.en: Ulviya has been married for three years and has a baby. She is 28 years old and lives in the Fuzuli region. Already 22 years old, her family members are IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Ulviya has been in the animal breeding business. She is such a hardworking woman and wants to increase her business. For this reason, she needs a loan of 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan, Ulviya wants to repair a stall for her cows. In the future, she wants to buy more cows. Ulviya says thanks to the Kiva organization and lenders for loan.

loans.use: to repair her cow stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for labor to tend to her coffee crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a room in her home.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru: Муборак живет тихо, мирно со своими 2 детьми и их семьями на Севере Таджикистана. Ее муж умер несколько лет назад, и она осталась вдовой. Муборак занимается выращиванием пшеницы более 8 лет. Она выращивает пшеницу на 2 га земли. Муборак также имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Она данное время откармливает 5 голов коров. Муборак сама выращивает корм для скота и поэтому она получает хороший доход от данного бизнеса. Она использует полученный доход для покрытия семейного дохода. Муборак запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки семена и минерального удобрения для осеннего посева пшеницы. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muborak lives quietly and peacefully with her two children and their own families in northern Tajikistan.  She is a widow; her husband died a few years ago.  She has been cultivating wheat for more than eight years.  She grows wheat on two hectares of land.  She also makes an additional income from animal husbandry.  At the moment, she is fattening five cows.  She grows her own livestock feed, and for this reason, she is able to make a nice profit from her animal husbandry business.  She uses her income to cover her family's expenses.  She is taking a loan of 6,000 somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers in order to sow wheat during the fall season.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers in order to grow wheat.

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.en:
Ikromjon is a kind and smart man. He was born in the year 1972. Ikromjon is the careful father of three children. He is divorced and cares for the  children alone. He is a highly educated person. 

Ikromjon works in a school as a teacher of the Uzbek language. He has worked there more than 22 years. He always tries to improve his knowledge. Now, he is going to get more highly educated and with this aim he has appllied to the university.  

After graduating from the university, Ikromjon will get the specialism of economist. He is asking for a loan to pay for university tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Sardar

texts.en:
Sardar was born in the year 1972. He has been married for 18 years and has a child. His child is going to the eleventh class and preparation for the  University. Sardar’s wife is a housewife and she helps Sardar in his business.  They are living in Bala Bahmanli village of Fuzuli region, but they are an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city. 

Sardar has been in the animal breeding business for many years. He makes cheese, yogurt, and other dairy products and sells these products. In this work his wife helps Sardar. Winter is coming and Sardar wants to buy hay and straw for calves.

Therefore he  has applied to Komak Company for a loan in the amount of 1500 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). For this aid, Sardar is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders.

loans.use: to buy hay and straw

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, two attending school. 

She has been selling fruits and vegetables in the market at retail for the last 15 years, working seven days a week. She also earns income from renting out machines for making popcorn. She has requested a loan of UGX (Ugandan shillings) 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more green and yellow bananas, tomatoes, onions, and fruit for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and changes in prices. 

Her dream is to buy land to start farming.She would also like to buy a fridge to start selling soft drinks. She joined MCDT because of the successful members of her community who are members of the SACCO. She resides in her own house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy onions, oranges, sweet bananas, and tomatoes

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 42-year-old woman, married to Brian who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three children.  Janet has been selling cereals for a period of ten years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Janet is now servicing her second loan of KES 22,500 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy additional beans and maize to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Janet plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have a bright future.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан старается обеспечить свою жену и детей всем необходимым. Хасан в течение 7 лет занимается животноводством, как и многие жители Таджикистана. Хасан решил начать новую деятельность, чтобы принести в дом новый источник дохода и покрыть растущие расходы детей. Он обратился за кредитом для приобретения маршрутки марки Starex с 10 пассажирскими местами. Он будет предоставлять услуги маршрутное такси. Для осуществления цели Хасана необходимы средства. Хасан верит и надеется, что ему помогут реализовать план и принести в дом дополнительный доход.
texts.en: Hasan works hard to provide all the necessities of life to his wife and children.  For the past seven years, and like many other residents of Tajikistan, he has been involved in animal husbandry. In order to have an additional source of income and to cover his children's rising expenses, he has decided to get involved in another activity.  He is taking a loan to purchase a 10-passenger Starex minivan, which will enable him to provide passenger transportation services along a predetermined route. Hasan needs money to achieve his goal.  He is hopeful that he will receive the support he needs to realize his project and to bring home a larger income.

loans.use: to buy a Starex minivan.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen, 37, is a mixed-farmer from Segero location in the Eldoret region of Kenya. She is also a committed wife and a loving mother of two children--a son and a daughter. In 2002, she started farming on a three acre piece of land. Ever since, she has grown a farm and diversified into a horticultural farming, poultry farming, and dairy farming. Her main sources of income come from the horticultural farm and poultry farm. 

Hellen is seeking a KES 37,225 loan to purchase a dairy cow. The acquisition of the dairy cow will significantly boost milk production in her farm. The additional milk will bring more profits that will be ploughed back into the farm for expediting growth of the dairy sector. The milk market is very stable and the prices are good. Income generated from this investment will go towards loan repayment and food security for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Mohammad Hafeez

texts.en:
Mohammad lives in Lahore. He is 31, married and a father of 3 children. He runs a general store in the local community. He is hardworking and spends most of his time at his shop. His business has been growing over the years and he has to replenish the inventory from time to time to make sure he doesn't run short and his customers are satisfied. Being the only person earning in the family, he wants to start saving money for his children's education.

He wishes to take a loan to restock inventory at his general store. He is hopeful that it will help him increase sales and he will be able to save some amount for the future.

loans.use: to restock the inventory at his general store with items like packs of salt, rice, flour, detergent, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Deep ravines and gullies gutting into hillsides define the rolling valleys within the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Soil erosion is a widespread primary factor degrading fertile lands within the area, causing loss of tons of fertile soils. 
'
Lenders! Meet Agnes, who is a middle-aged dairy farmer who hails from Kapsumai, a remote village in Kapsowar, Kenya. This lady has now become a passionate crusader and practical dairy farmer who went into farming early, when their area was still in the dark about modern ways of profitable dairy farming. For the past three years she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been milk and some variety of crops she plants. 

Proceeds from dairy farming have always not been enough to support her four children. Agnes loves to take care of her dairy animals and has even nicknamed one of them “Chelel,” which makes her a very proud farmer. Agnes is seeking a loan to buy an additional dairy cow so that she can fully utilize the space in her farm and so that she can seize the opportunity for the ready market of milk that is in her village. 

Through increased profits Agnes will be able to comfortably provide for her children and will also be able to secure a future for her eventual grandchildren. Agnes is confident that if you invest in her, she will be able to turn around her life; and with the accumulated profits, she will be able to open a large milk shop that will sell to both wholesalers and retailers. Agnes is patiently waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition for her youngest son

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar lives with his mother in a remote village in Dusheti, a poor mountain district in Eastern Georgia. They have a small farm where he grows potatoes, carrots and other vegetables. In order to produce healthy food of high quality, he does not use any chemical fertilizers or herbicides. He produces cheese from his own cows’ milk, too.

His clients appreciate the organic production method and pay a fair price. Some of them submit their order to Nodar via internet and he delivers it. He does the marketing for some neighbors, too and takes their produce to the towns.

Nodar will use the loan to buy seeds and to hire workers for the farm work in order to produce more organic vegetables. The additional manpower is needed because not using any herbicides means that the weeds must be removed by hand regularly.

The young man is looking forward to being able to earn a better income for himself and his mother and to boost organic agriculture in Georgia.

loans.use: to buy seeds and hire workers to grow more organic vegetables.

loans.name: M. Boota

texts.en:
M. Boota is 49, married, and blessed with five children. He is a shoe manufacturer by profession. He is skilled and his clients appreciate his work. He is hardworking and a responsible father. He has established himself well in the market. 

He makes different varieties of fancy and regular shoes. He has a small factory where he makes them. He has also provided employment to many individuals. 

He currently need  financing of PKR 150,000 to buy raw materials to make shoes. For this purpose he has requested for a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva field partner, to help him buy these materials and get the order made on time. He is hopeful for a successful and bright future as a businessman.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as rexene, leather, buckle, thread, nails, sole and glue for making ladies' shoes,

loans.name: Rejib

texts.en:
Rejib lives in a village in Mestia district together with his wife and their two sons. The photo shows Rejib with his 17-year-old son. Having studied agriculture, Rejib built a small farm in his remote home village, which lies more than 2,000 meters above sea level in the Caucasus mountains.

As his income was not enough to support the family, he renovated some rooms and opened a guest house for hikers and other tourists. Now Rejib and his wife use their own produce such as vegetables, fruit, dairy products and meat to prepare delicious meals for their guests. A greenhouse even allows him to grow tomatoes. This is a pleasure because most restaurants and hotels buy foodstuffs from far away.

Rejib will use the loan to renovate some more rooms so that he can accommodate more guests. In this way, he increases family's income and creates a good prospect for his sons. He would be glad if the boys stayed in their region of origin.

loans.use: to renovate more rooms to expand his guest house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to produce more Svaneti Salt seasoning.

loans.name: Rohatoy

texts.ru: Рохатой благодарит за поддержку за первый заем. Она надеется, что с таким же успехом ее профинансируют еще раз. Рохатой увеличила поголовья скотин и хочет еще раз получить кредит и расширит бизнес. На сегодняшний день Рохатой имеет две цели к которым она стремится. На первом месте иметь ребенка. Рохатой с мужем очень хотят иметь детей. Вторая цель расширить деятельность и иметь устойчивый бизнес и хорошим доходом. Рохатой просит Бога о ребенке и Вас просит поддержать ее в расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Rohatoy is very grateful for the support she received during her first loan, and she hopes to receive financial assistance again.  She increased the size of her herd and is once again requesting a loan to expand her business.  She currently has two goals in life.  Her first goal is to have a baby, as she and her husband really want to have children.  Her second goal is to increase her activity, so that she can have a stable business and make a decent income.  Rohatoy is praying God to become a mother and she is asking you to help her expand her business.

loans.use: to buy livestock and expand her business.

loans.name: Carlos Ovidio

texts.es: Carlos tiene 30 años de edad de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 15 años de edad y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Carlos se dedica a la venta de manteles y zapatos desde hace mucho tiempo. Con el deseo de mejorar las condiciones habitacionales de su familia  ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la conexión e introducción del agua potable dado que no cuenta con el vital líquido. Además, desea dar inicio a la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio para lo cual necesita comprar los materiales necesarios como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro, etc.
texts.en: Carlos is 30 years old and lives with his life partner, his 15 year old daughter and 2 year old son.  Carlos has been selling tablecloths and shoes for a long time. He's requested a loan to FUSAI with the wish to improve the living conditions for his family by investing in the connection and introduction of drinking water to the house since they currently lack the vital fluid.  He also wants to start building a bedroom for which he'll need to buy materials like brick, cement, sand, iron, etc.

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, sand, iron, etc to build a bedroom and for the drinking water connection.

loans.name: Juana De Jesus

texts.es: Juana de 31 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 4, 3 y 1 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que da lo mejor de sí para apoyar a su compañero de vida con los gastos económicos del hogar, apoyada en su pequeño negocio de venta de platillos típicos, los cuales vende desde hace más de 14 años por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que esperan ansiosos por sus productos. Juana es una mujer que siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y es por ello que desea instalar una puerta en su vivienda para darle seguridad, además desea reparar la pila de la misma ya que se encuentra deteriorada por lo que el agua que almacena se filtra y se pierde, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: una puerta, cemento y arena para instalar una puerta y reparar la pila de su vivienda.
texts.en: Juana is 31-years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and their three children, who are 4- 3- and 1-years old respectively.  Juana is an enterprising woman who gives her all to help her husband with the household finances.  She has a small business selling local fare.  She has been selling her dishes for more than fourteen years, and so she has a good quantity of customers who anxiously await her products.  Juana is a woman who is always looking for a way to improve her family's standard of living.  That is why she wants to install a door in her dwelling; to give her family some security.  In addition, Juana wants to repair her sink, as it is in disrepair.  The water she collects is filtered and wasted.  Juana is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in a door, cement and sand to install a door in her home and to repair her home's sink.

loans.use: to invest in a door, cement and sand for installing a door in her house and to repair her home's sink.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Doña Blanca tiene 63 años, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara junto a uno de sus hijos. Doña Blanca siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, lleva 9 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería como camisas, pantalones, sandalias, calcetas y ropa intima para damas y caballeros. Ella sale a vender a la comunidad y a las aldeas de alrededor. Esta solicitando un tercer préstamo a ODEF, el cual es por 13,000 Lempiras para surtir más su negocio, va comprar pantalones, ropa intima, blusas, camisetas etc. para poder vender más y obtener mejor ganancia. Su plan es hacer un local para el negocio y dejarles a sus hijos una fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Doña Blanca is a 63-year-old single mother who has three children. She lives in a neighborhood in Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara with one of her children.

Doña Blanca has always worked in trade. For the past nine years, she has been selling merchandise such as shirts, trousers, sandals, socks, and undergarments for women and men. She goes around selling in her community and in the surrounding areas. The loan she is requesting is her third one with ODEF. It is in the amount of 13,000 HNL and will be used to restock her business. She will buy trousers, undergarments, blouses, T-shirts, and other items so that she can sell more and generate a better profit.

Her plans include setting up a shop for her business and leaving behind a source of income for her children.

loans.use: to buy trousers, undergarments, blouses, T-shirts, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Florence, forty  years old and blessed with two children. She practices vegetable farming of cabbages, potatoes, and carrots. 

She is happy for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa enterprise management training she received which equipped her with skills to manage her business. 

She is applying a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. She hopes this will help in improving crop yield, and  thus increase income. This will enable her improve the living standards of her family which includes quality education and better clothing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Lucy, forty years old, married, and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to gain knowledge on group leadership, savings mobilization, enterprise creation, and financial management.

Her economic activity is dairy farming. She is accessing the Kiva loan to buy quality dairy feeds for her cows. This will increase their milk production hence more income. She will be able to provide school fees, food, and clothing for her family.

Lucy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To pay for dairy feeds.

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es: José de 24 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos una niña de 5 años y un varón de 6 años de edad. Él un hombre trabajador que desde muy temprano se esfuerza por salir adelante junto a su familia apoyado en su trabajo como jornalero, el cual realiza en una hacienda cercana. José siempre busca la manera de dar mejores condiciones de vida a los suyos, por lo que desea encementar el corredor de su vivienda para que sus hijos tengan un lugar donde distraerse, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento,  arena, grava y mano de obra para encementar el corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en: José, who is 24 years old, lives in his own house along with his life companion and their two children, a girl, age 5, and a boy, age 6. He is a hard-working man who since early on has exerted himself to get ahead along with his family, which is supported by his work as a day laborer, which he does on a nearby ranch. José always seeks ways to give better living conditions to his family, and for this reason he wants to cement the walkway of his home so that his children will have a place to play. For this reason he is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and labor to cement the walkway of his home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and labor to cement the walkway of his home

loans.name: Maria Gladis

texts.es: María de 35 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 4 hijos un varón de 16 años y 3 niñas una de 5 meses, de 14 años y 5 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que cada día se esfuerza por salir adelante junto a su familia, algo que ha logrado dedicándose a la venta de verduras desde hace mucho tiempo en los alrededores del municipio. María es una mujer que siempre ha buscado darle lo mejor a su familia, por lo que desea repellar las paredes de su vivienda y reparar las puertas de su vivienda, ya que estas se encuentran corroídas por la lluvia y el polvo, y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, hierro, lamina y mano de obra para repellar las paredes y reparar las puertas de su vivienda.
texts.en: Maria, who is 35 years old, lives in her own house along with her life companion and their four children, a boy, age 16 years, and three girls, ages 5 months, 14 years, and 5 years of age. She is a woman who exerts herself every day to get ahead, together with her family, something that she has managed by working in vegetable sales, which she has done for a long time in the surrounding areas of the town. Maria is a woman who has always looked for ways to give the best to her family. For this reason she wants to plaster the walls of her house and repair the doors, since they have been damaged by the rain and the dust. It is for this reason that she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, iron, metal sheeting, and labor to plaster the walls and repair the doors of her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, iron, metal sheeting, and labor to plaster the walls and repair the doors of her house

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es: María de 38 años de edad habita en vivienda propia desde hace 10 años, siendo reconocida en su cantón por ser una mujer humilde y trabajadora, ella vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos dos varones de 15 y 10 años y una niña de 7 años de edad, a los cuales ha logrado sacar adelante gracias a que presta sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar, además se apoya en su esposo que se gana la vida como corralero en una hacienda cercana. María desea mejorar la seguridad de su vivienda, y por ende de su familia, para lo cual desea construir una pared en su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pared en su vivienda.
texts.en: María, who is 38 years old, has lived in her own home for 10 years and she is known in her canton for being a modest and hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband and her three children, two boys who are 15 and 10 and a girl who is 7 years old, whom she has been able to get ahead thanks to her work providing at-home cleaning services.  She is also supported by her husband who earns his living as a farmhand at a nearby ranch.  María wants to improve the security of her home, and consequently that of her family, and so she wants to build a wall at her home, which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick, and rebar to build a wall at her home.

loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick, and rebar to build a wall at her home

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio has been operating his retailing business for many years and he earns well. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for his children. He and his wife work hard, with the determination of earning a better income to provide their children with a better education.
In order to increase sales, Gregorio is requesting a new loan for PHP 24,000 to purchase additional merchandise products to sell. These include more quantities of fish net, scotch brite, steel wool and other products needed in his business. He sincerely expresses his heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Gregorio hopes to increase his inventory and product sales. He also wants to help save for his children and give them a better future. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fish net, Scotch Brite and steel wool for resale.

loans.name: Almakan

texts.ru: Алмакан 50 лет, замужем, мать героиня 7 детей, самой старшей дочери Алмакан 29 лет, самому младшему сыну - 11 лет. У Алмакан - высшее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она с 2002 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Алмакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 3 теленка и 10 овец, также есть земельный надел мерою 1,50 ГА, где она выращивает кукурузу внутрихозяйственного потребления. Ежемесячный доход Алмакан составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). Этих средств катастрофически не хватает на содержание и воспитание детей, большинство из которых еще ходят в школу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Алмакан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, что позволит улучшить благосостояние Алмакан и накопить средства на образование детей.
texts.en: Almakan is 50 years old, married, and the "mother heroine" of seven children ["mother heroine" is an honorary title awarded for bearing and raising a large family].  Her oldest daughter is now 29 years old and her youngest son is 11.  Almakan has a university education.  Since 2002, she has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  Almakan has worked very hard to grow her business, and she now owns three cows, three calves and 10 sheep.  She also grows corn on 1.5 hectare of allotted land, for her family's own consumption.  She makes a monthly income of 7,000 som (KGS), which is vastly insufficient to support and educate her children, most of whom are still in school.  In order to further develop her farming activity, Almakan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy calves.  She is planning to use her profits from this loan to further increase her livestock headcount, which will allow her to improve her welfare and to save some money toward her children's education

loans.use: to purchase additional calves for fattening and resale in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, poles, and metal sheets to build a wash basin and a bathroom and replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en: Nulu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other members of the family. She has been operating a stall selling green bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes in the market at retail for 25 years, working seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to be able to buy more bunches of green bananas and sweet potatoes for sale. Her challenges include thieves and transportation. Her dream is to expand her business and buy land for farming. She joined MCDT because of good customer care. She stays in her own house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Vera, 54 years old, is a widow. Her husband died in the Karabakh war. She lives in Dilagarda village in the Füzuli region with her brother’s family. They have been IDP (internally displaced persons) from their native land of Füzuli city for 22 years. Vera has a few cows and she has been in the animal breeding business for 12 years. She prepares dairy products (cheese, yogurt, etc) and sells it in the local bazaar and to her neighbors to earn money. Today she needs 2,300 AZN to repair the stall for her cows, which is in danger of falling down. She is thankful to the Kiva organization for help.

loans.use: to repair the stall for her cow

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 42-year-old woman and a mother of a son and two daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a food stall; he sells different types of eatable items, e.g., samosa, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, Kabab paratha, etc. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Bushra's husband needs to purchase different types of eatable and other items for his business purpose so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not in the condition to purchase these items for his business purpose.

Therefore, Bushra has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purpose.
 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of ingredients for her husband's food stall.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Emmy. Emmy comes from Kapsowar, where she lives with her parents. Emmy has been a mixed farmer for three years. Her primary income sources are eggs, crops and some small business she engages in to make the extra coin. 

Emmy is most passionate about horticulture farming. She takes pride in being a part of the fastest growing agriculture industry category in Kenya. However, she is facing serious challenges brought about by harsh weather conditions. 

Emmy is seeking a loan to invest in the expansion of her horticulture farm. She sees a lot of room for improvement and growth. What is lacking is the capital to drive the positive change. With your loan, Emmy will make enough income to take care of her family and other farming expenses. She wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to give her family a decent living and afford for her children a proper education.

loans.use: To expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is 44 years old and married, and he has two kids. He is a refugee, as are all his family. They live in an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) settlement. He earns money for his family bringing up animals and selling their meat and wool at a local bazaar. He has been working in this area for five years and his monthly income is 220 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat). 

Azerbaijan people have been bringing up sheep and selling their wool from ancient times. They use their wool for sewing war jackets, blankets, gloves, etc. These things made from sheep wool are very warm and soft. Sheep meat is used to cook such delicious dishes as kebabs. People like eating kebabs on holidays and parties. 

Bilal wants to expand his business. Though husbandry is a good source of income, unfortunately, his income is too low to cover the life demands of his family. He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to buy additional husbandry animals (cows). He plans to produce and to sell milk and dairy products. Let’s help Bilal to reach his aim.

loans.use: to buy additional cows

loans.name: Jiya

texts.en:
Jiya is a 22-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of a daughter. Jiya has been running her own cosmetics selling business for many years and earns the income to contribute to managing the household.
 
She needs different kinds of cosmetics and other relevant accessories for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also be helpful for her to increase her monthly sales and profit.

Jiya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of cosmetics for reselling purposes.

loans.name: Evelyn Yaneth

texts.es: Evelin de 36 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 19 y 16 años de edad. Ella se esfuerza cada día para salir adelante al lado de su familia y es por ello que todos los fines de semana se levanta desde muy temprano para cocinar el maíz, el pollo y la salsa, para luego preparar los tamales que sale a vender por el municipio y sus alrededores. Evelin sabe que en su humilde vivienda faltan muchas mejoras para que sea un lugar más cómodo para habitar es por ello que ha decidido repellar las paredes de bajareque de su vivienda, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y mano de obra para repellar las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en: Evelyn, who is 36 years old, lives in her own home along with her life companion and their two children, ages 19 and 16. She makes an effort every day to advance alongside her family. It is for that reason that every weekend she gets up very early to cook corn, chicken and salsa to then prepare the tamales that she goes out to sell throughout the town and its surroundings. Evelyn knows that her humble home needs many improvements in order to be a more comfortable place to live. It is for that reason that she has decided to plaster the wattle-and-daub walls of her house, but she doesn't have the necessary economic liquidity. For this reason, she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, and labor to plaster the walls of her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, and labor to plaster the walls of her house

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a 33-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. With three daughters, her children are doing studies. Her husband has been running his own garments business for many years. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. 

He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Saira is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business purpose. 

Saira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of ready-made clothes for her husband's garments business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with two children, both of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She has a business of selling local brew from home on a retail basis and has been in this business for 10 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy a jerrycan of local brew, crates of beer and spirits. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires of buying a fridge to start selling other cold drinks. She decided to join MCDT SACCO because of good customer care. She has her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy a jerrycan of local brew, crates of beer and spirits

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: Vicenta de 37 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre de 73 años de edad. Ella es una mujer reconocida en su cantón por ser una persona solidaria y trabajadora que todos los días desde muy temprano presta sus servicios domésticos para dar un aporte a la economía de su hogar, además su hijo también le apoya económicamente gracias a su trabajo en una tienda de zapatos. Vicenta desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que este se encuentra deteriorado por lo que se filtra el agua al caer la lluvia deteriorando sus pocas pertenencias por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lamina galvanizada, polines y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, además pagará mano de obra para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Vicenta, who is 37 years old, lives in her own house with her mother, who is 73 years old. She is a woman who is recognized in her district as being a caring and hard-working person who every day from a very early hour provides domestic services in order to support the economy of her household. In addition, her son also helps her economically, thanks to his job in a shoe store. Vicenta wants to replace the roof of her house, since it is deteriorated, and so the water leaks in when it rains, damaging her few possessions. For this reason, she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, poles, and pins to replace the roof of her house. In addition, she will pay for labor to replace the roof of her house.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, poles, and pins, and in addition to pay for labor to replace the roof of her house

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en: Larisa is 50 years old. She is a careful mother of four children. Larisa is an entrepreneur. She sews and sells national mattresses in a local market. She has been busy with this business for more than 10 years. Larisa’s husband is a businessman. She and her husband work hard for the well being of their four children. Now her son is a student in the first course. She must pay for his tuition. She is asking for a loan to pay for the tuition of her son. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition for her son

loans.name: Zuleekha's Group

texts.en:
Zuleekha is a 51-year-old active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and seven children. Her husband has been doing his own dairy business for the past 25 years. He sells quality dairy products and earns an income to feed the entire family.

Zuleekha's husband want to purchase different items to increase the size of his dairy business, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to buy these items. Therefore, his wife Zuleekha has applied for a Kiva group loan with another member from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will financially assist her husband to purchase the items relevant to his dairy business. 

For this financial aid, Zuleekha is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of dairy products for her husband's dairy business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees and to buy a new bicycle for her son

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to complete maintenance of his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore Farzana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Farzana's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily. And provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Farzana also plans to make savings with the profit of her husband's income, to meet her family's needs in future.

Farzana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two children. Shazia provides sewing services and earns  income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods, such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, a machine and other items for her business but, due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and also help her to increase monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services.

Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy sewing accessories for her stitching business.

loans.name: Dayandur

texts.en:
Dayandur is 42 years old, married, and has a daughter. All members of the family live in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper and raises their child. He is a farmer and grows seasonal fruits (apples, pears, cherries, etc.) and vegetables (cucumbers, greens, potatoes, tomatoes, and so on). He sells all of these products at a local bazaar and earns 180 AZN monthly. He has been working in this field for five years and has good experience in gardening.

People like eating fresh fruits and vegetables because it is very good for their health. Beside that, people prepare different national dishes from vegetables and delicious sweet pies, cakes and jams from fruits. People prefer buying fruits and vegetables from Dayandur’s grocery. They visit it every morning in order to buy all needed produce, because his produce is always fresh and tasty.

Dayandur wants to expand his business and increase his monthly income. His current income isn't enough to cover his child's education and his family’s demands. He has applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to buy high-quality fertilizer and garden tools. This is his first loan.
