loans.use: to buy high-quality fertilizer and garden tools

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reina de 36 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 17 y 18 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia gracias al apoyo de su compañero de vida y de su pequeño negocio de pan francés, actividad que realiza desde hace 9 años. Reina es una mujer comprometida con el bienestar de su familia y es por eso que desea construir una pila y comprar el derecho para la instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro y pagará derecho de instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Reina, who is 36 years old, lives in her own house along with her life companion and their two children, ages 17 and 18. She is a woman who, thanks to her effort and tenacity, has managed to raise her family thanks to the support of her life companion and her little french bread business, a business that she has had for nine years. Reina is a woman committed to the well-being of her family, and it is for this reason that she wants to build a wash basin and
buy the permit to install electrical service in her house. For this reason, she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron and pay for the permit to install electrical service in her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron for a wash basin and pay for the permit to install electrical service in her home.

loans.name: Jabeena

texts.en:
Jabeena is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her son needs to make repairs on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance on a daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore, Jabeena has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Jabeena's son can afford the maintenance costs easily and provide better transport services to earn a profitable income. Jabeena also plans to save the profits from her son's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Jabeena is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To pay for repairs on her son's taxi

loans.name: Raulito

texts.en:
Raulito is a 29-year-old man from the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. He is married with a 10-year-old son. He raises and sells hogs. Aside from hog raising, he makes homemade ice cream and sells it to the nearby community. These are his sources of income. His hog raising business started five years ago. Raulito is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and supplies like cones and flavoring agents like vanilla and chocolate. These are very helpful in augmenting his income. 

Raulito hopes to expand both of his businesses and increase his business profitability for his child’s education.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and supplies like cones and flavoring agents like vanilla and chocolate

loans.name: La Gloire 2 (2) Group

texts.en:
At 24 years old, Aurore embodies the entrepreneurial spirit of Brazzaville’s youth. With her own small telephone credit stand and a side business selling female beauty products, Aurore has a big vision for the future. She hopes to one day have her own large shop selling everything from phone credit to food and clothing. In order to help achieve her dreams, Aurore joined the community bank group La Gloire 2 (2) in the spring of 2014 with HOPE Congo.  Now on her second loan, she is the leader of a subgroup of nine other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. 

Aurore would like to take out a small loan of 300,000 CFA through her community bank group to purchase additional phone credit cards and beauty products to re-sell. Aurore dreams of being able to travel to China and Dubai one day with her profits and buying new products to sell in Brazzaville.

loans.use: to purchase additional phone credit cards and beauty products to re-sell

loans.name: La Gloire 2 (1) Group

texts.en:
For the last three years, Aimé has been the proud owner of a small photocopy and print stand in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. Since photocopying is a popular business in Brazzaville, Aimé is full of plans to keep moving forward and distinguish himself from his competitors. He would like to buy a color photo printer to add a new dimension to his current services. In order to buy this printer, Aimé wants to take out a loan of 200,000 CFA through his community bank group La Gloire 2 (1).

Aimé recently joined HOPE Congo and is eager to take out his very first loan with a group of other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville. Helping lead a subgroup of ten people, Aimé has even bigger dreams for his business. He hopes to eventually have his own shop with offset printing, higher quality photos and printing on t-shirts. The father of two young children in primary school, Aimé hopes that they will be able to learn his business and eventually travel to other countries.

loans.use: to buy a color photo printer for his printing and photocopying business

loans.name: Sytha

texts.en:
Sytha (pictured here) is 40 years old and lives in Khsach Kandal district, along the Mekong river, Cambodia. She has been married since 1979 and has two daughters who attend school. 

Sytha has 15 years of experience as a silk weaver. She sells her product (Phamuong) to wholesalers in her village. Her husband is a motorbike repairman in the village. She decided to apply for a loan to buy silk for her weaving and to buy more material for her husband business too!

loans.use: To buy silk for weaving and material for repairing bicycles and motorcycles

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham is a 31-year-old man. He is married with a child who will go to the first class in the next year. They are living in Asagi Seyidahmadli village in the Fuzuli region but for over 22 years, Ilham has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from his native city of Fuzuli. 

Ilham has cows. He buys little calves, raising them and selling their meat at the local bazaar to earn money. Today Ilham has applied to Komak company for a loan of 1200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan, Ilham wants to buy more calves to increase business. For this help, he is greatly thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders.

loans.use: to buy more calves

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Her name is Rosalie, 23, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Married to Wilfredo, a carpenter, they have one child. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and send her child to school.

Rosalie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 400 a day.

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan, which she will use to buy grocery items such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, charcoal, soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are the source of meeting their daily expenses and sending her child to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Rosalie hopes to maintain and grow her business so she they could have a better life. She strives hard to give her child the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Kiva lenders! Meet Ruth, one of the most hardworking women on earth. She is 20 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter.  She hails from Kipsana, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin, but Ruth has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past three years. Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. Ruth passionately loves farming and has even nicknamed one of her cows “Brown”, and whenever she is milking her cow, she feels proud. She is contented with the farming way of life. Ruth is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her parents of a decent meal. The Kapsowar area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Ruth feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. Ruth is very disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children to come.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for three pigs (two sows and one boar) and cement

loans.name: Nageena

texts.en:
Nageena is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is 53 years old and resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. One of her sons has been doing his own business of engine buffering in the local market for many years. That is the only source of income for Nageena's family.

Nageena's son needs to buy a new buffering machine so that he can provide better buffering services to his regular clients. But due to insufficient financial means, he is not in a suitable condition to buy a new buffering machine. Therefore, his mother Nageena has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will financially assist her son to buy a new buffering machine for his business purposes.

Nageena is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new engine buffering machine for her son's buffering business.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok (pictured here) is 44 years old and lives in Khsach Kandal district along the Mekong river, Cambodia. She has been married since 1980 and has two sons and three daughters. One of her children is married and the others are a construction worker, a restaurant waiter and a hotel waiter. The last child is still young. 

Sok is a farmer. She has planted lotus with her husband for 10 years. In addition to planting lotus, her husband is a fisherman.  After discussion with each other, Sok and her husband decided to apply for a loan to continue their planting by using a loan to rent land and buy lotus and fertilizer.

loans.use: To rent land and buy fertilizer and lotus for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and buy educational equipment for her daughter

loans.name: Maria Idalia

texts.es: María de 30 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar que está compuesto por ella, su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijas de 1 año, 9 años y 13 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado sobre llevar de una manera digna los gastos económicos de su hogar por medio de su trabajo en un restaurante, además su compañero de vida apoya económicamente gracias a su trabajo de elaboración de estructuras metálicas. María desea construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda, que le aporte un poco de su seguridad a la misma y a su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un  muro perimetral en su vivienda.
texts.en: María is 30 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She has a partner and has three daughters, ages 13, 9 and 1. Thanks to her efforts and persistence, María has managed to help pay household costs through her work in a restaurant. Her partner also helps financially thanks to his work building metal structures. María wants to build a perimetre wall around her house; this will make the house and her family more secure. To do this work, María is applying for a loan from FUSAI that will be used to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a perimetre wall around her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a perimetre wall around her house.

loans.name: Ana Marisol

texts.es: Ana de 40 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 3 hijos de 20, 12 y 5 años de edad a los que está apoyando para que estudien, ya que ella desea lo mejor para ellos. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza por sostener la economía familiar con su venta de quesos y cuajadas, además esta laboriosa mujer hace remiendos y se desempeña como cosmetóloga en su vivienda en donde tiene un pequeño lugar ambientado como salón de belleza. Ana desea construir un cuarto para instalar en él un salón de belleza que le permita trabajar y estar cerca de sus hijos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro y mano de obra para construir un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en: Ana is 40 years old and lives with her three children, ages 20, 12 and 5, in a house that she owns. Ana is providing her children with an education as she wants the best things for them in life. Ana is an enterprising woman who works hard to support her family economy by selling cheese and curd. She also works hard doing repair jobs as a seamstress, and works at home as a beautician, where she has a small space set up as a beauty salon. Ana wants to build a room to set up a better beauty salon that will allow her to work and be near her children. Ana is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in sand, cement, gravel, bricks and iron and to pay labourers to build another room in her home.

loans.use: to invest in sand, cement, gravel, bricks and iron and to pay labourers to build another room in her home.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is married with four children and all of them go to school. She has additional family members. She operates a stall at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of sweet and green bananas and cassava. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring to educate her children to the university level. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy sweet and green bananas and cassava

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru: Человек с огромным сердцем доброты и прекрасной душой, который живет среди высоких Таджикских гор, нуждается вашей поддержке. Ее зовут Робия. Ей 48  лет, замужем и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Климат ее местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. Более чем 2 лет она занимается скотоводством. Она в основном откармливает баран. Робия хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  5000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода она собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Robiya is a woman with a huge and kind heart, and a beautiful soul.  She lives in the high mountains of Tajikistan and needs your support.  She is 48 years old, married, and raising five children.  The local climate is ideal for the cultivation of crops as well as for animal husbandry.  Robiya has been raising livestock for more than two years, mostly fattening sheep.  She wants to grow her business, but doesn't have enough money to do so.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni which will allow her to buy livestock and develop her business.  With the profits from her loan, she is planning to provide her children with a good education and modern technology.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy some cattle in order to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Bitochi

texts.ru: Биточи кредитуется во второй раз. Первый кредит она потратила полностью на оплаты учебного контракта внука. Битончи досрочно погасила задолженность, чтобы получить повторный кредит для оплаты нового учебного года.  Битончи верит, что ее поддержат еще раз и ее внук успешно закончит и этот год в Университете. Она видит, как ее внук проявляет большой интерес к учебе и всячески старается ему помочь.
texts.en: This is Bitochi's second loan.  She used the entire amount of her first loan to pay for her grandson's tuition.  She repaid that first loan ahead of schedule, so that she could get a second loan to pay for additional tuition fees.  Bitochi is confident that she will receive support again this time and that her grandson will be able to complete this new academic year at the university.  She sees how interested her grandson is in his studies and she is doing everything she can to help him.

loans.use: to pay for her grandson's tuition.

loans.name: Edwin Antonio

texts.es: Edwin de 27 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Él es un hombre trabajador que todos los días se esfuerza para salir adelante junto a su grupo familiar apoyado en su trabajo como motorista en el cual realiza viajes a diferentes lugares del departamento, lo que le permite sostener la economía familiar. Edwin desea construir una letrina de hoyo seco en su vivienda y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y cemento para construir una letrina de hoyo seco en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Edwin,  27 years old, lives in his own home with his family. He is a hardworking man who strives every day to succeed, together with his family, which is supported by his work as a motorcyclist who takes trips to different parts of his region. This allows him to sustain his family's finances. 

Edwin wants to build a dry pit latrine in his home and is therefore requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and mortar to build a dry pit latrine in his home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and mortar to build a dry pit latrine in his home.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma de 37 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su familia, la cual está conformada por su esposo y sus 2 hijos 18 y 16 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que desde hace 15 años se gana la vida elaborando y distribuyendo una gran variedad de cinchos para caballo, gracias a ello ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, apoyada también por su esposo que se desempeña como albañil y agricultor. Vilma desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que este se encuentra deteriorado por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Vilma, 37 years old, lives in her own home with her family, which consists of her husband and two children, 18 and 16 years old. She is a woman who, for 15 years, has made a living producing and distributing a variety of straps for horses.  As a result, she has been able to raise her children, supported also by her husband, who works as a mason and farmer. Vilma wants to replace the roof of her home, as it has deteriorated.  For this reason, she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheet metal, beams and nails to replace the roof of her home.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet metal, beams and nails to replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Evelyn Johanna

texts.es: Evelyn de 24 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 1 año y 6 meses de edad. Ella es una mujer que a pesar de ser madre soltera y tener un hijo pequeño no se ha dejado vencer y a buscado la manera de sacarlo adelante y darle lo mejor prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar con diferentes personas que le dan trabajo desde hace 4 años porque la conocen y saben que es una mujer trabajadora. Evelyn desea encementar el piso y repellar las paredes de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y mano de obra para repellar las paredes y encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Evelyn, 24, lives in her own house with her 18-month-old son.  Despite being a single mother with a small son she has been able to support him by working as a domestic employee for different people.  She has been in this line of employment for four years because people know she is a hard worker.

Evelyn wants to put down a concrete floor and put up drywall in her house and is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand and gravel and to pay the corresponding labor costs.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and gravel and pay labor costs for the drywall and concrete floor of her house.

loans.name: Maira Jeannette

texts.es: Maira de 36 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos una niña de 11 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando y un varón de 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida desde hace mucho tiempo vendiendo granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles y maíz los cuales distribuye en diferentes mercados en día de plaza, en el cual se permite que vendedores ambulantes vendan en los mercados. Maira siempre ha procurado darles lo mejor a sus hijos, por lo que desea reparar el techo de una parte de su vivienda ya que se encuentra deteriorado, y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, lamina y polines para reparar el techo de una parte de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maira, 36, lives in her own house with her two children, an 11-year-old daughter who is in school and a two-year-old son.  She is an enterprising woman who earns a living selling basic grains such as rice, beans and corn at different markets that allow street vendors to conduct sales.

Maria is always looking to give her children the best she can so she wants to repair a dilapidated part of the roof of her house.  Therefore she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand, metal sheeting and beams to repair part of the roof of her house.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, metal sheeting and beams to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Blanca Ester

texts.es: Blanca de 33 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 14, 12 y 6 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que desde hace mucho tiempo se esfuerza por sostener la economía familiar apoyada en su negocio de venta de diversidad de ropa, además buscando tener mejores ingresos repara motocicletas y vende repuestos, en este negocio le apoya el compañero de vida que también se desempeña como vendedor de una venta de muebles y electrodomésticos. Blanca desea encementar el piso de su vivienda y cambiar el techo de la misma por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, lámina y pines para encementar el piso y cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca, 33, lives in her own house with her life partner and three children, ages 14, 12 and six.  For a long time she has been supporting the family economy with her business selling different clothing.  To earn extra income, she also repairs motorcycles and sells spare parts with the help of her partner who also works selling furniture and domestic appliances.

Blanca wants to put in a concrete floor in her house and also change the roof.  Therefore she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting and prongs to carry out the project.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting and prongs to put in a concrete floor and change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks, detergents, rice, beans, sugar, butter, eggs, churros, vegetables, juices, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs and pay for labor to help with her coffee cultivation.

loans.name: Justina Yanet

texts.es: La señora Yanet trabaja en un colegio fuera de la localidad donde vive, desempeñándose como maestra de educación primaria con 20 años de laborar, tiene una Relación  estable  con 3 hijos a los que le da el apoyo para su desarrollo académico, esta señora  tiene una urgencia de resolver un problema familiar, del cual visito a Ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en gastos personales, los que le darán mejores condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: Yanet works in a high school outside of the town where she lives. She works as a primary school teacher with 20 years' experience. She is in a stable relationship with 3 children whose academic development she supports. She has a family problem she has to resolve urgently, so she visited Ceprodel to ask for a loan which she will use for personal expenses, for a better quality of life.

loans.use: personal expenses.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, está teniendo mayor demando de productos que ofrece en su tienda, y no cuenta con el capital suficiente para para surtir su inventario, por lo que se decidió por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar granos básicos, golosinas, bebidas, detergentes, jabón, etc., así seguirá atendiendo bien a sus clientes y ofertando productos con precios competitivos.
Con el crédito anterior su negocio ha crecido un poco, tiene nuevos clientes, sus ventas actuales le dan los recursos económicos con los que puede cancelar su deuda y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is experiencing greater demand for the products she sells in her shop and she does not have enough capital to stock her inventory. So she decided to request a new loan to buy basic grains, candies, drinks, detergents, soap, etc. and thus continue to serve her customers well and offer products at competitive prices.

With the previous loan, her business has grown a little. She has new customers. Her current sales give her economic resources with which she can repay her debt and cover the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candies, drinks, detergents, soap, etc. and thus continue to serve her customers well and offer products at competitive prices.

loans.name: Martina Adriano

texts.es:
La señora  Martina   de  65  años  de edad  es casada  y vive con sus hijas en su casa de habitación se dedica desde hace 25 años al negocio de pesca y venta de mariscos como ser: pescado blanco, rojo y palometa sus clientes son los habitantes de la zona.
 Doña Martina es  una mujer muy trabajadora ya que día a día  se esmera para sacar adelante a su familia y junto con su esposo contribuyen a mejorar su hogar él tiene lanchas de pesca y le trae el producto para que ella lo venda a un mejor precio.
Doña Martina está solicitando el préstamo para comprar de todo tipo de pescado y tener suficiente producto para la venta y así poder obtener más ganancias y sacar adelante su negocio y a su familia para que puedan tener un mejor futuro.
Su sueño es crecer más un su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Martina is 65 years old. She is married and lives with her daughters in her house. For 25 years, she has had a fishing business and has sold seafood such as white fish, red fish, and palometa. Her customers live in the area.

Martina is a hardworking woman who strives day to day to get her family ahead with her husband. They contribute to improve the home. He has fishing boats and he brings product so she can sell it at a better price. Martina is asking for a loan to buy all types of fish and to have enough product to sell so she can make more profit and get her business and her family ahead so they can have a better future.

Her dream is to grow her business more.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September of 2014.

loans.use: to buy fish for her business.

loans.name: Maria Elsi

texts.es:
María, tiene una venta de pupusas y refrescos, la cual está activa desde hace 20 años, su horario es de seis de la mañana a dos de la tarde, con su experiencia ha mantenido su negocio generando ingresos para subsistir, el oficio lo heredó de su familia;  la Sra. María es soltera, sus hijos ya son independientes, vive sola.
El préstamo le dará oportunidad de comprar harina, quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, tomates, condimentos, entre otros materiales para elaborar la venta de pupusas diariamente, con esta inversión mejorara su negocio, el servicio que brinda a sus clientes será mucho mejor y podrá tener nuevos ingresos.
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando, cancelar su deuda y hacer mejoras en la vivienda.
texts.en:
María has a business selling pupusas and beverages. She has had it for 20 years. Her schedule is from six in the morning until two in the afternoon. With her experience she has kept her business generating income to subsist on. she inherited this trade from her family. María is single and her children are on their own, so she lives alone.   

The loan will give her a chance to buy flour, cheese curds, cracklings, oil, tomatoes, seasonings, and other materials to make the pupusas every day. With this investment, she will improve her business. The service she offers her customers will be much better and she will be able to have new income. 

Her dreams are to keep working, pay off her debt and make improvements on her home.

loans.use: to buy flour, cheese curd, cracklings, oil, tomatoes, seasonings, and other materials to sell pupusas every day.

loans.name: Hazbleidy

texts.es:
Hazbleidy junto con su madre tienen una micro-empresa de confeccion, Hazbleidy inicio hace 4 años como operaria con una vecina quien la ayudo y la motivo a independizarse y buscar montar su propia empresa y hoy en día la tiene donde confecciona principalmente blusas en licra. 
Es una rubia muy emprendedora tiene 22 años de edad y un hijo de 6 años, este niño es la fuente de su inspiración y trabaja incansablemente por darle una buena calidad de vida y que nunca llegue a pasar necesidades.
Hazbleidy solicita un crédito para la compra de maquinaria plana pues la que tiene esta muy deteriorada debido a la antigüedad y ya que se le presenta la oportunidad del micro-crédito quiere tomarla pues no dispone de grandes recursos para comprarla. 
Su sueño es poder tener un taller lleno de operarias prosperar en familia y que su hijo crezca sano y pueda estudiar.
texts.en:
Hazbleidy and her mother have a sewing micro-business. Hazbleidy started it 4 years ago as an operator with a neighbor who helped her and motivated her  to go off on her own and open her own business. Today she mainly sews lycra blouses.  
 
She is a very enterprising blond woman. She is 22 years old and has a 6 year old son. This boy is the source of her inspiration and she works tirelessly to give him a good quality of life and so that he will never lack anything.

Hazbleidy is asking for a loan to buy a flat bed sewing machine. The one she has is very deteriorated because it is old and with this opportunity of the micro-loan, she wants to take it because she doesn't have a lot of resources to buy it.
 
Her dream is be able to have a workshop full of operators to prosper in her family and for her son to grow up healthy and be able to go to school.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to optimize her production time. The one she has is very deteriorated.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
This is Elsa. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. The loan was also useful in the education of her children. The income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

To further improve her sales, she would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available, the better. More items to sell will result in increased profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elsa hopes that her business will continue to cover their everyday needs. She always wants her family to be healthy and happy. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Isika

texts.en:
Isika is a married woman and has children entirely under her care. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Isika wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise her income.

For that reason, with the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase green vegetables, sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw to sell.

loans.name: La Mission (2) Group

texts.en:
Franck is a proud new member of the community bank group LA MISSION (2). Leading a subgroup of 11 other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo, Franck has his own hairstyling salon. As a single father of two, Franck has his hands full supporting his family in addition to his parents. In order to grow his business and increase his profits, Franck would like to take out his very first loan with HOPE Congo in the amount of 200,000 XAF. With this money, Franck will be able to purchase additional supplies for his shop such as combs, hair extensions, and foot baths. 

Eventually, Franck hopes to diversify his business to also sell drinks in bulk. He dreams of being able to move ahead in life and hopes that his children will be able to go far.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies for his shop such as combs, hair extensions, and foot baths.

loans.name: Srey Pech

texts.en:
Srey Pech is 40 years old, and a widowed mother with one son. Her old mother also stays with her.  She lives in Khsach Kandal district, along the Mekong river, Cambodia. Her son is a construction worker. 
Srey Pech is a silk weaver and commutes by motorcycle. Her last motorcycle was old and used too much gasoline, so Srey Pech and her son decided to sell it and ask for a loan to buy a new one. They hope that they can save the money from the new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for commuting her son to work.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 60-year-old man from the town of Mcarthur, Leyte in the Philippines. He is married with five grown children, and he operates a rice mill. His rice mill business started four years ago, and he renders a certain fee per sack of rice after it is milled. Aside from operating a rice mill, he also engages in buying and selling Multicab spare parts. These are his sources of income. Benjamin is asking for a loan to buy additional spare parts for Multicabs and pay for maintenance and labor. With these items taken care of, he would then continue to operate his rice milling business, thus create higher earning.
In the future, Benjamin hopes to expand both businesses and increase business profitability for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for Multicabs and pay for maintenance and labor.

loans.name: Marleny Elizabeth

texts.es:
Marleny, agradece el apoyo financiero que Kiva le brinda a través de Padecomsmcredito, pues con el préstamo anterior a mejorado su negocio y tiene su fuente de ingresos estable. 
Nuevamente solicita un crédito para comprar maíz, leña, chicharrón, quesillo, carnes, condimentos y otros ingredientes que sean necesarios para la elaboración de la venta de pupusas y tamales, espera tener resultados positivos y administrar bien el capital.
texts.en:
Marleny is thankful for the financial support that Kiva offers through Padecomsmcredito. With the previous loan she improved her business and has a stable source of income.  
 
She is asking for a loan again to buy corn, firewood, cracklings, cheese curds, meats, seasonings and other ingredients necessary to make and sell pupusas and tamales. She hopes to have positive results and to manage the capital well.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, crackling, cheese curd, meat, seasonings and other ingredients necessary for making and selling pupusas and tamales.

loans.name: La Mission (1) Group

texts.en:
Nuptia is both a young entrepreneur and a mother. In order to provide for her new family, Nuptia runs a business out of her home renting chairs for various weddings and events in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. In addition to her chair rentals, Nuptia also grills food to sell to at the local bus stop. One day, Nuptia dreams of being able to increase her businesses to the point where she can employ multiple people and even travel to other countries to purchase and resell items in Brazzaville. To achieve her dreams, Nuptia recently joined the community bank group LA MISSION (1) with HOPE Congo. In order to increase the profits from her business, Nuptia wants to take out a 250,000 XAF loan within her community bank group to purchase additional meat to grill and more chairs to rent out.

As a member of LA MISSION (1), Nuptia helps lead a subgroup of 12 other micro-entrepreneurs who also work in Brazzaville. In the future, Nuptia dreams of being able to change her way of life, especially by having her own home. She hopes that her baby boy will be able to grow up strong and that she’ll be able to send him to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat to grill and more chairs to rent out for special events.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for personal expenses

loans.name: Lissungui (2) Group

texts.en:
For the last five years, Saurel has worked hard to create his own businesses. The proud owner of a barbershop as well as a small business renting out carts for transportation, Saurel has dreams of one day building up his savings to also start a taxi business. In order to help increase his income, Saurel recently joined the community bank group LISSUNGUI (2), where he leads a subgroup of 11 other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. Saurel would like to take out a small loan of 200,000 XAF to purchase additional carts to rent out and to renovate his barbershop in order to  draw in more customers.

Through saving little by little, Saurel dreams of being able to go back to school in the future to study finance management. One day he would even like to own his own piece of land.

loans.use: to renovate his barbershop and purchase additional carts for his transportation business.

loans.name: Amour Et Vie (1) Group

texts.en:
As the single father of three children, Nestor has long run various business activities to support his family. For the last five years, Nestor has run his own drink stall, selling various sodas and juices to passersby. 

In order to increase his income, Nestor would like to take out a loan of 400,000 CFA through HOPE Congo. Nestor is currently on his third loan with HOPE Congo since joining the community bank group, AMOUR ET VIE (1) in 2013. Within AMOUR ET VIE (1), Nestor is the leader of a subgroup of ten other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, Republic of Congo. 

By taking out this small loan, Nestor will be able to develop his business further to become a grocery store, purchasing canned goods, soap and various other food items in addition to more drinks. Nestor dreams of a future where he will be the owner of multiple grocery stores throughout Brazzaville and be able to call himself a true businessman. 

One day he would even like to travel to the United States or Europe! He hopes to be able to give his children everything and that they will be able to find work in the future.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soap and various other food items in addition to more drinks

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Age 57, Alicia is a woman from the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. She is married with four grown children. She raises and sells hogs. Aside from that, she also raises ducks as another source of income.  Her hog raising business started more than five years ago. 

Alicia is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets, and feed for both ducks and pigs. With this, Alicia will sell more ducks and pigs and help improve her income.

In the future, she hopes to expand her both businesses to have a stable livelihood and improve their status of living.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, and feed for both ducks and pigs

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella lives on a hilltop in Kapsowar, Kenya with her husband and their two children. From her small, but immaculately clean mud house, she can see a lush valley full of maize, tomatoes, beans, and vegetables. She can also see a bright future, thanks to the income she earns through practicing mixed farming. 

Stella passionately loves dairy farming and has nicknamed one of her cows “Birir” (from a person’s name). Because of the immense farming knowledge, she has turned her farmland into an open university. Here, hundreds turn up to get trained in the hope that they will replicate her model on their own farmland. 

However the biggest challenge she faces is satisfying the demand for milk in her village. The demand is overwhelming. 

She is seeking a loan to buy another dairy cow. She believes that through the loan, she will be able to improve her living conditions and be able to secure the future of her children. Having gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo, she is confident that the skills she acquired will help her increase her business and she will be able to pay back the loan. 

Stella is confident that if you invest in her dream you will be impacting the life of her family and children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
This beautiful and elegant lady’s name is Silva. She is 65 years old, and she lives with her beloved husband in Kapan city of Syunik region. They have two sons and both of them are married and live with their families separately. 

Silva has a pedagogical education, and for many years she worked at the kindergarden. Now she works at the Vanadzor city’s big park as an inspector. As she says she likes her present work, despite of its being very different from her specialty. She says here she manages to meet all her friends and previous neighbors whom she used to meet very often when she was young. She says that she already knows and loves all the children and newborn babies that visit the park daily with their moms. 

After some repair work on their cute house, she wants a loan to buy new furniture for her kitchen.  The current furniture is too old, since she used it for a long 30 years.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for her kitchen

loans.name: Yasmina Daynesa

texts.es:
La señora Yasmira Daynesa de 30  años de edad, vive con sus  hijos se dedica desde hace 2 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, en su negocio vende frescos, churros, frijoles, arroz,  lácteos, jabón, pollo, azúcar, frescos de todo tipo y sabor, pan, azistin, confle, salsas, gelatinas de pelo, desodorantes, etc. vive  en la cuidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Yasmira Daynesa está solicitando el préstamo para poder comprar un frízer, nuevo y poder surtir a un mas en su negocio con otros productos, cuenta con una parte del dinero para la compra, pero necesita el préstamo para poder completarlo.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre de 2014.
texts.en:
Yasmira Daynesa is 30 years old and lives with her children. Since two years ago, she has had a business selling general groceries, where she sells soft drinks, chips, beans, rice, dairy products, soap, chicken, sugar, all kinds and flavors of soft drinks, bread, cleaning products, cereal, hair gels, deodorants, etc. She lives in the city of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. She is an enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead and fight day in and day out to improve her quality of life.
Yasmira Daynesa is requesting a loan to be able to buy a new freezer and to be able to stock her business even more with other products. She has part of the money for this purchase, but needs the loan in order to complete it.
Her dream is to have a good business, well stocked, and at the same time, to improve her future together with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2014.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for her business

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en:
This beautiful lady’s name is Syuzanna and she lives in Stepanavan city of the Lori region of Armenia. She studies at the Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute at the magistrates of the faculty of Pedagogy and Psychology, and she has been combining her education with her work for 2 years already. She works at the special school of Stepanavan city and she prepares developmentally-challenged children for school. She works with a special preschool program and being a psychologist, she manages to have good results in this difficult work. As she says, sometimes a specialist must work very long, properly and hard in order to see the results of the work; that is why she also has some children who attend private courses at her house.
Syuzanna asks a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer so she can find all the methodological innovations that can make her work with her pupils more productive.

loans.use: to buy a computer to make her work with her pupils more productive.

loans.name: Mejuma

texts.en:
Mejuma is a married woman with four children who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past eight years, she has operated a mat weaving for sale business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding and establishing a poultry business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase paints and sewing materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase paints and sewing materials.

loans.name: Lissungui (1) Group

texts.en:
Yvernele is a member of the community back group LISSUNGUI (1), and she leads a subgroup of 12 other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. As a young single mother, Yvernele has been selling palm oil for the last year and a half to help support her family, including her younger brother who lives with her. She sells palm oil in bulk and individually from her home, and Yvernelle is known for having high-quality products that keep people coming back for more. One of the biggest challenges for Yvernele is being able to transport her oil jugs, which cost 2,000 XAF per container. 

In order to increase her profits, Yvernele wants to take out her second loan with HOPE Congo through her community bank group. With this loan, Yvernele plans to purchase additional containers of oil. In the future, Yvernelle dreams of being able to finish her studies and start producing a steady income for herself and her family. One day, she even hopes to travel to the US to study.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of palm oil.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is 55 years old and she lives in Stepanavan city of the Lori region of Armenia. She graduated from Vanadzor Musical College - the vocal department. She has been working at the school for 34 years as a singing teacher. As she says, her subject at the school is beloved by nearly all the pupils and her lessons are usually very interesting, active and developing.  She also gives private vocal lessons at her house for the pupils who want to choose the specialty of singer so they will pass exams for studying at the Conservatory. 
Ruzanna would be happy and thankful to have this loan in order to buy a computer and also to buy very important CDs of famous classical musicians. Those items will surely help her to work with high quality and have good results in her students' exams.

loans.use: to buy a computer and very important CDs of famous classical musicians.

loans.name: Amour Et Vie (2) Group

texts.en:
For the last three years, Salvé has had her own used clothing stand in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. Primarily selling sheets and large cloths, Salvé uses her profits to take care of her family of four. This year, in order to increase her business, Salvé joined the community bank group AMOUR ET VIE (2). She is the leader of a subgroup of ten other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville and would like to take out her first loan with HOPE Congo of 200,000 CFA.

With this loan, Salvé will be able to purchase additional bundles of sheets to sell at her stall. Eventually she hopes to be able to start selling clothing as well, and dreams of being able to have her own shop selling used clothing bundles in bulk. One day, through slowly saving up her profits, Salvé hopes to travel to Paris.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of sheets to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Tigranuhi

texts.en:
Tigranuhi greatly wants to have a deal with Kiva for the second time, being so pleased with her first one. Tigranuhi is happy to inform us that she already has become a mother and she has a newborn son.  At this time her husband is again abroad doing various construction work. 

Now she is on maternity leave, and she organizes her pedagogical activities at her house with her 20 pupils. During the week her students take private courses from Tigranuhi in Russian Language and Literature, getting prepared for entrance examinations.

Tigranhui asks for this loan because she wants to furnish the room where she teaches the courses to her pupils. She will buy a big table with chairs and also bookshelves, for having a cute and comfortable workplace for her pedagogical occupation.

loans.use: to furnish the room where she teaches the courses to her pupils with a big table with chairs and also bookshelves.

loans.name: Sowed

texts.en:
Sowed, 45, is a married man with five children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in motor vehicle transport as his main source of income, although he also earns an extra income from his herbal clinic. He started this business to earn a living, have better standards of living and look after his family. He hopes to have another taxi although his main challenge is lack of enough capital to meet the increasing demands and poor roads. 

He is requesting for a loan to complete the construction of his boys' quarters.

loans.use: to complete the construction of his boys' quarters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her son’s tuition fee.

loans.name: Mahabbat

texts.en:
Mahabbat is 42 years old, married, and she has 3 kids. Her husband is a laborer. The family lives in an IDP settlement. Mahabbat is a good farmer. She raises seasonal fruits and then sells them at a local bazaar. Her monthly income is about 200AZN. She has been working in this field for 14 years and has good experience. 

People like eating fresh fruits. They use them to prepare juice or jam for tea. They also cook fruitcakes and other kinds of sweet things. People prefer to buy fresh fruits from Mahabbat because her products are cheaper and don’t contain pesticides.

Mahabbat is a good mother. She does everything for her kids. She wants her children to be well educated. She plans to increase her income and provide her children with as excellent an education as possible. She applied for 1,200 AZN in order to buy new fertilizers. She wants to raise and sell not only fruits but vegetables, too, in order to expand her business and income.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers.

loans.name: Kantutitas De Bajo Milluni Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “Kantutitas De Bajo Milluni” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de confitería, recolección de gomas, tejido de chuspas, servicio de construcción, venta de material de limpieza, tejido de chompas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alicia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de invitación de una campaña de promoción de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de paja y cebada; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicia al observar que en su zona aún realizaban la crianza de ganado y que este producto era necesario para la crianza de los mismos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semillas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la siembra lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Kantutitas De Bajo Milluni" communal bank is starting its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional hub. It is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors, of which Alicia is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include selling candy, collecting rubber, knitting bags, construction services, selling cleaning materials, and knitting sweaters.

This loan will benefit small business owners such as Alicia. She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer. She joined by invitation from a promotional campaign of the institution. She has a business selling straw and barley. She started this business when she saw that her area was still active in raising livestock, and these products are necessary for that activity.

She will use this loan to increase her capital by buying wholesale seeds from sellers in the city of El Alto. After sowing the seeds, she will sell the products in her sales location. This work allows her to earn an income to support her family, as she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training sessions offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wholesale seeds.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru:
Назира берет повторный кредит для своего торгового бизнеса. Она успешно погасила свой первый кредит и теперь для развития бизнеса она снова нуждается в заемных средствах. Назира хочет закупить новый ассортимент мужских национальных одеяний для увеличения объема продаж. Для реализации цели Назире не хватает 1500 долларов США и эту сумму она запрашивает в кредит. 
Назира благодарит кредиторов Kiva за поддержку ее первого займа, который она также использовала на расширение бизнеса. Назира надеется, что и на этот раз Вы ее поддержите. Она верит в вашу отзывчивость.
texts.en: Nazira is taking out a second loan for her retail business. She successfully repaid her first loan and needs another to expand her business. Nazira wants to purchase a new stock of traditional men's clothing to increase her sales. She needs a loan of $1,500 USD to achieve her goal. Nazira thanks the Kiva lenders for their support of her first loan, which she also used to expand her business. She hopes that you will support her this time. She has faith in your kindness.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of Tajik traditional men's clothing to develop her retail business.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 49 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 8 children. He is a mason and has been in this business for 10 years. 

He will be using this loan to buy masonry tools such as trowels, plumb lines, and plastering tools. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

This is his third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he repaid his previous loans successfully. His future hopes are to expand his business and make more income and be able to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more masonry tools.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a twenty-nine-year-old, hardworking, married man with two children aged 3 and 1 years, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce, selling coffee and maize as his main source of income, and practices farming and boda boda (bike taxi) transport as a source of extra income. 

He was inspired to start these businesses to look after his children and improve his standard of living. He hopes to become a rich man in the future, though he faces the challenge of price fluctuations of agricultural produce.

He is requesting a loan to buy more coffee and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more coffee and maize to sell.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is a thirty-eight-year-old, hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farming, a business he started so as to improve his standard of living. 

He hopes to become a modernized farmer. However, his main challenge is the lack of capital to buy seedlings. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and manure for his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for his farm.

loans.name: Kaligenda

texts.en:
Kaligenda, who sells produce, is a hardworking married man of 35 years living in Kagadi, Uganda. He desires to grow his business despite the challenges of competitions from similar businesses for market share, and the poor roads that hinder his service delivery. 

Kaligenda is asking for a loan to buy maize for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize for selling.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
This is Mwanamisi. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more ingredients for her business. Her business keeps on growing. She works hard to provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for Kes 10,000 to buy more stock of food ingredients such as onions, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for her business. 

The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food ingredients such as onions, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Reyna De La Paz

texts.es:
Reyna tiene 53 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, tiene 4 hijos los cuales están acompañados y viven aparte,  vive con su esposo el cual trabaja como jornalero.

Reyna se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, actividad que realiza en su casa todos  los días, ya tiene 10 años de experiencia en este rubro y lo aprendió de su madre, además Reyna vende platos típicos como tamales.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar maíz para la elaboración de tortillas y así producir mas para tener mayores ingresos para cubrir sus gatos.

Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y contar con buena salud para lograr sus propósitos.
texts.en:
Reyna, 53, has a fifth-grade education.  She has four children who are married and live on their own.  She lives with her husband, who works as a day laborer.

Reyna earns a living making and selling tortillas, and she works at home every day.  She has 10 years of experience in this line of work, having learned it from her mother.  Reyna also sells traditional dishes like tamales.

She needs the loan to buy corn to make more tortillas and to earn more income to cover her expenses.

Her dream is for her business to grow and to be in good health so she can achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a widowed woman from Iraq who is 35 years old and has three children. She lives with her dad and works hard to help with the family's income. 

She is a seamstress and works from home. She has practiced tailoring since she was a child, but in 2007 she started sewing clothes for the purpose of making a living. She has good experience in this field and a good reputation in the surrounding area.

Fatima is requesting a loan of 1,800 USD. She will use this loan to buy 2 specialized sewing machines. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to grow her business and increase her profits. In doing so, she will be able to provide her family a comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy two specialized sewing machines.

loans.name: Durdiniz

texts.ru: Дурдиниз благодарит за поддержку за первый кредит http://www.kiva.org/lend/621949. Она надеется, что с таким же успехом ее профинансируют еще раз. Деятельность Дурдиниза продвигается хорошо, ее дочери помогают ей во всем. На этот раз она просит ей помочь отремонтировать дом и купить мебель, чтобы подготовиться к зиме. Она поспешно собирает деньги, чтобы закончить ремонт, но понимает, что ей необходимы еще денежные средства. Дурдиниз полагается за Вашу поддержку. Помогите ей закончить ремонт до зимы.
texts.en: Durdiniz is grateful for the support of her first loan: http://www.kiva.org/lend/621949. She hopes that she will be successful with her next loan. Her business is going well and her daughter is helping her with everything. This time she is asking for a loan to help her repair her house and buy furniture to get ready for winter. She is quickly getting together the funds to finish the repairs, but has realized that she will need more money. She is relying on your support to help her finish the repairs before winter.

loans.use: to finish home repairs and to buy furniture

loans.name: Seadet

texts.en:
Seadet is 31 years old and married with a daughter and a son. Her husband earns money for the family working as a laborer. The members of the family are refugees and have lived in an IDP settlement for a long time. 

Seadet has been working as a farmer for 10 years and has good skills in this area. She grows fig trees and then sells the figs at a local bazaar. For this, she gets about 150AZN monthly.

Figs are a very useful and tasty fruit. With figs, the Azerbaijan people prepare jams for dessert with tea. They use it as a liqueur when they catch a cold.  Dried figs are also very useful for good health.
 
Seadet needs money to make her garden better. She wants to build a greenhouse for fig trees to protect them from severe weather. Besides that, she wants to expand her business and increase her income. She needs to cover her family’s living expenses and the children’s education. 

She applied for 1,500 AZN in order to buy other fruit trees and raise them.

loans.use: to buy other fruit trees and raise them.

loans.name: Ovsanna

texts.en: Ovsanna is 41 years old and lives in the village of Tsovagyugh in Gegharkunik, Armenia. She is married and has a son and daughter. The entire family is engaged in farming and they support and help one another with everything. On her farm Ovsanna has five cows, three calves, two bulls, two pigs and six piglets. Ovsanna says her family is happy with its peasant life and rich farm, but they work a lot and any help is useful. From her farm she sells a lot of milk, as well as some other dairy products she makes (cheese and curd) and meat. Ovsanna would like to enlarge her farm and for that reason she made a decision to cooperate with Kiva. She is requesting a loan of 600,000 Armenian Drams in order to buy a cow and a lot of animal fodder, which she will add to what she has already started to store for the winter months.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a lot of animal fodder.

loans.name: Kyabaguda Twekambe Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel, a married man, earns from produce, alcohol, and growing maize and Irish potatoes for commercial purposes in Kagadi, Uganda. He is a member of Kyabaguda Twekambe Group where each member guarantees the others to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities. 

He is hopeful for the expansion of his businesses and educating his children due to the fact that he is hardworking. Despite being challenged by price fluctuations, Emmanuel is requesting a loan to buy alcohol for selling.

loans.use: to buy alcohol for selling.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a 48-year-old married woman from Dulag, Leyte. She has one grown-up child. Her husband worked as a welder operator to support their family. 

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store, and sells items like noodles, biscuits, soap, coffee, seasonings, and canned goods. Her business started four years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy a variety of merchandise like shampoo, cooking oil, canned goods, coffee, and soft drinks. These will help Mercedita  sell more supplies and eventually help answer her every day needs.

Mercedita hopes that someday she can expand her sari-sari store business for a better and stable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a single mother of four children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (brother and sister). 

She has a business of a bar and has been in this business for 7 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more jerrycans of local gin as well as crates of beer and soda. 

Rose works in a shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked bar and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. 

Rose decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of their good customer care. She resides in a rented house where the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy jerrycans of local brew and crates of beer.

loans.name: Tulibamu Paacwa Group

texts.en:
Margret is a 29-year-old married and hardworking woman living in Kagadi-Uganda. She has been tailoring and operating a beauty salon since 2010 and also farming to earn a living. She has hopes for business growth and wants to educate her children. 

She is a member of the Tulibamu Paacwa Group where each member guarantees the others to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities. Margret is asking for a loan to buy salon items to sell.

loans.use: to buy salon items to sell.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony, who sells motorcycle spare parts and electronics and farms to cater to his family's needs, is a hardworking Ugandan married man aged 30 years. 

Anthony desires to grow his business but he is challenged by insufficient capital. However, he is getting credit to buy motorcycle spare parts for selling.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts for selling.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 41 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos dependientes. Pedro vive con su madre que se encuentra de muy avanzada edad; en el caserío de Ñuruñupe del distrito de San Felipe, el caserío de Ñuruñupe es un caserío mediano con aspiraciones a superarse, el cual se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de San Felipe, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. En dicho distrito sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de maíz, el cual se encuentran con 30 días de sembrado, dichos productos son comercializados en el distrito de San Felipe, dichos cultivos se encuentran en muy buen estado, Pedro cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en la agricultura, además se dedica al cultivo de pan llevar como son yuca, frejol, etc. los cuales son para su consumo, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. El destino del crédito es para invertir en su negocio, pues desea realizar el mantenimiento de su cultivo de maíz para poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su producción y de esta manera poder venderlo a un mejor precio, aumentando sus ingresos, mejorando su caldiad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 41 years old and single. He doesn't have any dependent children. Pedro lives with his mother, who is of a very advanced age, in a hamlet called Ñuruñupe in the district of San Felipe. Ñuruñupe is a medium-sized hamlet with aspirations of bettering itself. San Felipe is located in the province of Jaén, which is in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Perú. The principle activities of the district are agriculture, commerce and livestock. 

Pedro makes a living farming and he currently has maize crops which he sowed 30 days ago. He sells his maize in the San Felipe district and his produce is of a very high quality. Pedro has more than 10 years experience in agriculture and he also grows basic food crops, like yuca, beans, etc. for his own consumption. He has very good references, both personal and working. 

The loan is destined to be invested in his business, since he wishes to carry out maintenance on his maize crop in order to make more profits and so improve his production. In this way he will be able to sell his crops at a better price. improve his income and so improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain his maize crop in order to make more profits and improve his production.

loans.name: Muong Phang 5 Group

texts.en:
Muon is a Thai lady at the age of 32 and is married with two children: one girl and one boy. They have lived in a Thai traditional house in a remote village for 10 years. Her son is studying at grade 12 and her daughter is at grade 2 with good results. 

The income of the family mainly comes from working on the farm, cultivating rice and vegetables. To have additional income, Muon raises chickens and fish while her husband does extra work for the local construction employers or is hired to harvest the rice paddy in an employer's field. 

Muon believes that education is a good way to escape from poverty, so she has been trying to develop the agriculture activities to have more earnings so that her children can go further in the studying path. For that reason, Muon chooses to take part in Anh Chi Em to benefit the from the program's services including loans and training. This is the fourth loan she has taken out from Anh Chi Em, and this time she will use the loan to buy small fish. In the previous loan, Muon also bought small fish but her business didn't work well because of disease. 

She hopes that, with the support from the socio-economic team of Anh Chi Em, her investment will be successful this time. In the picture, Muon is smiling and standing first from the right.

loans.use: to buy small fish

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a 24-year-old single man from a village near Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. Two years ago, Noor opened his own project, which is a store for car washing and selling car supplies. It is a good business and the income is high. 

Noor took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools for washing cars and other supplies for his store. By taking this loan, Noor will be able to improve his store and serve more clients. 

Noor appears in the photo while he was working

loans.use: to buy new tools for washing cars and other supplies for his store.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has a hardware store and has been running this business for 10 years now. He sells wood paints and vanish and also timber for making wooden tables and chairs. He is 28 years old, single and has no children.

He will use this loan to buy more stock of hardware materials such as timber, nails, ceiling boards, painting brushes and wood glue. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and in the future, he hopes to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy hardware materials to sell.

loans.name: Pascalina

texts.en:
Pascalina has a grocery business in Machakos town and has been running this business for 10 years now. 

She is 35 years old, married, and she and her spouse have been blessed with three children.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of potatoes, tomatoes and onions to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and service the loan.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her hopes are to have a prosperous business and a happy family in future.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is a 35-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He still deals in produce, selling maize and coffee as his main source of income, though he has other side businesses like farming and a retail shop where he earns an extra income. 

He started this business to educate his children, sustain his family and have a better standard of living. He has challenges of inadequate capital and weather changes that affect his produce business; however, he has a vision of becoming a prominent businessman.

Abel is requesting a loan to buy more maize and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Maria Marleny

texts.es:
María, está pensando en seguir fortaleciendo su negocio y necesita capital para comprar variedad de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños/as, así como también concentrado para cerdos, se le facilitara continuar desempeñando sus actividades económicas y satisfaciendo a sus clientes.
El impacto que ha tenido en su negocio con el crédito anterior ha sido positivo, ya que ha pedido comercializar ropa en otras zonas, que antes no podía cubrir, con los nuevos ingresos a iniciado a criar cerdos para luego comercializarlos.
texts.en:
María's thinking about strengthening her business and she needs capital to buy a variety of clothes for women, men, and children, as well as concentrated pig feed.  This will allow her to keep on doing her job and satisfying her customers.

The previous loan had a positive impact on her business because she has been able to sell clothing in areas she couldn't previously cover.  With the new income, she has started to raise pigs for later sale.

loans.use: to buy clothing and concentrated pig feed

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is 49 years old. She and her husband are farmers and have three children. She is very hardworking and kind-natured. She has a lot of friends and all of them love her very much.

Munira has been farming for 10 years, producing watermelons, tomatoes, onions and crops. Her products are sold at the local market in the city. With the previous loan she obtained, she has been able to invest in her crops.

In order to provide her crops with the needed attention, Munira is currently requesting another loan in the amount of 8,000 somoni to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds and fuel, and to pay for rental workers. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers, seeds and fuel, and to pay for rental workers

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is a 21-year-old single man from Nablus city. He lives with his parents and brothers in a small house. His father works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Salah is a student in his last year, studying business administration. He would like to take a BA degree and find a job to help his family in part of their expenses.

Salah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Salah will be able to write his seminars and reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Virginita

texts.en:
Virginita is a 50-year-old woman from the town of Dulag, Leyte. She is married with five children. The oldest child is 30, while the youngest is 4 years old. 

She engages in the buying and selling of pigs. Her business started almost a year ago. Her husband is doing the same business. Virginita is asking for a loan to buy additional pigs to resell. 

In the future, Virginita hopes to expand her business to open up a barbeque stall, and eventually, she would be able to continue financing the studies of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 34 years old and married. Together with his spouse, he has been blessed with two children. He has a tailoring shop, and he has been in this business for the past 15 years. 

He plans to use this loan to buy more stock of textile materials for use in his business. He will use the anticipated profits to add more stock of sewing materials and educate his children. 

This is Joseph's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and his future hopes are to grow his business and supply tailoring materials to other tailoring shops.

loans.use: To buy textile materials for use in his business.

loans.name: Fabiano

texts.en:
Fabiano is a 58-year-old hardworking married man with 17 children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He used his previous loan to buy more cattle for fattening. His still deals in cattle grazing and fattening alongside farming where he earns a living. He started this business to look after his family and educate his children. 

He still faces hardships of inadequate capital to expand his business and seasonal changes, especially drought.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Fred
