texts.en: Fred is a hard-working, married man with seven children between the ages of 20 and 26 years. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. Fred is a farmer who grows a variety of crops, including sugar cane, bananas and beans. He started this business because it was easy for him to begin and he wanted to earn a living. Fred also earns extra income from livestock. He hopes to increase his crop production but his main challenge is poor climate. Fred is requesting a loan to buy manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, who is a 49-year-old married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda, used her previous loan to pay school fees for her children. 

She still deals in the selling of second-hand clothes as her main source of income, alongside agriculture. The reason why she started these businesses was to earn a living and look after her family. She still faces a challenge of competition, seasonal customers, and the high rate of inflation, but has hopes of becoming a prominent businesswoman.

She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anita Shg Group

texts.en:
In a town located in the forest area of Koraput district of Odisha, a lending group was formed, comprising ten hard-working, responsible, caring, and empathetic women, who struggle each day to provide the best to their families. The group is called “Anita Self-Help Group.” The members consider themselves family, and are always there for each other. They are grateful for the support provided by Peoples Forum in granting them loans to invest in their businesses. 

The group is located in an area where the main industry is the production of tumeric, mango and maize. 

Kumari, the lady standing with her hand raised, has made a living selling vegetables during the morning and evening for eight years. She is a cheerful and kind person. She lives with her husband and five children. Kumari also helps her husband by working in the field to produce maize, and more recently, vegetables. 

Kumari will use her loan to buy big baskets for holding vegetables and to rent a place for vegetable selling in a near market to continue selling vegetables. She wants to use her earnings to invest in the children's education and to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy big baskets for holding vegetables and to rent a place for vegetable selling in a near market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wood, and nails, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan, a married man with three children, started selling produce in 2009 alongside farming as his source of income in Kagadi, Uganda. 

Because he is hardworking and honest, he desires to construct a permanent house despite delayed payments by debtors. 

Dan intends to use credit to buy maize and cassava for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize and cassava for selling.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben, a 33-year-old married man with eight children, operates a clothing shop and a banana plantation in Kagadi, Uganda, to earn income. 

He used the previous loan to buy clothes for resale. Ben desires to grow his business. 

Despite being hardworking, he is challenged by changes in fashions and lack of enough capital to maintain his business. 

Ben is requesting credit to buy clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Katweimukye Farmers Kaisobakara Group

texts.en:
Vicent, an honest married man with five children living in Kagadi Uganda, is age 61 years. 

He started selling bicycle spare parts in 2001 alongside farming to earn a living. He wishes to increase his stock despite an insufficient market. 

He is a member of Katweimukye Farmers Kaisobakara where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

Vicent is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for selling.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for selling.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is a married woman with a 7-year-old son from Mcarthur, Leyte. Her husband works as a carpenter to provide for them. Lani, on the other hand, has been engaged in her sari-sari (variety) store business for four years now. In her store, she sell canned goods, candies, shampoo, bath soap, seasonings and condiments. 

She would like to expand her business and buy more stock to offer more to her customers. She is asking for a loan to buy shampoo, canned goods, chips, bath soap, candies, detergent and soft drinks. Lani hopes that she can attract more customers once her store's stocks are replenished.

In the future, she hopes to send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, canned goods, chips, bath soap, candies, detergent and soft drinks

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru:
Ее зовут Гуландом. Ей 47 лет. Она замужняя женщина и мать четверых детей. Гуландом вместе с семьей проживает на районе Вахш. Вахш находиться на южной части Таджикистана и является довольно теплой стороной  Таджикистана. 
    Гуландом около 10 лет работает в сфере торговли пищевых продуктов. Гуландому нравиться работать в данной сфере и хочет расширить свой бизнес. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом, для купли и привозки нового товара в родной район Вахш. Гуландом очень ответственный и честный человек, она обещает выплачивать кредит в срок. Поддержите Гуландом.
texts.en:
This is Gulandom. She is 47, married, and the mother of four children. She and her family live in Vakhsh, the warmest region of southern Tajikistan.

Gulandom has about ten years of experience in selling food products. She likes her work and wants to expand her business. For this reason, she applied for a loan to buy and import new products in her home region of Vakhsh. She is a very responsible and honest person and promises to repay the loan on time. Support Gulandom.

loans.use: to purchase and import goods for her business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 31 years. She is married to Jeremiah and together they have been blessed with two children of 2 and 4 years.

Florence operates two businesses: farming and a salon. She has done this for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

Florence has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 40,000, which she will use to purchase chicken marsh (feed for chicks) for her poultry.

With the anticipated profits, Florence will be able to educate her children. Her dream for the future is to have a stable life.

loans.use: to buy chicken marsh.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arceli is 46 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Arceli has a food vending business in the Philippines. Arceli requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Arceli has been in this business for 1 year. Arceli would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Masemo

texts.en:
Masemo operates an ice cream business. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. 

She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation and also seasonality. 

She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase sugar, milk and other ice cream ingredients. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk and other ice cream ingredients.

loans.name: Kellin

texts.en:
Kellin is a married mother who lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and water.

For the past three years, she has operated an agricultural selling business, selling farm produce from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of disease outbreak leading to losses. She dreams of expanding her business to generate more income. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase more seedlings and pesticides. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es: Guadalupe de 36 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos. Guadalupe se dedica a la venta de leche de vaca desde hace cuatro años lo cual le permite apoyar en la economía del hogar y junto al apoyo de su compañero de vida van sacando adelante a su familia. Guadalupe solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pila con baño para lo cual necesita materiales como: arena, cemento, ladrillo, hierro y grava.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 36 years old. She lives in her own home with her partner and their two children. Guadalupe makes a living by selling cow's milk, which she has done for the past 4 years. This allows her to help with household finances so that she and her husband can continue to move their family forward.

Guadalupe requests this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a sink and a bathroom, for which she needs materials like sand, cement, bricks, iron, and gravel.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, iron, and gravel to build a sink and bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and purchase educational materials for her oldest daughter

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria, solicita más capital para comprar insumos agrícolas, con los que eliminara la maleza del terreno y dará un buen trato a los cultivos de granos básicos, en esta ocasión el área de siembra es mayor.
La utilización de créditos le ha ayudado a mejorar la calidad de su cosecha, a pesar del mal invierno logro abastecer a su familia y a los clientes con granos básicos, las ganancias no fueron las esperadas pero ha cancelado su deuda y tiene la esperanza que la nueva siembra tenga resultados más positivos.
texts.en:
Victoria is requesting more capital to purchase agricultural supplies. With them, she will eliminate weeds in the field and provide good care for the crops of basic grains.  On this occasion, the planting area is larger.

Using loans has helped her to improve the quality of her harvest; and in spite of the bad winter, she was able to provide her family and her customers with basic grains.  

The earnings were not what she had hoped they would be, but she has paid off her debt, and she hopes that the new planting will have more positive results.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies with which she will eliminate weeds in the field, and provide good care for the crops of basic grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase coarse grase, clay, firewood, etc. to begin this season's production.

loans.name: Kulsaira

texts.ru: Кулсайра, 56 лет, замужем, 3 детей. Кулсайра вместе с супругом работает в библиотеке, также они вместе занимаются животноводством и выращиванием сельхозкультур, стартовав в 2010 году с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кулсайры в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы и 15 овец, также есть земельный надел мерою 2,00 ГА, где Кулсайра со своей семьей выращивают ячмень и сено. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Кулсайра вложит в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и покупку легковой машины для сына.
texts.en: Kulsaira is 56, married, and has three children. She and her spouse work at the library and also raise livestock and plant crops together. They started farming in 2010 with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to their hard work, Kulsaira currently has two cows and 15 sheep, along with a 2.0 hectare plot of land where they grow barley and hay. In order to expand her business, she applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy sheep to fatten and sell. She will use her profits to continue expanding her business and to buy a car for her son.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Marco Julio

texts.es:
Marco es un padre de familia que siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos, trabaja como chofer desde hace mucho tiempo en su ciudad natal, Nazca.
Es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, su mayor sueño es poder ver a su hijo convertido en un gran profesional y por eso se esfuerza cada día para sacarlo adelante.
Marco está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá pagar la matrícula de la Universidad de su hijo para que de esta manera siga con sus estudios sin ningún inconveniente. Más adelante espera cumplir su sueño de poder ver a su hijo como un exitoso empresario y poder mejorar también su vivienda para comodidad de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Marco is a father who always worries about the well-being of his family. He has worked as a driver for many years in his hometown, Nazca. He is a very responsible and hardworking person. His greatest dream is to see his son become a great professional, so he works hard every day to move him forward.

Marco is grateful to Kiva lenders because, with their support, he will be able to pay university matriculation fees for his son, so that he can continue with his studies without any inconvenience.

In the future, he hopes to see his son become a successful businessman and he would also like to improve his home for his family's comfort.

loans.use: to pay university matriculation fees for his son.

loans.name: Rositas De Villandrani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSITAS DE VILLANDRANI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Noime es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de chamarras, venta de comida, producción de leche.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Noime es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, al trabajar en un taller como operaria, posteriormente con un poco de ahorros decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra máquina de coser) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
Rositas de Villandrani Communal Bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members governed by a board of directors of which Noime is the president.  The bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including sewing jackets, food sales, and milk production.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Noime.  She said it's the first time she has been a member of Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a loan officer who went to her home.  Currently she has a tailoring business.  She said she learned the business several years ago while working as an operator in a shop.  Later she decided to set up an independent business with a bit of savings.

Noime's loan is to increase her capital with the purchase of a sewing machine from vendors in the city of La Paz.  Later she'll set it up in her work space.  This form of work allows her to earn income to support her family, because she lives in a common-law relationship and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the training the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu has operated a kiosk business for some time now, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her main challenge. The previous loan helped her a lot in boosting her business. She is really grateful. Saumu carries one of her children on her back in the photo.  

With the Ksh 10,000 she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her kiosk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a university course.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 40 years old. She is from Dulag, Leyte. She is married with three children aged eight, fourteen, and eighteen. Nelia's husband is a carpenter. With the thought of helping her husband earn a living, Nelia is also engaged in catching crabs, raising hogs, fishing and food vending. 

Nelia is asking for a loan to improve her businesses. She will use her loan to buy fishing nets, bamboo, a boat and to pay for piggery repairs. Nelia is hopeful that with a loan, her business will be maximized to earn a better income.

In the future, she hopes to have other business options to make her family's life better.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, bamboo, a boat and to pay for piggery repairs

loans.name: Erkaim

texts.ru: Эркаим 56 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Эркаим - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, благодаря упорному труду Эркаим, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 2 теленка и 35 овец. Также Эркаим занимается торговлей продуктами питания и товарами широкого потребления в собственном торговом павильоне. Ежемесячный доход Эркаим составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). Супруг и все дети активно помогают по хозяйству. Накопленные средства семья старается вкладывать в развитие и расширение бизнеса. Эркаим обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку телят, часть средств, а именно 25,000 сом (KGS) будет потрачена на увеличение товарооборота в магазине. Доходы от кредита Эркаим планирует направлять в дальнейшее развитие как сельскохозяйственной, так и торговой деятельности.
texts.en: Erkaim is 56 years old, married and raising 3 children together with her husband. Erkaim has a secondary-specialized education and, to provide the primary income for her family, is involved in animal husbandry. Thanks to Erkaim's hard work, today her business contains 2 cows, 2 calves and 35 sheep. Erkaim is also involved in selling food products and commodity-type goods at her own retail pavilion. Erkaim's monthly income amounts to 9,000 som (KGS). Her husband and all of the children actively help with the household. The family tries to invest their savings into developing and expanding their business. Erkaim requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy calves and spend some of the money, 25,000 som (KGS) precisely, on increasing the goods turnover at the store. Erkaim plans to apply the earnings from the loan to further developing her agricultural and retail businesses.

loans.use: to purchase additional calves and commodities for resale at her store

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 42 years old, married, and has 5 five children, 4 of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Cecilia has a buy-and-sell rug business in the Philippines. She has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional rugs to sell.

Cecilia has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more rugs to sell.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio tiene 44 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. Antonio trabaja como agricultor desde hace mucho tiempo. Cultiva principalmente maíz y maicillo y una parte lo pone a la venta y la otra lo deja para consumo. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para reparar el techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado.
texts.en: Antonio, 44, lives with his wife and four children in a house that they own.  He has operated a farming business for many years, growing maize and maicillo.  He sells part of his crop and keeps the rest for his family.  Antonio is applying for a FUSAI loan that he will use to buy the materials he needs--laminated metal sheeting and wood--to repair his crumbling roof.

loans.use: to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Nelisa

texts.en:
Nelisa is a 43-year-old, married woman from the community of Dulag, Leyte. Nelisa and her husband find their livelihood in fishing in order to provide for their family. Their children, ages 9 to 19, motivate them to work hard. 

Nelisa is asking for a loan to buy nylon and fishing hooks necessary for their fishing activity. She is confident that, with the additional capital, she can concentrate on being productive. 

In the future, she hopes that she can be successful in sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy nylon and fishing hooks.

loans.name: Fathona

texts.ru: Фатхона родилась в 1994 году. Она живет и учится в столице Таджикистана. Фатхона не замужем и живет с родителями. Она в 2012 году успешно окончила среднюю школу и поступила в Российско-Таджикский Славянский Университет. Она изучает Международное Отношение. Фатхона является студентом 3 курса.  Она часто посещает библиотеку и читает современную литературу. Она интересуется искусством и периодически ходит в разные выставки. Она обратилась в ИМОН за займом. Ее родители не имеют денег, чтобы оплатить за ее учебный договор. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1200 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Fathona was born in 1994. She lives and studies in the capital of Tajikistan. Fathona is not married and lives with her parents. She successfully completed a secondary school in 2012 and was accepted to the Russian-Tajik Slavonic University. She studies International Relations. Fathona is a third-year student. She frequently visits a library and reads contemporary literature. She is interested in art and periodically goes to various exhibits. She came to IMON to request a loan. Her parents do not have money to pay for her university tuition. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1200 US dollars to pay for her tuition. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition fees and purchase educational materials for her son

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un joven emprendedor, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, actualmente se desempeña como obrero de campo en su ciudad natal, Imperial. Es una persona que siempre piensa en el bienestar de su familia antes que en él mismo, es por ello que día a día lucha para poder mejorar la vida de los suyos. En sus tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte como una manera de liberar su mente. Su sueño es poder comprarse un terreno para poder sembrar cultivos y así iniciar su pequeño negocio.
Juan está muya agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá arreglar y hacer el mantenimiento de una motocicleta que tiene, así él podrá movilizarse de su trabajo a su casa y ahorrar sus pasajes. Con esto estará ahorrando para en poco tiempo comprarse ese terreno que tanto quiere y emprender su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan is a young entrepreneur who is eager to move forward.  Currently, he works as a farm laborer in his native city of Imperial.  He is a person who always thinks about the well-being of his family before thinking of himself, and that is why every day, he fights to improve the lives of his loved ones.

In his free time he likes to play sports, as a way of freeing his mind.  His dream is to be able to purchase a plot of land in order to be able to plant crops, and thus start his small business. 

Juan is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support that they have given him, he will be able to repair and maintain a motorcycle that he has. This way, he will be able to get from work to his house, and save the fares.

With this he will be saving, so that he will soon be able to purchase that plot of land that he wants so much, and start his business.

loans.use: to repair and maintain a motorcycle that he has.

loans.name: Yesu Nti Group

texts.en: The Yesu Nti group is made up of seven people who live in the same neighborhood. They sell groceries, second hand clothing, frozen food, bread and wigs. The featured borrower of this group is named Emelia. She is 28 and single. She did not go to school. Emelia has been selling wigs for 6 years in her neighborhood, which enables her to provide for herself satisfactorily. She buys the wigs from wholesalers and sells them to her customers. Hoping to improve service to her customers, Emelia and the other members of the Yesu Nti group are requesting their seventh loan from ID-Ghana. This is the seventh time that this group has requested financial help from ID-Ghana in order to raise the standard of their activities. The previous loans were correctly repaid and as usual they will hold each other responsible for repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy wigs from wholesalers and sell them to her customers.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is married and has two children both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, Ann has owned a food stall business selling to neighbours and town dwellers. 

With the KES 50,000 Ann wants to purchase a stock of goods such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in this business

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition fees and purchase educational materials for her youngest son

loans.name: Leilar Gay

texts.en:
Leilar Gay is a 31-year-old woman from Dulag, Leyte, in the Philippines. She has a 5-year-old child. 

Leilar Gay engages in selling frozen goods like ham, hot dogs, and chorizo (pork and meat sausages). She started her business 2 years ago. Aside from selling frozen goods, she also engages in rice retailing. 

Leilar Gay is requesting a loan to buy various frozen goods such as ham, chicken, hot dogs, and additional sacks of rice. This will help Leilar Gay increase her daily income, and thus provide her child with a proper diet and better living conditions.

In the future, Leilar Gay hopes to expand her business and increase profitability so that she can afford her child’s education.

loans.use: to buy various frozen goods like ham, chicken, hot dogs, as well as rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his children's college costs.

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургул 24 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 маленьких детей. У Нургул высшее образование, работу в селе найти очень тяжело, однако надо содержать семью и воспитывать детей. Поэтому уже 3года, Нургул занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 1 корова, 30 овец, 2 лошади, заготовлено 90 тюков сена. Ежемесячный доход Нургул составляет всего 15,000 - 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нургул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Нургул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Nurgul is 24 years old, married and raising 2 small children together with her husband. Nurgul has a higher education, but it is very hard to find a job in the village; however, it is necessary to support the family and raise the children. This is why Nurgul has been involved in agriculture for already 3 years. Today her business contains 1 cow, 30 sheep, 2 horses, and 90 prepared bales of hay. Nurgul's monthly income amounts to only 15,000-20,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Nurgul requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy sheep in order to increase the livestock headcount. Nurgul plans to invest the earnings from the loan to further increasing her livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy sheep in order to increase the livestock headcount

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for his work as a mechanic.

loans.name: Muong Phang 6 Group

texts.en:
Dinh, 28, and a member of Muong Phang 6 Group, is a Thai lady who lives in an old Thai traditional house with her parents-in-law, her husband, and her two children. Her parents-in-law are at an advanced age while her two children are too small -- her son is only at grade three and her daughter is at grade one. Thus, Dinh and her husband are the ones who mainly generate income for the family. 

They primarily work at agricultural production, such as cultivating rice, vegetables, raising chickens, pigs, and fish. Furthermore, Dinh's husband works for local construction employers. 

To better cover their living expenses, Dinh has stepped up the business by raising more fish. For that reason, she continues to apply for the second loan with Entrepreneurs du Monde - Anh Chi Em and will use the loan to buy small fish. She said that she was really interested in the training sessions provided by the program and, hopefully, the training would make her business go well. 

Dinh dreams that her family will be more abundant in life and her children will study well, then have good jobs. 

In the picture, Dinh wears the white shirt and stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy small fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира, 44 года, разведена, есть взрослая дочь. У Замиры среднее образование, она с 1992 года в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, стартовав с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Замиры, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 5 коров, 3 теленка, 20 овец. На участке мерою 0,50 ГА она выращивает кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Для животных заготовлены сено и корма, на лето отгоняют скот на пастбище. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Замира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, также хочет накопить средства на строительство дома, для этого она уже приобрела земельный участок.
texts.en:
Zamira is 44 years old, divorced, and the mother of an adult daughter. Zamira has received secondary education. Since 1992, Zamira has been raising livestock as an additional source of income for her family, having launched her business with 5,000 KGS. Thanks to Zamira’s hard work, her farm now includes five cows, three calves and 20 sheep. On her 0.5 ha [1.2 acres] land plot she grows corn for own needs. She has stocked up on hay and feed for her livestock;  during summer, the animals are brought out to pasture. Zamira’s monthly revenue is approximately 20,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, Zamira has turned to the Bai Tushum & Partners microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy calves. She plans to invest the resulting revenue in an additional expansion of her business. She would also like to save up for building a house, for which she has already purchased a land plot.
.

loans.use: to purchase additional calves for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy clothing suitable for the time of year to sell in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inputs to fertilize his cocoa crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Estela Estrella

texts.es:
Estela es una joven muy luchadora y soñadora, trabaja como vendedora de zapatos en su ciudad natal, Pueblo Nuevo. Es una hija ejemplar, en sus tiempos libres apoya a su mamá en los quehaceres del hogar y la ayuda también a preparar riquísimos postres que son disfrutados por toda su familia. Actualmente está preparándose para la universidad porque más adelante quiere convertirse en una excelente empresaria y poder sacar adelante a su familia.
Estela está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá cubrir sus gastos de preparación para la Universidad y así pueda cumplir su sueño y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Estela is a hardworking young woman with big dreams for the future. She sells shoes in her home town, Pueblo Nuevo. As an exemplary daughter, in her free time she helps her mother with household chores as well as the tasty desserts she makes which are enjoyed by the whole family. Currently Estela is making preparations to start university because in the future she wants to become an excellent businesswoman so she can help her family make progress.

She is very grateful to Kiva lenders because it is with their support that she will be able to cover the costs of preparatory university courses. Then she will be able to fulfill her dream and improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: Pay for preparatory university courses

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto es una persona que desde muy joven viene trabajando para sacar adelante a su familia, es muy responsable, honrado y trabajador y vive en San Martin junto a su familia. Desde que era un adolescente viene dedicándose al cultivo de cacao, primero apoyaba a sus padres y poco a poco ahorró su dinero para poder comprarse sus propios terrenos y así ser independiente. Ahora que tiene su propia familia es con el fruto de su trabajo, mucha dedicación y cuidado que hoy está sacando adelante a su familia.
Alberto en esta oportunidad quiere comprar insumos para abonamiento de sus cultivos y precisamente va a utilizar el préstamo para comprar abono. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, con ello su producción mejorará y así él mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia. Más adelante espera comprar más terrenos para ampliar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Alberto is a person who has been working since he was young in order to get his family ahead. He is responsible, honorable and hard-working. He lives in San Martin with his family. He has been growing cocoa since he was an adolescent. At first he helped his parents and little by little he saved enough money to be able to buy his own land and become independent.

Now that he has his own family it is from the fruits of his labor, much dedication and care that today he is getting ahead with his family. At this time Alberto wants to buy inputs to fertilize his crops and he will use the loan to buy manure. He is very grateful to the lenders at Kiva for their generosity. With the loan his production will increase and he can improve the quality of living for his family. Later he hopes to buy more land to expand his planting.

loans.use: to buy manure for his cocoa crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to build a water storage tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing for her grandson.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the tuition fees and educational equipment for her oldest son.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar es un joven emprendedor, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es soltero y vive en San Vicente junto a su familia. Debido a algunas situaciones económicas y a la necesidad de trabajar no pudo estudiar una profesión, por ello trabaja como personal de limpieza en el hospital. Es una persona muy honrada y trabajadora, con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres en los gastos del hogar porque quiere que vivan cómodamente y sin necesidades.
Cesar está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un juego de muebles para amoblar su casa, con esto su familia se sentirá más cómoda y él continuará luchando por el bienestar de su familia, para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Cesar is a young entrepreneur with a lot of desire to get ahead. He is single and lives in San Vicente with his family. Due to his economic circumstances and the need to work he couldn't study a profession. He works on the cleaning staff at a hospital. He is an honest and hard-working person and with the fruit of his labors he helps his parents with the household expenses as he wants them to live comfortably with their needs fulfilled.

Cesar is grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to the support they have provided him, he can buy a set of furniture to furnish his house. Doing this the family will feel more comfortable and he will be able to continue struggling for the well-being of his family and improve the quality of living of his loved ones.

loans.use: to buy a set of furniture for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cab for his taxi business.

loans.name: Ramona Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña ramona cuenta con varios años de experiencia en el oficio de comerciante. Ha logrado salir adelante con esfuerzo propio y con la ayuda del primer financiamiento que le brindo la institucion el cual lo utilizo para comprar diversos productos y así mantener su inventario. Doña Ramona solicita el segundo crédito para comprar un freezer grande el cual le servirá para guardar refrescos, gaseosas, pollo y productos lácteos. Este le beneficiara ya que podrá cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. Su meta próxima es obtener otro crédito para mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio.
texts.en: Sra. Ramona has several years of experience as a businesswoman. Through her own efforts and with help from her first loan, she has managed to get ahead. With the loan money she bought various products and kept up her inventory. Now Ramona is seeking a second loan to buy a big freezer in which she can keep drinks, soda, chicken, and dairy products. This purchase would be a great benefit as she would be able to satisfy the requests of her customers. Her next goal will be to improve her business premises.

loans.use: Buy a big freezer

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani lives in Goris town in the Syuniq region. She now lives with her husband and one-year-old child. 

Ani keeps livestock of cows, calves, sheep, and hens, as well as three colonies of bees. She sells the gathered agricultural products to the workers of the milk factories and butcher next to her house. She loves the farming business and takes care of the farm with love and pleasure. 

Ani is a master in her work and plans to improve her livestock, so she is asking for a loan of USD 3,000 in order to buy three more cows.

loans.use: to buy three more cows.

loans.name: Sumana

texts.en:
Sumana has completed a PUC (pre-university course) and then attended Khadi & Village Industry Board (KVIB) training in tailoring. At present, she runs a home-based business producing and promoting eco-friendly cloth bags through organic outlets, replacing the use of polythene covers.

She is married and has son, pursuing his first year B.E. (Mechanical Engineering). They are residing in a rented house.

Sumana is requesting a loan from Kiva for production and marketing of eco-friendly cloth bags. With the loan, she will buy raw materials to make the bags. This loan will help her to increase her monthly income.

In the future, she desires to include a greater range of eco-friendly clothing materials (cotton, jute). As the production increases, she would like to involve more women in this process.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make eco-friendly cloth bags.

loans.name: Imee

texts.en:
Imee is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has two children, ages nine and six years respectively. Imee operates a sari-sari (convenience store) where she sells basic household goods like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, seasoning, toiletries and rice. Her husband works as an electrician. 

Imee is asking for a loan to buy various supplies like beverages, canned goods and seasonings. With these goods Imee could generate a higher income, and thus more easily provide her children with proper diets and good living conditions. 

Imee hopes that with additional capital, she can continue to improve the profitability of her business.

loans.use: to buy various supplies like beverages, canned goods and seasonings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an agricultural tractor for the family farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain the cocoa fields and fertilize the plants.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is a 49-year-old resident of Dulag, Leyte. He operates a sari-sari (variety store) where he sell basic household goods like canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, seasoning, toiletries and rice. He started his business quite a few years ago. 

Edgar is asking for a loan to buy various items like soft drinks, canned goods, beverages and toiletries. Edgar hopes that with the additional capital, he can continue to improve the profitability of his business.

loans.use: to buy various items like soft drinks, canned goods, beverages and toiletries

loans.name: Sayedghani

texts.en:
Sayedghani has completed his graduation in archaeology from Mysore University, but due to some family commitments, he ended his career and started farming. He is well known for his paramount contribution to the society. 

Sayedghani is residing with his wife, two daughters and a son in Malavalli village in his ancestral house. He has two younger brothers who are working in private companies in Mysore. 

His farm is well known for 'mango diversity'; it conserves more than 120 mango varieties planted during the Tipu sultan era by his grandfather 'Mohammad'. Karnataka agriculture department senior officials have visited his farm and recommended to the central government to declare it as a biodiversity hot spot, but this has been denied due to some unknown reasons.
 
Sayedghani has a deep understanding and dedicated interests about the nitty-gritty of traditional folk rice varieties conservation, which he has learnt from his father. At present, he is conserving more than 800 traditional rice varieties collected across the nation and a few exotic traditional rice varieties. 

Sayedghani has received the Plant Genome Savoir Award, the Krishi Pandit Award, and also state-level recognition for his tireless efforts towards conservation and promotion of traditional rice varieties. 

Sayedghani is requesting a loan of INR 50,000 to improve his farmland.

loans.use: to improve his farmland.

loans.name: Jayadevaiah

texts.en:
Quality organic vegetable seeds are a challenge in today's context. By involving farmers with traditional agricultural wisdom, this activity will support and encourage neighboring farmers. Sahaja Samrudha NGO is working in this way; it has been helping so many farmers. 

Jayadevaiah is also one of the farmers from Sahaja Samrudha NGO. He is an organic farmer. He has been in this profession for the past 16 years and owns 3.5 acres of land planted with fruit trees (jack-fruit, mango, tamarind, sapota, guava) and biodiverse food crops and spices varieties. His wife plays a major role in helping in all farm activities. His two unmarried sons are employed with a private company and also take part in farming activities. 

The borrower resides in his own house, which has an asbestos roof. He has the resources necessary to carry out sustainable agriculture with a vermin-compost pit, two desi cows, and an agriculture setup and bio-gas unit.

Now, Jayadevaiah is seeking a loan from Kiva to establish a vegetable seed production farm. This will help him to grow more and to become a role model for other farmers in his locality. 

With the additional income, he hopes to start marketing vegetable seeds, organic fruits and bio-inputs, and water management technology.

loans.use: to establish a vegetable seed production farm.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Forty-five-year-old Nerissa is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. She is married with two grown children. Her husband works as a carpenter and a fisherman. Nerissa helps by operating a sari-sari (variety) store and raising hogs. 

She is asking for a loan to buy sugar, salt, coffee, canned goods, noodles, eggs, milk, piglets and feed. Nerissa hopes that with additional capital, she can replenish her stock on time and make the most out of her business.  

Her income will be for food, savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, coffee, canned goods, noodles, eggs, milk, piglets and feed.

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio is 55 years old, and is a farmer living at Alcala with his family. 

He raises his family through his income in his farming business. He plants and harvests rice to sell with the help of his family and laborers he pays. 

Last harvest season, he achieved low production so he is now asking additional capital to use in ensuring good growth for his crops. He is asking for 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides used in farming. 

Arsenio will continue improving his farming practices.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides used in farming.

loans.name: Buena

texts.en:
Buena is a 36-year-old married man from Dulag, Leyte. For the last four years, he has been engaged in gathering tuba (coconut wine) for a living. The province of Leyte is known for producing the best coconut wine in the country, and the demand for it is quite high from different places. Coconut wine or tuba has different uses. People can drink it like a liquor, or ferment it to produce vinegar. 

Buena is asking for a loan to buy plastic containers to be used to stock more coconut wine. Once these are available, he can also buy more coconut wine from other coconut farmers and have it properly stored. 

His income will be used to buy healthy meals for him and his wife and for reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy plastic containers to store the coconut wine he sells

loans.name: Winners Group

texts.en:
These members are part of Winners Group, and they are beginning their first loan cycle with ID Ghana. The group is made up of seven members. The members’ businesses include groundnuts, cooking pots, general goods, frozen foods, magazine, cosmetics and groceries. This loan will help their small businesses, including Francis'. This is his first loan from ID Ghana, having joined at a friend’s invitation. 

Francis has a business selling assorted magazines and newspapers, and says that he started this business with a little bit of capital on his parents’ recommendation. He will use the money from this loan as working capital to buy more assorted magazines and newspapers in quantity from the news agencies at wholesale price and then sell to customers. This work will allow him to generate income with which to support his family. He is married and has two children. When asked what he likes abut ID Ghana, he says that he likes the health care that the institution provides. The group will need a total amount of GHS 3,000 to better their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more assorted magazines and newspapers in quantity from the news agencies at wholesale price and sell to customers.

loans.name: Avdyl

texts.en:
Avdyl is 35 years old and married. He comes from and lives in a Roma community in Kosovo. Like most of the people living in this community, he and his family live in poor conditions and a substandard living environment. His wife stays home and takes care of the children and house, while Avdyl earns a living by selling plastic bags. He works long hours, from early morning until late night every day and collects these bags through the area with his tractor and he sells them to a factory for recycling. 

For the first time, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase materials and plastic bags to sell. He hopes in the future to be able continue collecting bags, but expand his area to all of Kosovo, so he can increase his income and profit. He very much would like to provide his children a better education and is thankful to the lenders for their support and help.

loans.use: To purchase materials and plastic bags to sell

loans.name: Nhóm 05.mặt Bằng 08.nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to resell.

Hiền is 34 years old, and she is married with three children. Hiền is the group leader of the Nhóm 05.Mặt Bằng 08.Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa Province, with three dependents.

In 2013, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hiền has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hiền has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is 31 years old and married. Together with her spouse, she has been blessed with one child. She sells and supplies gas cylinders and has been in this business for 10 years.

She will be using this loan to increase her stock of gas cylinders for resale. She will also refill some of the empty gas cylinders. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to grow her business and also to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy more stock of gas cylinders.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka operates a food kiosk business, selling foodstuffs like maize flour, rice, and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She really appreciates the previous loan which improved her business and consequently her living standards.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is married and has six school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a business of buying and selling goats, selling at the market to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Rujeko Group

texts.en:
Sheila is a 34 year old lady of the Rujeko group, which is made up off three hard working women. She resides in Budiriro 1 in Harare, Zimbabwe. She has been part of the group as a secretary for more than six month now. Sheila is married and her husband is a self-employed electrician who operates in their community. She has two children and both of them are school going.

She operates from a flea market at Makomva shopping centre where she sells small items like gloves, mirrors, shoe polish and clothes. For her, business was slow because she had little capital to purchase attractive items. So with her first loan from Thrive she was able to restock better quantities.  Her business grew such that she was able to help her husband to pay for their residential stand upon which they will build a stand.

Sheila hopes to one day run a bigger and more attractive flea market stall so that she can meaningfully contribute towards bettering her family’s standards of living. With the kiva loan she will be able to achieve this.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and other products for her business

loans.name: Sparrow Group

texts.en:
Tatenda is a 21 year year old zealous young lady who is in the Sparrow group. She is orphaned and stays at her late parents' house in Kuwadzana, a small suburb of Harare. She has been in the cross border business for four years now, she travels to South Africa and buys new clothes that she resells in Zimbabwe. She operates her business from home. Since she did not have the opportunity to continue with her education when her parents passed away, she has been trying to run her cross border business.

Tatenda has her hopes and dreams for the future. She wishes to raise enough money so she can go to college. She also wishes to one day open a clothing shop in the Central Business District of Harare. The Kiva loan will help Tatenda to boost her business and expand it. Hence her dreams for a brighter tomorrow will be fulfilled.

loans.use: to expand her clothing business so that she can go to college.

loans.name: Tinosvika Group

texts.en:
Eniah is a married mother of four; three of whom are still school going. Her husband is a carpenter and her main business activity is selling timber since 2009. 

She sells to carpenters making furniture in Harare South, a busy area for furniture business. She was trained at Thrive in March 2014 and got a loan and stocked timber from Nyanga and Chimanimani forests. Her daily sales are averaged USD 115 on normal days and can go up to USD 255 on good days. She has managed to advance the standard of life for her family, her business has enabled her to pay school fees, buy household assets (fridge). Her business is growing and now stocking timber worth USD 1500 on average per month. 

A loan to Eniah and her group will enable her to grow her business ensuring the days of hunger remain a thing of the past for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy more wood for sale to carpenters and furniture makers

loans.name: 23 Minh Thọ Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Châu operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more equipment for fishing.

Châu is 51 years old, and she is married with four children. Châu is the group leader of the 23 Minh Thọ Minh Lộc solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

In 2009, Châu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Châu has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

Châu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Châu hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for fishing

loans.name: Nhóm 01Đông Bắc-Quảng Vinh-Quảng Xương Group

texts.en:
Lênh has raised poultry and pigs for 7 years. She requests a loan to purchase  poultry  to raise and sell in future.

Lênh is a 55-year-old married woman with 1 child.  She is the leader of a 4-member group, the Nhóm 01Đông Bắc-Quảng Vinh-Quảng Xương solidarity group. 

This is Lênh first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  The main hardship that Lênh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Lênh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase poultry  to raise and sell.

loans.name: Luan

texts.en:
Luan is a father of five children at age 30. Three of his children are already attending school. In order to earn a living, he has been involved in agriculture for some time and owns a cow and a calf. His animals provide milk for him to use for his family and to sell in the neighborhood and markets. 

His stable is very old and needs to be renovated so that the animals have better shelter and an area to live in. His goal is to be able to add more cows to his farm, which he knows will enable him to add more income for his family. 

This loan will help him a lot to improve his living conditions and provide a better future for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his stable so that the animals have better shelter and an area to live in.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 26 years old, married, and together with her spouse, has been blessed with one child. She does farming, and the business has been profitable. 

She will use this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting on her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and improve the living standards of her family.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to expand her farming and be successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 - Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
An is a 40-year-old  married woman with 2 children who lives  in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has had a retail business selling incense and ghost money for 6 years. She requests a loan to purchase more incense and ghost money to resell.

An is the group leader of the nhóm 01 - Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of 5 members.   She joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business and has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that An faces in her business is the lack of capital.

 An hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more incense and ghost money to resell.

loans.name: 020404170003 Hải Sơn _  Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Hiền is 31 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Hiền has been a fisherman for 8 years and requests a loan to purchase a fishing net.

She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 020404170003 Hải Sơn _  Hoằng TRường   solidarity group.   Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hiền has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital.

Hiền hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net.

loans.name: 06 Ninh Phú Đa Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xinh works in agriculture raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Xinh is 60 years old and she is married with 4 children. Xinh is the group leader of the 06 Ninh Phú Đa Lộc solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

In 2013, Xinh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Xinh has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Xinh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Xinh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Xinh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 12-Tân Sơn 2-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Thủy is 55 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents

Thủy  has raised pigs for 10 years and requests a loan to purchase pigs  to raise and sell in future.


Thủy is the group leader of the Nhóm 12-Tân Sơn 2-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. This is Thủy first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Thủy hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase  pigs.

loans.name: Nhóm 03-Nam Ngạn 1-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Chính is 54 years old and she is single with 2 children.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Chính has had a manufacturing business to make bread for 10 years. She requests a loan to purchase more flour to make bread and sell.

Chính is the group leader of the Nhóm 03-Nam Ngạn 1-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 5 members.   Chính joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Chính has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  The main hardship that Chính faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Chính hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase  flour to make bread.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 36 years old, married, and together with her spouse, has been blessed with two children. She sells clothes and has been in this business for two years. 

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of clothes, such as blouses and skirts, to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to build rental houses.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to expand her business and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 09-Thôn 01-Quảng Nhân-Quảng Xương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vệ works in agriculture raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Vệ is 38 years old and she is married with 2 children. Vệ is the group leader of the Nhóm 09-Thôn 01-Quảng Nhân-Quảng Xương solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

In 2011, Vệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Vệ has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Vệ  has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Vệ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 02.mặt Bằng 08.nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thu has a service business tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine to do tailoring.

Thu is 48 years old and she is married with 2 children. Thu is the group leader of the Nhóm 02.Mặt Bằng 08.Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thu has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thu hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to do tailoring

loans.name: Mamani

texts.en:
Mamani is a 30-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter) at North Altagram, in Dhupguri, in the district of Jalpaiguri , West Bengal. She is married to Jakir, a farmer by profession. 

Mamani’s husband has been involved in agriculture for many years. He cultivates varieties of crops and sells them in the market. Nowadays, his current income is quite insufficient for the growing expenses of his family, and so he decided to start paddy cultivation. Paddy being the staple food of the local people, the crop is in great demand.

So, Mamani is asking for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to help her husband to purchase necessary agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, etc. Her future plans are to continue growing and working hard to provide a better life for her family. 

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for cultivation of paddy.

loans.name: Nhóm 15 Thôn 9 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Tình works in agriculture raising poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Tình is 38 years old and she is married with 3 children. Tình is the group leader of the Nhóm 15 thôn 9 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of 9 members. Tình supports 3 dependents with her business in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tình first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Tình has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tình faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tình hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap, 42, lives with family members in a rural village of the Battambang province. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are still in school and one is too young. To tackle her family’s hardship, she grows rice for her main source of income. Moreover, her husband is a motor taxi driver to supplement the family’s income.

This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. Sopheap will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed to support her rice farm. She hopes this loan will enable her to expand her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to support her rice farm.

loans.name: One By One Women Group

texts.en:
Rose is a first-time borrower of Ugafode Microfinance Ltd (MDI) applying for a loan through the group. She is a single mother with three children, all of whom go to school. She is a resident of Wakiso town council and she deals in selling matooke in the Wakiso market. 

The purpose of the loan is to pay tuition for her kids and also buy necessities for them. She is honest and hardworking. She has been able to pay school fees for her children in boarding schools and also provide all the basic needs for them.

Her dream is to see that her kids graduate and have a bright future. She is so grateful for the support that has been given to her as a single mother.

The sixth person in the photo (in the middle at second left) is the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her children

loans.name: Natijamo

texts.ru:
Натичамо добрая, вежливая и честная женщина из городка Хуросон. Ей 53 года. Начитамо замужем и имеет дочку. Она проживает на районе Вахш. Натичамо столько времени зарабатывала своим честным трудом. Она берет заказы на шитье национальной женской одежды. 
    Ее дочь скоро выходит замуж и Натичамо необходимо купить дочери приданное. Из-за того что она не смогла собрать достаточную сумму денег, Натичамо просит кредит. Средства займа пойдут на проведения свадьбы и покупки приданное для дочки.
texts.en:
Natijamo is a kind, well-mannered and honest woman from the city of Khuroson in the Vakhsh region. She is 53 and married with one daughter. She has earned a living with her honest labour for a long time. She takes orders for sewing women's clothing in the national style.

Natijamo's daughter is getting married and Natijamo needs to buy her daughter a trousseau. Since she doesn't have enough money, she is requesting a loan. The loan amount will go toward the costs of the wedding and the trousseau.

loans.use: to buy a trousseau for her daughter and pay for the wedding

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is 34 years old and married, and she and her spouse have been blessed with 3 children. She is a livestock farmer and has been in this business for 10 years.
 
Jeniffer will be using this loan to buy a Friesian calf and to purchase medicine from a veterinary shop to deworm her livestock. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is Jeniffer's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to expand her farming and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy calf and to purchase medicine to treat her livestock

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 20 years old and has a three-year-old son. Stephen fights every day so that his son can get ahead. Stephen is from a family of peasants and, thanks to his father, learned about all sorts of country work from a young age. Stephen currently has maize and bean crops as well as two dairy cows. He sells his milk to his neighbors and sells his harvest at the local market. Stephen is a humble and hard-working man. In spite of the obstacles that he meets, he is always willing to try to get ahead. Stephen is applying for his loan to buy a dairy cow. With another cow he can increase production and therefore his sales income. Through his work, Stephen wants to continue fighting for his dream of expanding his milk business. This will allow him to earn a higher income for his family and to give his son the opportunity to have a better education and improve his well-being.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Edson Paul

texts.es:
Edson es una persona muy trabajadora, es soltero y vive en Irazola junto a su familia. Desde hace algún tiempo trabaja como Obrero en una empresa de su ciudad, tiene un excelente desempeño en el trabajo porque nunca ha temido al trabajo duro, con esto ha podido apoyar a su familia en los gastos del hogar. En sus tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte y cuando está preocupado le gusta pasear por Pucallpa, de esta manera se relaja y regresa con más energía para cumplir sus metas.
Edson quiere arreglar su casa, ya que actualmente el techo está construido a base de algunas calaminas y las palmeras de coco. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar materiales como cemento, ladrillos, arena para empezar a techar su casa y así pueda vivir más seguro. Más adelante espera comprarse un terreno para cultivar Palma aceitera y así convertirse en un próspero empresario.
texts.en:
Edson is a very hardworking person. He is single, and he lives with his family in Irazola.

He has been a workman in a company in his city for some time now. His work performance is excellent because he has never been afraid of hard work, and with this, he has been able to support his family with the household expenses. 

In his free time he likes to play sports; and when he feels worried, he likes to go to Pucallpa. In this way, he relaxes and returns with more energy for fulfilling his goals.

Edson wants to repair his house, as the roof is currently constructed from some corrugated sheeting and coco palms.  

He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support that they have given him, he will be able to purchase materials such as cement, nails, and sand, in order to begin building a roof for his house. In this way, he will be able to live more securely.

Later on, he hopes to purchase a plot of land in order to cultivate oil palms, and thus become a prosperous businessman.

loans.use: to purchase cement and nails in order to build a roof for his house.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a farmer in the town of Makueni, where she grows crops to sell. She has been in the farming business for 10 years now. She is 58 years old and married, and she and her spouse have been blessed with 6 children who are now grown up.

She will use this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

This is her fifth loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and she paid her previous loans successfully. In the future, she hopes to have a prosperous business and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 34 years old, married, and has been blessed with six children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past the three years, she has operated a vegetable kiosk business, selling green vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes. She sells primarily to local neighbours. Agnes dreams of expanding and establishing a shop in the future.

Agnes decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase sacks of cabbages, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cabbages, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes

loans.name: Njira

texts.en:
Njira is a married woman and has been blessed with five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Njira operates a retail shop, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business. 

Njira is requesting KES 30,000 to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat oil to sell in her kiosk. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Mangane

texts.fr:
Né en 1984 à Ségou, Monsieur Mangane est marié et réside dans une famille traditionnelle avec ses frères et autres parents à Heremakono Nord, un des  quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Mangane n’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser dans les études, IL s’est initié à cette activité d’achat et de vente  de radios, cassettes et chaussures, de lunettes, etc il y a environ 10 ans. Son activité est menée à la gare routière de Bougouni avec une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales et surtout de routiers. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses articles. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après 2  prêts qui ont été correctement remboursé, il sollicite son troisième crédit pour acheter auprès des grossistes,  20 postes de radios, 3 cartons de cassettes, 4 douzaines de paires de chaussures et 3 douzaines de lunettes. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in Ségou in 1984, Mr. Mangane is married and lives in a traditional family with his brothers and other relatives in Heremakono Nord, a neighborhood in the city of Bougouni (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali).

Not having had the opportunity to advance in his studies, Mangane started a business purchasing and selling radios, cassette tapes, shoes, glasses, etc. about 10 years ago. His business is carried out at the bus station in Bougouni with a group of customers from all social classes, mainly bus drivers. He is highly sought after by his customers for the quality of his wares.

With the hope of better satisfying his growing customer base, Mangane decided to join microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After two loans that have been properly repaid, he is seeking a third loan to purchase 20 radio sets, three boxes of cassette tapes, four dozen pairs of shoes and three dozen pairs of glasses from wholesalers.

With this loan, Mangane expects to see a monthly profit of 80,000 CFA francs, which will be used to contribute to the family expenses, to pay the interest on his loan, and the rest will be invested in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods.

loans.name: Samoun's Group

texts.en: A villager in Banteay Meanchey province, Samoun is 28 years old. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are in school and two are too young. Nowadays, she earns income to support her family via vegetable selling and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. For Samoun, this is her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan.  As a leader of a group of two members, she will spend her loan portion to buy vegetable seeds and fertilizer. She hopes that she can run one more business to earn extra income.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds and fertilizer.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Winners 2 Group

texts.en:
These members form a group called Winners 2. They are on their first loan cycle with ID Ghana. The group has seven members. They sell sandals, foodstuffs, napkins, linings and groceries.

The featured borrower is Eric, who is 27 years old and single and has no child. This loan benefits the small group of  micro-entrepreneurs where Eric is a member. He says that this is the first time he has joined ID Ghana. He joined through an invitation from a cousin who is a member of the institution.

Currently, Eric has a business selling fresh sandals and ladies' heels. He buys sandals and ladies' heels from the main market at wholesale prices and sells them to his customers. He says that the business started with a little capital he had and that it still will need financial support. That is why he has come to ID Ghana, so that he can grow the business.

The group will need a total amount of GHS 3,100 to grow their businesses, and they will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy sandals and ladies' heels from the main market at wholesale prices and sell them to his customers.

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en: Kea, 39 years old, lives in Battambang province and is a mother of two children who are too young for school. She struggles for a living via rice cropping on three hectares of land. She earns about 36,100 KHR per day to support her family. This is the first time for Kea with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader of a group consisting of two members, she will spend her entire portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds and pay for labor fees to support her farmland. She hopes that she can update her lifestyle so it is better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds and pay labor fees

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en: Mon, a local resident from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, is 39 years old. She is a mother of three dependent children, two of whom are in school. To support her living, she grows rice as her main source of the income and works as a school teacher to earn more income. This is the fourth loan for Mon with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. She is a leader of a group of two members and she will take her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds and pay the plowing fees to support her current business.
