She hopes that her rice farm gets a better yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds and pay plowing fees

loans.name: Ye's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area in Kampong Cham province, Ye is 37 years old and a married mother of four children. To tackle her family’s hardships, she grows cassava as a single source of income and grows rice to supplement her income. This is her fourth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her part loans. In her group of four members, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to support her cassava and rice farm. She hopes that she can improve her living conditions so they are better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to support her cassava and rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Por's Group

texts.en: Por, 34, lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of two children who are in school. She earns income to improve her family conditions via growing cassava and planting rice to earn more income. This is the fourth loan for Por with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. Now, in her group of three, she is the leader. For Por, she will take her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for both her farms. She hopes that she can update her lifestyle and her children can study to a high level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Kim Oun's Group

texts.en: Kim Oun is 56 years old and married with 10 children, one of whom is dependent on her.  She is living in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She grows cassava and rice, which are the main sources of her income. She has been involved with farming for 30 years. This is the fourth micro loan for her with VisionFund. She is leading her group to request a new loan. As a group leader, she will use her portion to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to get more crops from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha, 30, lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. She is married and has four children. For the last 10 years, Chantha has been farming rice and growing various kinds of vegetables. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day. 

Chantha has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles already and she completely repaid the loans. She has used the past loan wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to seek a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to have more crops from her rice farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Joselyng Scarleth

texts.es: Joselyng tiene 26 años de edad, llego a aprobar hasta el 5to. año de secundaria no pudo continuar sus estudios porque no cuenta con suficientes recursos económicos, su esposo labora como guarda de seguridad y ella atiende la pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, el sueño de Joselyng es que su hija aproveche sus estudios y sea profesional así como también desea que su mama deje de trabajar fuera del país para que venga a trabajar junto a ella, Joselyng solicita este apoyo de crédito para continuar adelante con el negocio y seguir generando ingresos.
texts.en:
Joselyng is 26 years old. She made it to the 5th year of secondary studies but could not continue her schooling for lack of financial resources. Her husband works as a security guard and she looks after the small grocery located in the house where they live. 

Joselyng’s dream is for her daughter to benefit from a good education and have a professional job, and also that her mother can stop working outside the country and come home to work with her. 

Joselyng is requesting this loan to continue growing her business and generating income.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, cereals, candy, cakes, meat, eggs, and similar items.

loans.name: Chhin's Group

texts.en:
Chhin lives in a rural village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 39 years old and married with four children. To support her family, she and her husband have been working as bicycle repairers and sometimes she earns additional income by working as a paid worker. The current business earns her about 46,000 KHR per day to make a living and afford to save 20,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

This is Chhin’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy spare parts for supporting her repair business. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her repair business.

loans.name: Seda's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Seda is 29 years old and married with two children. For more than 10 years, she and her husband have been farming rice as their primary source of the family’s income to make a living and sometimes they work as construction workers. They can earn about KHR 36,000 per day and manage to save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs. 

Seda has been a member of VisionFund for five cycles already and she wisely and successfully used the loan to make her living conditions better. She is now leading her group to seek another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland and increase her rice farming production to make more rice to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Ly is 61 years old and married. She has six dependent children, one of whom is still in school. The primary source of her family’s income is from rice farming. To better support the family, her husband sometimes works for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 33 years, she can earn about 66,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 40,000 KHR each day after expenses.
 
Ly has been a member of VisionFund for five cycles already. She wisely and successfully used the past loans to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve her financial burden. Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Ly wants to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more healthy rice to increase her family’s income to improve her living conditions and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosa tiene 30 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 3 años y 8 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que para ganarse la vida se dedica a la venta de deliciosos tamales de carne. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como logra sacar adelante a su familia. Rosa desea seguir mejorando las condiciones de su vivienda para lo cual ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir  en la compra de cemento, arena, grava, etc. para repellar las paredes de la cocina y para encementar el piso de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is thirty years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and their two children, who are 3 and 8 years old. 

She is a very resourceful woman who makes and sells delicious meat tamales to earn a living. She has been selling her tamales in the street for a long time, and in this way helps her family get ahead. 

Rosa wants to continue improving her house, which is why she decided to ask for this FUSAI loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, etc., to whitewash the walls in her kitchen and put a cement floor in the house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, etc, to whitewash her kitchen and put a cement floor in her house.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Pha, 36, lives with her husband and two children in a rural village in Dambae, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has two dependent children. She has struggled to feed and care her children by farming rice and catching fish. Together, they can earn about 23,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 15,000 KHR each day for the future.
 
Pha has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Pha wisely and successfully used the loan from VisionFund to relieve her family’s financial burden and buy some basic household necessities for the family. As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for another loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for labor. She hopes to grow healthy rice and raise more crops to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: María Celina

texts.es:
María de 26 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora estudio hasta 1° grado ya que sus padres no podían darle más estudio a ella y sus hermanos debido a los pocos ingresos económicos con los que contaban.

María es madre soltera de una hija de 15 meses de edad, el padre de su hija la abandono cuando supo que estaba embarazada.  En su casa ella vive junto a su madre, su hija y sus 4 hermanos.

Ella se dedica a trabajar como doméstica y también trabaja junto a su familia en la agricultura, cultivan 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 3,500 de frijol, el trabajo es familiar decidieron dedicarse a este rubro,  ya que así no compraran los granos básicos para su hogar, el trabajo lo tiene a 15 minutos de su casa a pie,  el terreno donde cultivan es bastante escabroso y tienen que trasladar los fertilizantes en la espalda hasta el lugar donde serán aplicados de esta misma manera es al momento de recolectar el grano obtenido; el horario de trabajo está entre 6:00 a.m  y 12:00 del mediodía ya que por la tarde tiene que ayudar a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar. 

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar electrodomésticos para el hogar y también comprar el abono para darle la segunda abonada a los cultivos que tienen como familia, ya que sus cultivos están casi en el tiempo justo para la aplicación.

Ella desea poder comprar un terreno y construir su casa,  ya que desea darle a su hija una casa propia, desea también darle el estudio que le fue negado a ella cuando era una niña, ella siente que con la ayuda que se le está brindando podrá realizar todos sus proyectos en un corto tiempo desea  pagar este primer crédito y poder sacar otro más grande y comenzar a comprar el terreno que desea.
texts.en:
María, who is 26 years old, is a hardworking and enterprising woman who went to school through the first grade because her parents could not offer her and her siblings more education due to their limited financial resources.  

María is the single mother of a 15-month-old daughter; her daughter's father abandoned her when he found out she was pregnant.  She lives at home with her mother, her daughter, and her four siblings.  

She works as a housekeeper and she also works alongside her family in farming; they have planted 7,000 square meters of corn and 3,500 of beans.  They do the work as a family; they all decided to work in this profession because this way they won't have to buy staple grains for their household.  Her work is 15 minutes on foot from her house; the land where they plant is pretty steep and they have to transport their fertilizers on their backs to wherever they need to be applied and the same goes for when they harvest their grains.  Her work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. to 12:00 noon, as in the afternoon she has to help her mother with the household chores.  

The loan she is requesting from CREDICAMPO to buy appliances for her home and also to buy fertilizer to fertilize the family crops a second time, as it is just about time to apply it.  

She wants to be able to buy some land and build a home, as she wants to give her daughter her own home; she also wants to provide her with an education, which she was not able to get as a child.  She feels that with the help that is being offered to her she will be able to complete all of her projects in a short amount of time; she wants to repay this first loan and be able to take out another larger on to start to buy the land she wants.

loans.use: to buy appliances for her home and also to buy fertilizer to fertilize her crops a second time.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADEYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments et de l’habillement.
Les femmes du groupe BADEYA sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente DJENEBA, deuxième personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter 2 sacs d’oignon, du poisson fumé, du sel, du grain d’arachide et des cartons de cube Maggi sur place chez les grossistes. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
Badeya Group is made up of married women who, on average, are 40 years old and have six children. They all live in traditional families in the town of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region in the Republic of Mali).

These women know one another through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties. They are in food services, the sale of vegetables and spices, and the sale of clothing. The women of the Badeya Group are on their sixth group loan.

With the goal of meeting enormous customer demand, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso.

Djeneba, the client who is the second person standing from right to left, is illiterate. She is currently selling vegetables and spices. She plans to purchase two sacks of onions, smoked fish, salt, and peanuts, and boxes of Maggi [a brand of bouillon] cubes from the wholesalers.

[She sells her products] at home and in the market for cash and credit to a mixed group of customers. Djeneba expects to see a monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ana de 39 años de edad, estudio bachillerato y está acompañada,  Han procreado en esta relación 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando.

Ana es empleada en una empresa eléctrica desde hace 20 años, este trabajo lo aprendió sola ya que cuando salió de estudiar se dedicó a buscar trabajo para ayudarles a sus padres pero fue ahí donde conoció al esposo y decidieron acompañarse.

El trabajo le queda a una distancia de 30 minutos y viaja en bus hasta la oficina luego sale a las comunidades hacer lectura de contadores y a la entrega de recibos de energía eléctrica, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes de las 8 am a las 4 pm 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar maya para hacer una cerca y ayudarle al hijo en un proyecto que en el instituto están realizando, que consiste en hacer cultivos invierneños.  Ella comprara la maya y otro grupo compraran los cultivos esto le ayudara mucho ya que si preparan bien el trabajo sacaran mejor nota y así se podrá graduar sin ningún problema, para que luego él consiga un empleo y seguir estudiando en la universidad y la otra parte del crédito sera para  comprar tres sacos de abono que necesitan para regarle a la milpa que el esposo de Ana tiene.  Así no tendrán que comprar el maíz el próximo año.  

Los sueños de Ana son que sus hijos salgan muy bien en los estudios que no tengan ningún problema para graduarse y que sean unos profesionales que nunca les falte el trabajo para que puedan darle todo lo necesario  a los hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is 39 years old; she has a high school education and she is in a relationship.  They have had two children, who are in school.  

Ana has been employed at an electric company for 20 years; she learned this work on her own, as when she finished her schooling she started looking for work to help her parents, but that was where she met her partner and they decided to get together.  

Her work is 30 minutes away and she travels by bus to the office, then she goes out into communities to read meters and to turn in electricity invoices.  She works Monday through Friday from 8 am to 4 pm.   

The loan she is requesting is to buy mesh to build a fence and help her son with a project he is working on in school that consists of planting winter crops.  She will buy the mesh and another group will buy the crops; this will help her a lot, as if they prepare the work well they will get a better grade and be able to graduate without any problems, which will allow him to then get work and keep studying at university, and the other part of the loan will be to buy three sacks of fertilizer to spread on the corn fields that Ana's partner has.  This way they will not have to buy corn next year.  

Ana's dreams are for her children to do very well with their studies and not have any problems graduating and for them to become professionals who can always find work so they can provide their children with everything they will need.

loans.use: to buy mesh to build and fence and help her son with a school project he is working on and to buy three bags of fertilizer for her corn crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for some household expenses and to buy snacks for his son's birthday

loans.name: Than's Group

texts.en: Than, a local farmer from Kampong Cham province, is 45 years old and a windowed mother blessed with four children. Her main sources of income are from her rice farming and her snack selling. She can earn about 30,600 KHR per day from the businesses that she has had for ages. This is the first time for Than with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy rice seeds to support her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her family's condition so they are better than before.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Auoy's Group

texts.en: A young woman who lives in Kampong Cham province, Auoy is 21 years old and a mother of a young kid. For this family, rice farming is the sole source of income for her entire family. She has been occupied in this business for several years and earns about 27,900 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She is the group leader of her group of three members. Auoy will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds and pay plowing fees to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get a good yield and update her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds and pay plowing fees to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Min's Group

texts.en:
Min, 64, is married and living with her child in a rural village of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She earns a living through farming rice and she has been in this business for 46 years, earning about KHR 27,000 per day and is able to save about KHR 15,000 each day after expenses for her future needs. 

Min has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already and she completely repaid the past loans, which have helped her relieve her family’s financial burden and support her business. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. Min, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income from the current business to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Saret is 33 years old and a mother of two children. She is living in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province where farming is a common way to make a living. Like other villagers, she has made a living through growing cassava for five years.
 
This is the first loan cycle for her with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR. She will use this loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her cassava and use a portion of the loan to pay plowing fees. She hopes to timely grow her cassava so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her cassava, and pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Sreynet

texts.en:
A citizen in the Memot district of Kampong Cham province, Sreynet is 28 years old, and married with one child who is too young for school. She has been selling grocery items and growing cassava for ten years while her husband works as a motorbike repairer. 

She has been with VisionFund for one cycle already, and she completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her living conditions. Now she is requesting a new loan to buy grocery items to sell and use a portion of it to buy spare parts for supporting her husband’s business. She hopes to improve her standard of living and send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell and spare parts for her husband's motorcycle repair business.

loans.name: Chhoeun's Group

texts.en:
Chhoeun is a citizen living in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district's Battambang Province. She is a married mother of three children. She grows corn as the main source of income and supplements her family’s income by working as a paid worker. She has been involved with her business for twelve years. 

This is the second loan for her though VisionFund. She and her group member are applying for a loan. As a group leader, Chhoeun will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and corn seed and pay for plowing fees for her farmland. She hopes to expand her farmland so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and corn seed and pay for plowing fees for her farmland.

loans.name: Sreyhuoy

texts.en:
Aged 30 years old, Sreyhuoy is a married mother of one son who is too young for school. She is living in a rural village in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. Cassava farming is the main source of family’s income and her husband supplements the family’s income by working as a laborer in a local area. She has been in this business for nine years, earning about 40,000 KHR per day and managing to save 20,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

She has been with VisionFund for four cycles and successfully paid back the loan which has improved her living’s style. Now she is applying for a new loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for labor fees. She hopes that the cassava will return a better yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Norn

texts.en:
Norn is a 46-year-old married mother of two dependent children. She lives in the Memot district of Kampong Cham province. The main sources of her family’s income come from cassava and rice farming. She can earn about 50,000KHR per day but she can save about 30,000 KHR after offsetting her daily expenses. 

She is the fourth-cycle client with VisionFund. She successfully used the past loans to better support her family. Now she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 KHR. She is going to buy fertilizers and insecticides and pay for labor fees for her farming. She hopes to yield more crops from her cassava and rice farming so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides and pay for labor fees for her farming.

loans.name: Sinoern's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Sinoern is a 47-year-old mother of four children, three of whom are in school. She is a rice farmer in the local area and supplements her family’s income by growing cassava. Having been in the business for 12 years, she can make a daily income from her current business of 60,000 KHR and is able to save about 30,000 KHR per day after expenses for future needs. 

This is the fifth loan for Sinoern with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice in time to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Sapha

texts.en:
A rural villager living in the Kampong Cham province’s Memot district, Sapha is age 31 years and married with two children who are still in school. Her main businesses are buying and selling gum, and planting rubber trees for seven years. 

This is the second loan for Sapha with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The first loan, which she fully paid back, has helped her better support her business, as well as her family. She is applying for a new loan to buy more gum to sell. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more gum to sell.

loans.name: Savorn's Group

texts.en:
Savorn, 49, lives in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. He is one of the breadwinners of the family. He makes a living through farming rice. He has been engaged in this business for thirty years.

This is his third cycle loan him with VisionFund. Now, he is leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, he wants to use his portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for his farmland and also to pay for labor fees. He hopes to increase the crop yield from his farming business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for his farmland.

loans.name: Sida

texts.en:
Originally from the Memot district of Kampong Cham Province, Sida is 50 years old and she is the mother of six children, four of whom are depending on her. She grows rubber trees and cassava as the main source of family’s income while her husband works as a policeman to earn additional income. Sida has been engaged in her business for twenty years. 

She is a first-time client with VisionFund and she is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR. She will use this loan to pay for labor fees. She hopes to grow more crops so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to pay labor fees.

loans.name: Peum's Group

texts.en:
A villager who lives in Kampong Cham province’s Memot district, Peum is aged 29 and she is a married mother with two daughters whom are still in school. The main sources of her family’s income are cassava and rice farming. The current business earns her about 45,000 KHR per day. 

She has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She has used the previous loans wisely to improve her standard of living. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes that to produce crops from her agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia Celia pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE, la socia continua con su negocio  de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia vende su mercadería como golosinas, arroz entre otros a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, golosinas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of the Communal Bank “Velasco Astete”. She continues to manage her grocery business. Celia is a responsible and diligent individual. She sells merchandise such as snack foods, rice, and other products to all of her customers who request them. Working in this manner enables her family to get ahead.

Celia is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, snack foods, and other products. She is grateful for the loan that has been issued and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy rice, snack foods, and other products.

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
Sarom is 41 years old and a widow. She is living in the Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng Province, where she grows rice to make a living. To add more income, she also weaves scarves. She earns 30,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for her with VisionFund. She is now leading her group of two to apply for a loan. Sarom, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers, rice seed, and to pay for plowing fees for her farmland. She hopes to earn more with crops from her farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, rice seed, and to pay for plowing fees for her farmland.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey is 35 years old and she has three children. She is living in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She works as a rice farmer to support her living. Having been in this business for seventeen years, she can earn about KHR 30,000 per day to support her family’s needs. 

This is the second loan for Srey with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As a group leader, she wants to use her loan portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to pay for plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгуль успешно погасила предыдущий кредит, использовала его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем инвесторам, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Назгуль есть 1 лошадь, 1 корова и 5 овец, на земельной доле Назгуль выращивает картофель и зерновые культуры. Ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назгуль обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков. Доходы от кредита она будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса, также Назгуль хочет накопить средства на покупку жилья для сына.
texts.en: Nazgul successfully repaid her previous loan after using it for its intended purpose. She is grateful to all of the Kiva investors who helped her with financing. Nazgul currently has a horse, a cow, and five sheep and a share of land where she plants potatoes and grains. She earns 12,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue expanding her business, Nazgul applied for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) with the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy two young bulls. She will use her profits to continue investing in her business and to save money to buy a house for her son.

loans.use: to purchase two young bulls for fattening and resale

loans.name: Salout's Group

texts.en:
Salout, aged 47 years old, is the father of four children, one of whom is still in school. He is residing in a rural area of Battambang province, Cambodia. He grows rice and vegetables to make a living. To add more income, he also works as a paid worker. 

Salout has been involved with his business for ten years. He has been with VisionFund for seven cycle, and the past loans have improved his living conditions. He is leading a group of two to apply for a new loan. He will use his loan portion to buy fertilizers, rice seed for his farmland. He hopes that this loan will enable him to get more income from his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seed for his farmland.

loans.name: Chein's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Chein is 35 years old and married. She has two children to take care of. To make a living, she has been in farming for five years and her husband works as a motor taxi driver to add more income. 

This is a new loan for her group with VisionFund. Now she and her female group member are applying for a loan. She is the group leader, and she will use the loan portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her rice paddy.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Moung Russey district, Srey is 44 years old and married. She has four children; three are dependents. She is a farmer who has grown rice and cassava to make a living for two years. 

Srey is a third-cycle client with VisionFund; she has successfully used the past loans to better support her family. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to have more yield from her farming business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Boeurn's Group

texts.en:
Boeurn, 27 years old, is a farmer in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, and she is a mother of one child who is in school. To improve her family’s condition, she grows rice as her main source and works for others for a fee to earn more income. She has been involved in the current business for ages, and she earns about 37,200 KHR per day. 

This is Boeurn’s her fourth cycle with VisionFund, and she has fully repaid her past loans. Now, she is a leader of a group of two members, and she will use this loan to buy seeds, pesticides and to pay plowing fees. She hopes that she can get a better yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides and to pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Nhor's Group

texts.en:
Nhor is a 52-year-old, married woman residing in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district, which is located in Cambodia’s Kampong Cham province. She has five children, two of whom are dependent. To earn a living, she has worked as a rice farmer for 34 years. Nowadays, a lower price of rice products is the main challenge for her income.

She is leading a loan group consisting of four female members, all who are second-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). From the first loan, her livelihood has improved. She will use her loan portion to buy rice seed, and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to have a better living.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, and fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en:
Vanny, a mother of one child, is a resident from Battambang province and is in her early 20s. She struggles for a living via the selling of grocery items and quail. For Vanny, this is her second cycle with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. 

Now, in a group of three, Vanny is the leader. She will take this loan portion to buy more quail to sell and she hopes that she can earn more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more quail to sell.

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Kampong Cham province, Yat is a mother of two dependent children; one is too young for schooling and one is in school. To tackle her family’s hardships, she grows rice as a single source of income, which generates her a decent income. 

This is second cycle for Yat with VisionFund, (Kiva’s partner). For this cycle, she teams up for a group of two to get a new loan. Yat, the group leader, will spend her entire loan portion to buy more farmland and to pay plowing fees. She hopes that she can earn more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more farmland and to pay plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en: Sophy, a local resident of Battambang province, is 39 years old and single. To support herself she earns income by selling junk items and is also employed by others. This is Sophy's fourth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); she has fully repaid back her past loan. As a leader of a group of two, she will use this loan to buy more junk items to resell. She hopes she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more junk items to resell.

loans.name: Burul

texts.ru: Бурул 55 лет, замужем, многодетная мать 5 детей. У Бурул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Бурул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется скот - 5 лошадей и 20 овец. Также есть 3,20 ГА собственной и 3,00 ГА арендованной земли, где Бурул с супругом выращивают картофель, зерновые культуры и эспарцет. Также у Бурул есть сезонный доход, она покупает у местного населения картофель и прочие овощи. Всю закупленную, экологически чистую продукцию Бурул реализует на центральных рынках страны, у нее уже наработаны постоянные покупатели, для транспортировки есть собственная грузовая автомашина. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 20,000 сом (KGS). Бурул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 6 тонн отборного картофеля для дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Бурул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, Бурул хочет накопить средства на свадьбу младшего сына.
texts.en: Burul is 55, married, and the mother of 5 children. She has a secondary education and earns a living for her family by farming. Thanks to her hard work she currently has livestock: five horses and 20 sheep. She also has her own 3.20 hectare plot of land and a rented 3 hectare plot where she and her spouse grow potatoes, grains, and sainfoin. Burul also has a seasonal income from buying potatoes and other vegetables from local farmers. All of the organic vegetables she buys are sold at the country's central market, where she has regular customers who have trucks to transport the goods. She earns 20,000 som (KGS) per month. Burul applied for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) with the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy six tons of select potatoes for resale. She plans to use her profits to continue investing in her business and to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase six tons of organic potatoes for resale

loans.name: Nhóm 01.mặt Bằng 08.nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huyền has a retail business, selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry food to sell.

Huyền is 52 years old and she is married, with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 01.Mặt Bằng 08.Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of seven members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Huyền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Huyền has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in her business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Huyền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huyền hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more dry food to sell.

loans.name: Khon's Group

texts.en: Khon, 60, is an old woman from Kandal province and a mother of five children. She struggles to earn a living via rice cropping. To earn more income, she catches fish to sell. This is Khon’s sixth cycle with VisionFund, (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loans completely. She is a leader of a group of two and she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a boat and catching-net. She hopes that she can renovate her house to update her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a boat and catching-net.

loans.name: Nhóm 11.tiền Phong.nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hồng has a manufacturing business making fermetter/cured pork. She is requesting a loan to purchase more meat and leaves to make cured pork to sell.

Hồng is 32 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 11.Tiền Phong.Nam Nạn Solidarity Group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

In 2013, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hồng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hồng faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profits, Hồng hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and leaves to make cured pork to sell.

loans.name: Koeurn's Group

texts.en:
A farmer who lives in Kampong Cham province, Koeurn is 34 years old and a mother of three children. Two of her children are in school and one is too young. To tackle her family’s hardship, she grows cassava as a main source of income and she also grows rice to supplement her income. She has been involved in the main business for ages and it earns her about 32,900 KHR per day. This is the fourth loan cycle for Koeurn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. 

As a group of two, she is a leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay plowing fees. Koeurn hopes that she can improve her family's condition better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Nhóm 20 Thôn 5 - Quảng Nhân Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huấn works in agriculture, raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Huấn is 50 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 20 Thôn 5 - Quảng Nhân Solidarity Group, which consists of three members. 

In 2010, Huấn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Huấn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Huấn faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profits, Huấn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell  in the future.

loans.name: 01 Đông Hải Đa Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Diệu works in agriculture raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future. Diệu is 53 years old and she is married with four children. She is the group leader of the 01 Đông Hải Đa Lộc Solidarity Group, which consists of four members. 

In 2013, Diệu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Diệu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profits, Diệu hopes to build a new house, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Savina

texts.es:
Savina es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, desde hace más de 15 años se dedica al cultivo de cacao, así como también maíz, arroz y plátano ya que las tierras en su ciudad son excelentes para dichas plantas. Desde muy temprano se va a trabajar porque quiere ofrecer productos de calidad a sus clientes, en sus tiempos libres le gusta recostarse fuera de su casa en una silla que tiene y admirar la naturaleza. Es una persona muy honesta, alegre y amable.
Savina está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar abono para sus plantas, de esta manera su producción mejorará así como sus ingresos. Con estos ingresos ella podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y más adelante comprar más terrenos para ampliar su producción.
texts.en: Savina is a very hard-working and enterprising woman. She has been growing cocoa for more than fifteen years, as well as corn, rice, and bananas. The soil where she lives is excellent for those types of plants. She starts work very early in the morning because she wants to provide quality goods to her customers. In her free time, she likes to sit outside her house in a chair and admire the nature. She is a very honest, cheerful, and kind person. Savina is grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their support, she will be able to buy fertilizer for her plants. As a consequence, her yield will improve, as will her income. With this extra income, she will be able to improve her family's quality of life and buy more land in the future to increase production.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her cocoa plants

loans.name: Sinoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Sinoeurn, 39, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She has two children, one of whom remains in school and one who is too young. 

To support her family, Sinoeurn grows cassava as her main source of income. Moreover, she grows rice to earn extra income for her family. She earns about 31,900 KHR per day. 

For Sinoeurn, this is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. Now, she leads the group of two to get a new loan. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay for the plowing fee. She hopes that she can get a good yield and expand her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay for the plowing fee.

loans.name: Saren's Group

texts.en:
Saren, a local farmer from Battambang province, is 32 years old and a married mother blessed with a little kid. She secures the basic needs in her family via vegetables selling and grocery items selling. 

This is not the original loan for Saren with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan, and now her living condition is getting better than before. 

Now in a group of two, she is the leader. Saren will spend her entire loan portion to buy cabbages and fertilizer. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family’s condition.

loans.use: to buy cabbages and fertilizer.

loans.name: Thon's Group

texts.en: Residing from Kampong Cham province, Thon is 35 years old. She struggles for a living via rice cropping and battery charging. To earn more income, she works for others for a fee. For Thon, this is her second cycles with VisionFund, (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loan completely. As a group of five, she is a group leader. Thon will spend her entire loan portion to buy an electric dynamo to support her business. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family’s condition.

loans.use: to buy an electric dynamo to support her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Mon is a 49-year-old married mother of six children. Four of her children are dependants and still in school. Her main source of income is from rice farming, which she has been doing for thirty years, and she also works as a paid worker.

Mon has been with VisionFund for eight cycles. The past loans have helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes to increase the yields from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha, aged in her early 40s, is a mother of three children. Her residential area is Kampong Cham province where her cassava is grown. Besides this plantation, she grows rice to earn more income and it has returned her about 31,300 KHR per day. 

This is not first time for Sokha with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. She is the group leader group of six members. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her family conditions better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Nasim

texts.ru: Насим с детства помогал родителям по домохозяйству. Он живет со своей семьей в отдаленном регионе. Насим 3 года назад начал свой бизнес, так как ему нужно было зарабатывать деньги и обеспечить свою семью. Он женат и имеет одного маленького ребенка, чтобы прокормить их, он упорно работает с раннего утра каждый день. Насим покупает скот, откармливает несколько месяцев и продает на местном рынке. Он в основном откармливает коров. Насиму помогает ее мама. Они живут дружно. Насим планирует увеличить количество коров, которых он откармливает. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 8000 сомони для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Nasim has been helping his parents with the household since his childhood. He lives with his family in a remote district. Nasim started his own business 3 years ago because he needed to earn money and provide for his family. He is married and has one small child, and works hard from an early morning every day in order to support his family. Nasim buys livestock, fattens it up for several months and sells it at a local market. He primarily fattens up cows. His mother helps him. They live happily. Nasim is planning to increase the quantity of cows that he fattens up. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 8000 somoni to buy livestock. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase his working capital

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Женщину на фотографии зовут Дилбар. Ей 39 лет. Она вместе с мужем и детьми проживает в одном из теплых районов Республики Таджикистана под названием Вахш. Дилбар вместе с мужем воспитывают троих детей (две дочки и сын). Дочери помогают маме в продвижение бизнеса. 
   6 лет назад Дилбар открыла маленький продуктовый магазин. Магазин не был таким большим и с большим ассортиментом продуктов как сейчас, с каждым годом Дилбар старалась развивать бизнес и сделать семью финансово устойчивым. 
  На сегодняшний день Дилбар необходимо купить и привести новый товар и расширить ассортимент продаваемого товара. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом с надеждой на то, что ей помогут осуществить задуманное.
texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Dilbar.  She is 39, and lives with her husband and children in Vakhsh, one of the warmer regions of Tajikistan.  She and her husband are raising three children in total (two daughters and a son).  Her daughters help their mother with the family business: a small grocery store opened by Dilbar 6 years ago.  The store wasn't as big and had fewer goods for sale then, but with each passing year, Dilbar did her best to grow her business and expand her offering, thereby strengthening her family's finances.

At the moment, Dilbar needs to buy and ship in a new set of goods to increase the variety of her offering.  She is seeking a loan to that end, and hopes she'll get the help she needs to bring her plans to fruition.

loans.use: buy a shipment of new wares to increase the variety of her offering

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chanta resides in a rural area located in the Koh Sotin district of the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Chantha is 44 years old and married with four children, one of whom is still in school. To earn a living, she has been growing rice while her husband is a paid construction worker to earn additional income. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day. 

This is a new loan for Chantha’s group with VisionFund. Now she and her members are applying for a loan. As a group leader, she will use the loan portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more from her rice paddy crops so as to fulfill her dream, which is to grow sesame and jicama to earn additional income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Sarem's Group

texts.en:
A resident from Battambang province, Sarem is 33 years old and the mother of three children. To support her living, she earns income via vegetable-selling and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. 

This is a first time loan for Sarem with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will take this loan portion to buy more vegetables for resale. She hopes that she can upgrade her business and improve her family conditions better than before.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Carlos Leonardo

texts.es:
El joven Carlos Leonardo es un joven que tiene 25 años de edad, realizo sus estudios de bachiller en ciencias y letras y culmino sus estudios universitarios en la Universidad Autónoma de Honduras titulándose como medico Odontólogo. El joven esta solicitando ayuda financiera para continuar sus estudio y realizar su especialización en el área de endodoncia y a la vez adquirir el equipo y materiales especializados que este estudio requiere. 

Carlos se considera una persona ordenada, puntual, amigable y responsable con las personas que se relaciona, su pasión es poder ayudar a las demás personas, considera que la mejor forma de hacerlo es brindando asistencia médica para cada persona, considera que el ser médico odontólogo, conlleva a una acción humanitaria sobre todo a poner sus dones  al servicio de los demás.
Su motivación inicial es poder superarse en el campo profesional, reforzando así los conocimientos adquiridos a lo largo de una carrera de muchos esfuerzos y enseñanzas personales y profesionales.

El joven nos compartió una anécdota en la que muchas veces el nerviosismo nos hace mostrar una actitud alegre y con sentido del humor; recuerda haber atendido a un paciente que realizaba su visita al dentista por primera vez, en la que esta persona se sentía indispuesta a iniciar el procedimiento medico debido al temor de que este pudiera causar dolor, Carlos recuerda haber actuado de una manera segura y a la vez mostrando su sentido del humor con el paciente para que este sintiera confianza y lograra tranquilizarse.

Carlos desea contribuir al desarrollo de su país, mediante una atención especializada obteniendo su propio complejo dental; así poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y a las demás personas de su ciudad.

Agradece a aquellos que integran la de de la Fundación KIVA y que creen en jóvenes como nosotros y les apoyan decididamente para continuar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Carlos Leonardo is a young man of 25 years of age who took his degree in Sciences and Arts and finished his university education at the Autonomous University of Honduras graduating as a Dentist. He is asking for financial assistance to continue his studies and specialise in endodontics, and to acquire the specialist equipment and supplies that these studies require.

Carlos considers himself organised, punctual, friendly and responsible in his dealing with other people. His passion is to be able to help people, and believes the best way of doing that is to offer medical help for everyone.  He believes being a dentist brings with it a humanitarian obligation, especially that of using his skills to serve others.

His primary motivation is to be able to grow professionally, thus reinforcing the knowledge he has acquired by way of great effort in his studies and personal and professional learning.

He shared with us a story which shows nervousness can often make us respond with a cheerful attitude and sense of humour; he remembered having attended to a patient who was visiting the dentist for the first time. The person felt unable to start the treatment for fear of the pain this may cause. Carlos remembers being reassuring and also sharing his sense of humour with the patient so that the patient had confidence in him and managed to remain calm.

Carlos wishes to contribute to the development of his country, through specialist help with his own dental complex, and thus offer a better quality of life to his family and to the other people of his city.

He is grateful to those members of KIVA, that they believe in young people like him and that they support them to continue their studies.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his specialisation in endodontics (dentistry).

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз родилась в 1979 году. Она добрая и трудолюбивая женщина, которая всегда старается улучшить условию проживания. Она живет с мужем и 3 детьми.  Дилафруз занимается скотоводством в течение последних 3 лет. Она данное время в обороте имеет 2 голов коров. Она продает молоко местным жителям. Дилафруз также продает молочные продукты как кефир и сметану. Она продает молочные продукты на местном рынке, где она имеет постоянных покупателей. Ее покупатели довольны ее молочными продуктами. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 8000 сомони для покупки лекарства, так как она больна и врачи должны срочно оперировать ее. Она действительно ждет и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Dilafruz was born in 1979. She is a kind and hardworking woman, who always tries to improve her living conditions. She lives with her husband and 3 children. Dilafruz has been involved in animal husbandry for the past 3 years. At the present time, she has 2 cows. She sells milk to local residents. Dilafruz also sells dairy products, such as kefir and sour cream. She sells dairy products at a local market, where she has regular customers. Her customers are happy with her dairy products. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 8000 somoni to buy medicine because she is ill, and doctors have to urgently perform a surgery on her. She truly awaits and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicine for treatment

loans.name: Hoeurb

texts.en:
A woman from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Hoeurb is 50 years old and she is the mother of five children. She grows rice as her single source of income to support her family. 

This is Hoeurb's fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully repaid her past loans. She will spend her entire loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get a better yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her farmland

loans.name: Hikmatoy

texts.ru: Хикматой умная и целеустремленная девушка. Ей 20 лет. Она студентка 2 курса Медицинского колледжа. Хикматой учится успешно и получает хорошие оценки. Она в будущем мечтает стать высококвалифицированным медработником. Хикматой читает много книг и всегда старается смотреть интеллектуальные телепередачи. Хикматой живет с родителями. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 800 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Hikmatoy is an intelligent and purposeful young woman of 20 who lives with her parents, She is a second-year student in medical college. She is a successful student who receives good grades. In the future she dreams of becoming a highly qualified paramedic. She reads a lot of books and always tries to watch educational television shows. 

Hikmatoy is requesting a loan of $800 USD to pay her tuition. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to pay her medical college tuition

loans.name: Rita

texts.ru: Рита, 42 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Риты высшее образование. Она по характеру: спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес 14 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Риты в хозяйстве имеется: 2 коровы, 1 бычок, а также есть земельный надел мерою 2,00 ГА, на котором она выращивает клевер. Ее деятельность приносит около 17,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рита обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Доходы от кредита Рита планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем хочет сделать дома ремонт.
texts.en: Rita is 42 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. Rita has a higher education. She is calm, level-headed and hardworking. To provide the primary income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry for many years, starting this business 14 years ago. Thanks to Rita's hard work, her business now contains 2 cows, 1 bull and also a 2.00 hectare land plot, where she grows clover. Her business yields about 17,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to further develop her business, Rita requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 10 sheep. Rita plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business and wants to make repairs at home in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to expand her business

loans.name: Sokny's Group

texts.en:
Sokny, 31, is a local resident in Pursat province and a mother of young kid. She is a farmer who does rice cropping as the main business to support her family. 

This business earns her about 28,800 KHR per day. For Sokny, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

She leads a group of five members to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend this loan portion to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to support her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: fo buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to support her farmland.

loans.name: Chanthon's Group

texts.en: A mother of two children from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Chanthon is 25 years old. She struggles to make a living through rice cropping and working for others for a fee to earn more income. This is the fourth cycle for Chanthon with VisionFund (a Kiva partner); she fully repaid her past loans. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can gain a good yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 25-year-old single man who has been working in the mobile phone business for 12 years. In 2011, he opened his own mobile phone selling shop, which he is working hard to develop, especially through a previously acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, which he invested in increasing his business merchandise with newly released mobile phones, accessories and prepaid cards.

Today, Ali is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, and it will be his sixth loan cycle for the same reason. It has proved to be very impressive in developing his business and covering his family's needs, since he is the sole earner of his family, responsible for the living of two other members.

Ali will work hard to keep on expanding his business and will put much effort on attracting more customers' attention through offers and new technologies, as he is currently doing.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with mobile phone accessories and prepaid cards

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is married with three children, all of them go to school. She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,800,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy sugar, rice, flour, beans, cooking oil and salt. She has been in this business for almost ten years. She generates additional income from selling piped water. She works from home seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. 

Aidah's major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring of building rental houses and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, salt, cooking oil, flour and beans for her retail business

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap, 54, is a farmer living in Battambang province. She is a mother of six children, three of whom are in school. She earns a living through farming rice to support her family. Moreover, she earns extra income via working as a teacher in a local area. 

This is Sopheap's second cycle with VisionFund (a Kiva partner); she fully repaid her past loan. She is now leading her group to ask for a new loan. Sopheap, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her rice farm. She hopes that she can gain a good yield so as to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her rice farm

loans.name: Meng's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Banteay Meanchey province, Meng is 24 years old and a father of two young children. He grows rice as his main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement the family’s income. He has been involved in this business for ages and he can earn about 28,900 KHR per day.

This is the second cycle for Meng with VisionFund; he fully repaid his past loan. He now leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for his rice farm. He hopes that he can earn more income from his business so as to fulfill his dream of running a new business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his rice farm

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District
